loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Corral de Arena ubicado en el  distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Alcira se dedica  a la venta de ganado ovino y caprino; ella cría el ganado en un ambiente situado en  su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente es propietaria de  un mototaxi.

Ella desea adquirir más ganado y alimento balanceado para alimentarlos adecuadamente y ofrecerlos a un buen precio para lograr ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alcira es una madre de familia bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
29-year old Alcira is married and lives with her family in the small village of Corral de Arena in the Olmos district. It is an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Alcira raises sheep and goats near her home and then sells them. She feeds them with local grasses, and when they have reached a good size, she sells them to businessmen who frequently visit the area. 

In addition, Alcira has a motortaxi.

She wishes to obtain more livestock and nutritionally balanced food so that she can sell the animals for a good price. Then she can expand her business and earn more money. For this reason she thought it was a good time to approach Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of 1500 soles to help her reach her goal. 

Alcira is a hardworking, diligent mother admired by those who know her for her desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and animal food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cheese & cream

loans.name: Busadykan's Group

texts.en:
Busadykan A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 55 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has brought up a daughter and a son. The son went to work in Russia to make money and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family.

Busadykan herself works as a teacher in a kindergarten. In order to earn additional money, the family breeds cattle. With money received from the loan Busadykan wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future she wants to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Rocila

texts.en:
Rocila is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. All her four children go to school.

Rocila is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest to her community. Aside from rice farming, she also grows pigs that she sells to the market.

Rocila requested a loan of PHP 17000, which she will use to purchase fertilizes and pig feeds. Rocila hopes to have a stable business. She also wishes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, tiene 36 años, está felizmente casada con Edwin de 48 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, muy cómoda y bien situada a las afueras de la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana), para la actividad que desempeña y que no le permitirían realizar en el centro de la ciudad. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos Rita, junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos en un espacio amplió y cercano por donde viven, también de manera independiente ella, tiene un taller de pirotecnia donde elabora cohetecillos, y diferentes ilustraciones de animales y objetos que al encenderse produce chispas y luces de diferentes colores en las fiestas patronales que se desarrollan en esta parte de la selva central “La Merced”, por otro lado cuando su pareja no le ayuda, practica el oficio de músico que también le resulta rentable y hasta le permite ahorrar. En adelante desea  construir su casa propia en la ciudad y de esa manera instalar un restaurante, que le facilite un negocio menos peligroso, ella, lleva 15 años dedicada a estas labores y asegura que gracias a esta actividad a sus hijos nunca les faltó que comer. Pero el costo de los estudios de sus hijos es su prioridad, por ello invierte la mayor parte de sus ingresos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP y  está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Rita, con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales pirotecnicos, cohetes, papel cometa, mechas, y cordeles.
texts.en:
Rita is 36 years old and happily married to Edwin, age 48. They have five children and live in a comfortable rented house that is situated in a good location on the outskirts of the city of San Ramón in the central Peruvian jungle. Due to her business activity, she is not allowed to operate in the central part of the city. In order to provide for the welfare of their children, Rita and her husband manufacture bricks in a spacious area located near their home. In addition, she works independently at her fireworks workshop where she makes miniature rockets and outlines of different animals and objects that are ignited with sparklers and different colored lights. Rita designs these products for the patron saint festivals that are held in the part of the central jungle known as “La Merced”. When her husband is not helping her, Rita also performs as a musician to earn extra income which helps her to accumulate savings. Going forward, she wants to build her own house in the city and establish a restaurant so that she can have a business that is less dangerous. Rita has been working for fifteen years and thanks to her business activities, her children have never gone hungry. However, her children’s education is a priority so she will use a large portion of her earnings to pay for these expenses.

Rita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes) and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She is happy to continue working with the other members of her Communal Bank since they are supportive, friendly, and responsible people. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for making fireworks and rockets such as kite paper, staples, and string.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making fireworks and rockets such as kite paper, staples, and string.

loans.name: James Matheri

texts.en:
James has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 21 years.  He is 52 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and they have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his sixth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacinta Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jacinta M. is a 36-year-old single lady. She has three children aged 16, 12 and 8 years old. She has been running her milk shop and motorcycle transport business for a period of one year with an income of about 13,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET after being introduced to it by a staff member. She has joined a  group of members to consolidate resources and buy a piece of land to be used jointly. She hopes to build rental houses and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land on which to build rental houses

loans.name: Solidario Flores De Loma Alta Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO FLORES DE LOMA.
Rafaela es la líder del grupo denominado  Flores de Loma Alta ella es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante por lo que 4 veces por semana ella va a el mercado la  Terminal  donde ella atiende a sus clientes desde las 3 de la mañana,  Doña Ruth  es muy  joven  y tiene un bebe, le gusta apoyar a su esposo por lo que se dedica a la venta de flores desde ya hace varios años  Doña María le gusta superarse por lo que junto a su esposo están en el negocio de la venta de flores  de muy de madrugada, por los negocios similares  y siendo vecinas es que ellas han decidido trabajar juntas un nuevo crédito,se han superado bastante gracias al apoyo de los créditos que Fape les facilita. Ellas solicitan este credito para la compra de flores y para estos días de celebración del día de las madres, ya que es una muy buena fecha  y desde ya la inversión inicia en este negocio, para lograr aprovechar y ver mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
SOLIDARIO FLORES DE LOMA.
Rafaela is the leader of the 'Flores de Loma Alta' group.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who likes to get ahead in life.  For this reason, four times a week she goes to La Terminal Market where she serves her customers from 3 o'clock in the morning.

Ruth is very young and has a baby.  She likes to support her husband and so she has been selling flowers for several years.

María likes to get ahead and so she and her husband have a business where they sell flowers from very early each morning.

Owing to the fact that they have similar businesses and are neighbors, the ladies decided to work together to obtain a new loan.  They have made a lot of progress thanks to the support of the loans that they have received from Fape.  They are requesting this loan to buy flowers especially for the days of celebration surrounding Mothers Day since this is a very good date for them.  Through their investment in their businesses they hope to make the most of this date and improve their profits.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 25 y 20 años de edad, él tiene 11 años de trabajar en su propio taller de reparación de bicicletas, con este negocio ha logrado cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos, pues quiere fortalecer el inventario de su taller comprando pedales, asientos, forros, frenos, rayos, entre otros, que son parte de las bicicletas y que los clientes tienen la necesidad de reparar.
Las aspiraciones de Reynaldo es primeramente ver que sus hijos estén en buenas condiciones, proveer para su hogar todo lo necesario y que su negocio sea cada día más rentable.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives with his wife and two children who are 25 and 20 years of age.  He’s been working for 11 years in his own bicycle repair shop.  This business has allowed him to cover household needs.

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts because he wants to strengthen his shop’s inventory buying pedals, seats, covers, brakes and spokes, among others, which are bicycle parts that the customers need to have repaired.

Reynaldo’s goals are first to see that his children are in good state, to provide for his entire home’s needs and that his business is more profitable every day.

loans.use: to buy pedals, seats, covers, brakes and spokes.

loans.name: Gulbara's Group

texts.en:
Gulbara, 47, is the leader of this group. She is married and has five children, three of whom are high school age. Ten years ago, she spent a month of her husband's salary to open a business. Instead of purchasing land for cultivation or investing in cattle, Gulbara got involved in trading vegetables. She purchases wholesale fresh vegetables delivered from the south of the country and retails them in a local food market. She remembers the times when she had to retail the small assortment of goods for only 3,000 soms. Thanks to her persistence and optimism, she managed to develop the business and raise its level to 10,000 soms monthly. The purpose of Gulbara’s loan is to purchase more goods to broaden the assortment and attract more customers.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for trade

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en: Faraj has been selling shoes for the last 2 years. He gets additional income from his rental houses. He is married and blessed with a 2-year-old child. In the next 5 years, he wants to open up a wholesale shop. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him the art of saving. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells cooking gas containers. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh runs a general store from the doorway of her home. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toys, soaps, perfumes, incenses and confectionery.

Oanh is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of products to sell. She would also like to use part of her loan to buy more gas containers for her husband to sell and expand his customer base. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase the income of her family and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 45 years old, is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store for her livelihood. After four years of business operations, she now generates a total monthly income of PHP 2,800. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase sacks of rice and rice bran to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Teresita plans to sell more fattened swine and to widen the selling area to increase her usual earnings.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jennifer has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy blouses and underwear for sale.
Jennifer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses and underwear for sale

loans.name: Chicas Lindas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Chicas Lindas es D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, ellas son 15 mujeres, vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, que se unieron con el propósito D. generar mayores ingresos para sus hijos y familiares. Ellas son muy reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en ayuda a la comunidad. Desean un desarrollo para cada una D. ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La señora Ruth se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, el cual le produce buenos ingresos. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela, pues las mujeres D. hoy en día siempre buscan verse bien, por lo que opto por este trabajo, ya que ve mucho futuro en el. Uno D. sus sueños es poder tener una tienda, donD. no solo pueda vender los cosméticos, sino también otros artículos para damas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cosmético, lo cual le servirá para poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientas. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee named "Chicas Lindas" ("The Pretty Girls") is in the city of San Lorenzo.  They are 15 women who are friends and neighbors from this city,  who meet together with the goal of generating greater income for their children and relatives.  They are very well-known in the area for their work helping the community.  They want each one of them to develop, not only financially, but also on a personal level.

Señora Ruth works selling cosmetics, which earns her a good income.  She comments that she has a good customer base, as women today are always looking to look good.  This is why she opted for this line of work, as she saw a good future in it.  One of her dreams is to have a store where she doesn't only sell cosmetics, but also other articles for women.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of cosmetics, which will allow her to meet her customers' orders.  She is very hopeful about this loan, as getting it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Marcos De Jesús

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el señor Marco de Jesús  se dedica arduamente a laborar como albañil en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 7 años. el nucleo familiar es de 5 personal a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construccion como zinc, perlines .para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia 
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sr. Marco de Jesús works hard at his job as a mason for a company. He has been doing this type of work for seven years. His family consists of five people for whom he must provide the necessary living conditions.

One of his needs at the moment is to improve the living conditions at home because they are in such a poor state. For this reason, he made the decision to begin making improvements. Marco approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials such as corrugated sheets and crossbeams for replacing the roof. By making this improvement, he will provide better living conditions for his family.

It is important that this work be completed so that his family will have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 39, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and mother to a child who is now studying in college. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Avelina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. 

Aside from this, she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16, 000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to have her house renovated and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials that she buys in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56-year-old married man who has two children for whom he works hard to improve and secure their living conditions. Ali sells fruit and vegetables. His trade is going fine but such a business needs daily care to ensure his products are healthy and fresh.
Good quality products are what differentiates him from others.
Most of his customers are from his village and a good number of foreigners stop at his shop because of its good location on Ain's main road.
Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his stock with special seasonal fruit and vegetables at good prices and with special offers.
He plans to start wholesale trade but he needs more capital to take this step.

loans.use: To increase his stock with new season fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 36 years old, single and blessed with two children. Both of her children attend school.  Christine runs a poultry business in the busy Kitengela area, where most of her clients are female hoteliers. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of KES.4,000 per month.

Christine was introduced to KADET LTD by KADET staff.  She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET. She plans to use the entire amount to purchase more layers chicken which she will resell at a later date. She will use the anticipated profits to start a poultry farm.

Christine hopes to purchase a plot and build her own rental houses. She has vision and is hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase  chickens that lay eggs

loans.name: Victoriano Reynolds

texts.es:
Victoriano es más conocido en la zona el nombre de Reynolds, el cual es su segundo nombre, tiene 68 años y vive con su familia en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es una zona urbana y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Desde hace unos meses que Victoriano tiene como proyecto, hacer unos cambios en su hogar, pero no ha podido ya que ha tenido problemas económicos, lo cual quiere decir que se le hace muy difícil realizar su proyecto por financiamiento propio.

Es por eso que Victoriano está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de 325,000.00 (trescientos veinticinco mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción para asi mejorar su hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Victoriano es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 110 empresas socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y nos indica que este es su segundo préstamo, lo cual lo tiene muy feliz y está muy agradecido con la Empresa por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Victoriano is better known in his area by his second name, Reynolds.  He is 68 and lives with his family in a village in the Hatillo district, an urban and residential zone.  However,  it has a lot of  businesses, particularly in the commercial centers.  Located there are many furniture stores, tortilla stores, bakeries, bookstores, auto shops and auto dealers, gas stations, dentists, pharmacies, doctors’ offices, bars, restaurants, stores and printers.

Some months ago Victoriano had as a project to make some changes in his house, but he hasn’t been able to accomplish them because he has had financial problems.  That is, it is very difficult for him to do these projects with his own money.

That is the reason that Victoriano is requesting a loan of 325,000 (three hundred and twenty-five thousand colons) to buy construction materials for improving his home and giving his family a better quality of life.

Victoriano is a member of Hatillo communal bank, one of the 110 businesses that is part of EDESA in Costa Rica.  He tells us that this is his second loan and he is very happy and appreciative with the bank for the help it has offered.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Otgonjav

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonjav is 45 years old. She is a widow and she works as a teacher in a kindergarten in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has two sons and currently lives with her younger son. Her salary is generally not enough for her family expenses. Her younger son, Lkhagva-Ochir, has no job and wants to support his mother by earning an income. Thus, he has decided to start a taxi business. The loan Otgonjav is taking will be dedicated to covering the cost of buying a new car so her son can start a taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a new car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
Jose Elías, tiene 39 años de edad, casado desde hace 20 años, tienen 6 hijos de 3, 10,12,15,17 y 20 años de edad, 5 de ellos estudian, vive en una aldea de San Jose Comayagua.
Don Jose, tiene un taller de Herrería, donde elabora herramientas de trabajo para la agricultura, como ser pujaguantes,  cumas, machetes y herraduras. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a esta actividad. En el taller cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas y una persona particular como empleado. Las ventas las realiza en la comunidad de Taulabe, surte los  puestos de mercado y negocios que venden estos productos.
Este préstamo es el tercero y es para invertirlo en el negocio en compra de hierro para elaborar herramientas de trabajo de agricultura. Con los prestamos anteriores a mejorado su taller.
Su meta es hacer crecer este negocio, ampliar su mercado para que le genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose Elías is 39 years old and has been married for 20 years. He has six children (ages 3, 10, 12, 15, 17, and 20). Five of his children are in school. They live in the neighborhood of San Jose Comayagua.

Don Jose has a blacksmith shop where he makes farming tools such as shovels, sickles, machetes, and horseshoes. In his workshop, he has the help of his daughters and a hired employee. His goods are sold in the community of Taulable at market stands and at businesses that sell these type of products.

This is his third loan and the money will be invested in his business. Jose will buy iron for making farming tools. His previous loans have helped to improve his workshop. Jose’s goal is to grow his business so that he can expand his market and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy iron for making farm tools.

loans.name: Ma. Estrella

texts.en:
Ma. Estrella is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Ma. Estrella has a beauty shop that provides hair cutting, styling, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the beauty salon.

Ma. Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the beauty salon

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito tiene 43 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. El es una persona responsable y que siempre está pendiente de las necesidades de su familia. Tiene dos hijos de 8 y 11 años respectivamente, como todo padre responsable José no solamente les enseña el ganarse la vida cada día si no que también a ser personas de bien. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de vacas, toros, chivos y otros. A pesar de que no ha sido fácil salir adelante con su negocio ha logrado brindar a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: José Benito, 43, is a livestock merchant.  He’s a responsible person who is always watchful of his family’s needs.  He has two children who are 8 and 11 years old respectively.  Like all responsible fathers, José doesn’t just teach them how to earn their daily livelihood but also how to be upstanding citizens.  The reason for his loan is to buy cows, bulls, goats and others.  Despite getting ahead in his business being difficult he’s managed to provide his family with their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, goats and others.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Lilian is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes.

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Lilian to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to have children and educate them so that they can have a bright future. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lilian's future prospects by helping her to learn how to develop herself and her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a petty trader. She sells cooking utensils, shoes, and children's wear at Efutu. She has been selling cooking utensils for the past six years now. She is married to a mason and has one child. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Maame will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils, shoes, and children's wear for sale. With the new profit she plans reinvest to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils, shoes and children's wear for sale.

loans.name: Rudia

texts.en:
Rudiah is married and has three children ranging in age from three to twenty-two years. She describes herself as an optimistic woman.

Rudiah has been selling household goods such as clothes pegs, hair bands, hangers, soap, etc. for the last five years. The high cost of the items she sells is a challenge for her. She will be using a 20,000 KES loan to buy more of the same to sell.

In the next five years, Rudiah's hope and dream is to venture into running a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy more household goods such as clothes pegs, hangers, soap, salt, hair bands etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 43 years old, married and has two children. They live in Water Fall, Aurora, in Zamboanga del Sur province.

For the past six years Sherlita has woven nipa palm fronds into mats that are used as roofing materials. She earns 5,000 PHP a month doing so.

Sherlita became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing materials.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Assiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Novembre 2015 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elle.

Madame Assiatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de paniers de poissons.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 03 paniers de 25 kg de poissons et payer un transport de 10000 pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de développer son épargne et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.

loans.use: acheter 03 paniers de 25 kg de poissons et payer un transport de 10000 pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

loans.name: Ochomi

texts.en:
Ochomi N. is married with eight children.
 
He started a small business of retail shop in the village.  The business grew steadily and the stock expanded after getting a loan of $ 200 from WITEP.
 
He now wants to expand the business to meet the high demand from customers in the strategic place in village.
 
It is 15 kilometers to reach the main town of Mbale.  So people of the community refer buying essential commodities from him than going to town.
 
Given a loan of $800, he plans to expand the business to meet the stock.
 
He is man of integrity and respect who will be in position to refund the money.

loans.use: Expanding business stock

loans.name: Ayshan

texts.en:
Ayshan is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village, settled in the Fizuli region.
Ayshan is 31, single, lives on front line . She has her own drugstore. 
She has been engaged in this business for 5 years.
This young girl believes that this business helps to provide a better living for her. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought vitamins, antibiotics, medicinal preparations.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her drugstore and to buy medicinal agents: creams, shampoos, soaps, cuds, tooth-pastes, tooth-brushes.

loans.use: To expand the area of her drugstore and to buy medicines

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Mercy is a resident and sells used footwear in the market. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $825.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Miss Trinh is 35 years old. Her husband died of cancer and Miss Trinh had to pay $3700 for her husband's medical treatment, so her first son must stop going to school. Her second and third are going to school. Miss Trinh doesn’t have any land for cultivation.

Her soft drink selling is thus important to increase her income by about $3/person/month. In addition, Miss Trinh works as a laborer at the cashew nut factory in the morning. She is a hard-working woman. Her average income is about $11/person/month. She wants to earn money from her business so that she can repay the debt for her husband's medical treatment. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Tuhtaboy

texts.ru:
Tuhtaboy N. is 67, is married and has 9 children. He has a high-school education. He made hajj (pilgrimage) to Mecca, which proves that he is an honest and god-fearing tradesman and a client that respects the rules and policies of MicroInvest. He borrowed his first loan in 2007 and over a short period of time became an active and disciplined client. The loan allowed him to increase turnover of his goods. Previously he had to by goods from local suppliers and pay for them in several installments with high mark-ups. Currently he is able to pay for the goods in cash as well as loan money to people who are only starting out in this business. He is planing to purchase a store in the future.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer.

Неъматов Тухтабой –67 лет, женат, имеет 9 детей. Образование среднее. Совершил “Хадж” в Мекку, что показывает, что он является честным и богобоязным клиентом по отношению к торговле и к политике организации МЗФ «Микроинвест». Начал кредитоваться в 2007 году и за короткий период стал одним из активных и дисциплинированных клиентов и тем самым увеличил товарооборот. Раньше приобретал товар на рассрочку у местных поставщиков с большой наценкой, а в настоящее время, кроме того, что покупает товар за наличные, а также дает на рассрочку начинающим свое дело людям в этой деятельности. В будущем планирует приобрести магазин.

loans.use: to open a shop

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles is married without children. She started her business because she needed income that would enable her to improve and expand her home in order to have space for her own home business. She began five years ago, renting an area in which she offered beauty products, make-up, perfume, etc. Little by little her business has grown and she wants to continue growing and increasing her sales and clients.

María de los Ángeles is asking for a $250 loan in order to buy merchandise for her business and in order to take advantage of prices in bulk and increase the usefulness of her products. She is offering to pay back the loan in three months. She thanks you very much for your support in assisting the successful growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

María de los Ángeles esta casada y no tiene hijos, ella empezó su negocio por que necesitaba ingresos que le permitan hacer mejoras a su domicilio y ampliarlo para poder poner un área para su negocio en el mismo. Empezó hace 5 años atrás, rentando un local en donde ofrecía sus productos de belleza, maquillajes, perfumes, etc. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y desea continuar con el mismo y seguir creciendo incrementando sus ventas y clientes.

María de los Ángeles esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y poder aprovechar precios por paquetes e incrementar sus utilidades, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo para el logro del crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet E. is 45 years, married with 6 children. She sells cooked food to people living in her community. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. This is a business she has been in for the past 6 years and she is seeking a loan of US$ 400 to buy more ingredients for cooking of food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking of food

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali N. wants to offer more food for sale, and more variety, in her restaurant in order to increase her profits and improve the standard of living for herself and her four dependents.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Iyebah

texts.en:
Iyebah T. lives on the outskirts of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. Iyebah inherited the business selling palm oil from her mother, who died two years ago when Iyebah was only 20 years old. Young as she is, she is now taking care of her younger brother's education and other family expenses.

Iyebah would like to expand the business, so she is requesting a loan of $225 to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil to sell to earn more to support her younger brother.

loans.name: Nhom Co Luat - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Ms. Luật, singled, 49 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her daily income is 5USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Nam, 27 years old, is a teacher. Her husband is a tailor. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy tools for her husband.

Mrs. Thu, 37 years old, and her husband process rice grain. She also tends pigs. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Mơ, 30 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her husband is a construction worker. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Thao, 52 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her husband farms rice paddy. The daily income is 5USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Cô Luật, 49 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, không có chồng. Thu nhập hàng ngày của cô cũng từ 80000-90000đồng/ngày. Cô vay 2006000 đồng từ chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc để mua cám cho lợn. Sự thuận tiện và không phải thế chấp là điều cô thích nhất khi đến với Chương trình. Chị Nam, 27 tuổi, làm nghề dạy trẻ, chồng làm thợ may. Chị vay 2006000đồng để thêm vốn cho chồng mua máy. Thu nhập của gia đình trung bình là 100000đồng/ngày. Chị Thu, 37 tuồi, làm nghề xay xát gạo và chăn nuôi lợn, chồng phụ chị xát gạo. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình khoảng 100000đồng. Chị vay vốn của chương trình binhminh cdc (2006000đồng) để thêm vốn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi. Chị thích vay vốn ở đây vì được tham gia lâu dài. Chị Mơ, 30 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, chồng chị làm thợ xây. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình cũng được 100000đồng/ngày. Chị vay 2006000đồng để thêm vốn chăn nuôi. Chị rất thích vay vốn của chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì không phải thế chấp Cô Thạo, 52 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng làm ruộng. Thu nhập của gia đình trung bình 70000-80000 đồng/ngày. Chị thích vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs, tools

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman G. started her business in Aghdam but later had to leave and became an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She used to buy leather and order various size jackets in tailors' shops for re-sale. She lost her business after she became an IDP.

Now, some years later, she has found the strength and desire to start again. So the circle started rolling again and even better than it was years ago. Now there are big markets and it’s easy to sell.

Khuraman buys leather at the lowest price and the leather jackets that she orders in tailors' shops are very easy to sell. She needs this loan to purchase more leather that she will use over the course of one year. This will reduce her price for the leather and be a reason for greater profit.

loans.use: Purchase of leather to use in making jackets for re-sale

loans.name: Yuliana Lizet

texts.en:
Yuliana Lizet P. R. has a business selling shirts, underwear, gifts, and stuffed animals in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, in La Libertad Region.  She has 4 years of experience and many loyal customers.  She sells her goods from a stand she rents in the Victoria Market.

Yuliana is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  She loves building relationships and earning money for her family.  Yuliana looks forward to working hard everyday and saving for her family's future.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Yuliana is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to restock her most popular items.

loans.use: To restock her most popular items

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida O. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon. She is married and has 2 children. Business is good and Vida wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy modern hairdressing tools and materials which she needs to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern hairdressing tools and materials to make her work easier

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Mrs. Hen H. is a villager in Tei Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently works in a bamboo selling business, while her husband, Mr. Mi Yu, is a horse-cart driver. They have two children: one is attending a local school while the youngest is too young to work or enroll in school. Although Mrs. Hen H. and her husband have two business activities, they are only able to generate a small income that is insufficient to improve their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Hen H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorcycle-taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motorcycle-taxi business.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee is a mother of three small children whom are her love and engine that propels her to work with determination to progress as a merchant and make her business a sustainable one. Her kiosk of groceries and sweets is the only activity that she does to satisfy the needs of her children and serve as support for her husband, who is a farmer. This activity is of much help, therefore she desires to expand it and supply it with more diverse products to beat the competition since she is located in a pretty commercial zone and so she has to maintain her business at the level of the competition. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan and hopes that you will be the person that can help her see that her business prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Aidee es madre de tres pequeños niños quienes son su adoración y motor que la impulsa a trabajar con empeño para progresar como comerciante y hacer de su negocio un negocio sostenible.Es así que el puesto de abarrotes y dulces que posee es la única actividad que realiza para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus niños y sirve de apoyo a su pareja quien es agricultor. Esta actividad es de gran ayuda, por lo mismo que desea ampliar y surtir de diversos productos para superar a la competencia, ya que se encuentra en un lugar bastante comercial y para ello tiene que mantenerse al nivel de la competencia.Por ello que solicita un préstamo y espera usted sea la persona que pueda ayudarla a que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Enlarging her kiosk and purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Komi Mawuli

texts.fr: Monsieur G.  Komi Mawuli  est né en 1969, marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Très tôt, il s’est lancé dans la mise en place d’un centre de loisirs dans son village pour la retransmission des matchs importants et autres évènements très importants d’actualité internationale aux villageois. C’est grâce à ses revenus qu’il arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer. Faute de courant électrique de la compagnie nationale qui n’est pas encire parvenu dans le village, il utilise un groupe électrogène qui consomme beaucoup et tombe souvent en panne à cause de sa vieillesse. Ainsi pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître son revenu, il sollicite un financement pour acheter une moto pour son déplacement, reconstruire un nouveau local et acquérir d’autres matériels. Ceci l’aidera à mieux subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr Komi Mawuli G. was born in 1969, is married and the father of five (5) children. At an early age he began being in heavily involved in the development of a community center/complex in his village where villagers would be able to watch re-transmissions of important international events and soccer matches. It is thanks to revenues from this that he is able to contribute support for household needs. As the national eletricity company does not yet provide electricity to his village, he uses an old generator which consumes much energy and is often out of order. Thus, in order to provide better satisfaction to his customers and to increase his revenues, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation needs, to build a new center and to acquire other materials. This will help him in providing better support for his needs.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Dame G. Jeanne est née vers 1963 à Lomé au Togo, un pays voisin au Bénin. Elle est mariée à GBOHOUI Etienne avec qui elle vit au Bénin. Elle est mère de 05 enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge des deux parents. Elle vend des articles divers tels que: du sucre en poudre, des séchoirs à mains etc... C'est pour répondre à la demande de ses clients qu'elle a sollicité  son troisième  prêt. Elle habite le quartier Ladji depuis plusieurs années où elle mène ses activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeanne G. was born around 1963 in Lomé, Togo, a country neighboring Bénin. She is married to Etienne GBOHOUI with whom she lives in Bénin. She is the mother of five children, all attending school and in the care of their two parents. She sells various articles, such as: powdered sugar, hand dryers, etc. She has requested her third loan to respond to the demands of her customers. She has been living in the Ladji district where she works for several years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dryer, irons, and various other items

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro M. S. quiere hacer un cambio dentro de su casa el desea una barra en medio para dividir sala y comedor. Esto lo quiere hacer es para que se vea bonita su casa y diferente a las demás, también para que sus hijos pequeños tengan el menor riesgo de cualquier tipo de accidente. Para hacer la división de sala y comedor el necesita $150 dólares. Él es el sostén de la casa  su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus 2 hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Pedro M. S. wants to remodel his home by placing a dividing wall between the living and dining rooms. He wants to beautify his home, making it different from those belonging to others and to prevent small children from being injured. It will take $150 to divide the living and dining rooms. Pedro is the breadwinner in house; his wife spends her time caring for the home and their two small children.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home remodeling

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
De 47 años, la señora Flor vende menués por pedido desde hace 1 año y, paralelamente, cuenta en un ambiente de su casa con otro negocio: cabinas de Internet. Su trabajo es duro pero ella sabe que vale la pena, y muchísimo, porque es así que puede costear la educación de sus 3 hijos: 2 en la Universidad y 1 en el colegio (de 26, 25 y 12 años de edad), en sí, son 6 personas con las que vive en casa. Sabe que en los rubros de sus 2 negocios hay mucha y dura competencia pero ella va para adelante, no se intimida y va diseñando sus metas a punta de esfuerzo.

Es consciente que a veces no basta esto, por lo que requiere de una pequeña ayuda, es decir, necesita de 500 soles de préstamo que le servirán como aliciente a su dedicado esfuerzo para con sus hijos.
texts.en:
47 year old Flor has been selling meals to order for 1 year and, at the same time, she has another business of Internet cabins in her home. Her work is hard but she knows that it is worth it because with these jobs she can pay for her 3 children’s educations: 2 are in the University and 1 in secondary school (ages 26, 25, and 12). In total there are 6 people who live in her home. She knows that in both of her business fields there is a lot of hard competition but she is succeeding, is not intimidated, and continues designing her goals and directing her efforts. She knows that at times this is not enough, which is why she requires a little help. That is to say, she needs a loan for 500 soles which will serve as incentive to continue dedicating her efforts on behalf of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make her food and continue implementing her Internet cabins.

loans.name: Magret S.

texts.en:
This is Magret S. T.. Magret was born in Bafodia, about eighteen miles from Kabala. She is twenty-eight years old. She is married to a teacher. They have four children together. Magret sells cotton and ground-nuts. She has been in this business for six years. Magret is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000. This will be her very first loan from SMT. 

With this loan, Magret will expand her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will use the loan to buy cotton and ground-nuts. She will also use some of the loan for transportation and other expenses relating to her business. 

She buys the ground-nuts from a make-shift business center, or “luma,” called Bamoi, about 160 miles round-trip from Makeni. She buys the cotton from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, a 390 mile round trip from Makeni. A bag of ground-nuts costs her Le 180,000 at Bamoi, and a piece of cotton costs her Le 25,000 in Freetown. She estimates that she’ll be able to get a least five bags of ground-nuts and thirty-six pieces of cotton with the loan. 

Although her business is doing well for Magret on the whole, she does, face one great challenge: bad debtors. Some of her customers refuse to pay her on time; some do not repay their debts at all. This instills fear in her as a businesswoman, making it difficult for her to know who to trust and who not to trust.

With this loan she receives from SMT, Magret is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an increase in the amount of profit she makes. An increment in profit means making her life a happier one and generating additional business.

loans.use: Expand on her business by buying more cotton and ground-nuts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su pareja e hijos. Es una mujer con una gran cantidad de virtudes, una de ellas, es ser muy servicial  y atender  a sus clientes con gran amabilidad, es así que su negocio de venta de  bicicletas y repuestos es muy buena. Desde hace 3 años administra su negocio de manera adecuada, pero adicionalmente, se suman otras dos actividades; la venta de jugos y el servicio de carrocería que brinda en la cochera de su casa, la cual es muy amplia. Lo que más le agrada realizar y obtiene mayor ganancia es venta de repuestos, ya que se ubica en un lugar estratégico, ubicado en una zona muy comercial. Gloria es clienta antigua, este en su tercer préstamo con MFP, desea continuar trabajando con esta IMF, y seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas. Ella desea en un futuro tener el servicio de carrocería en un lugar mucho más amplio y tener otros negocio al costado, por invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de pinturas para bicicletas y otra parte como capital para sus otros negocios.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She is a woman of many virtues, one of which is being very service-conscious, and she takes great care of her customers. This is why her business selling and repairing bicycles is going so well. She has been running her business for three years, but she also undertakes other activities such as selling juices and doing auto body work that she provides from the garage of her house. What she most enjoys doing, and makes the greatest profit on, is the sale of spare parts since she is very strategically located in a commercial zone. Gloria has been a client for years, and is in her third loan with MFP. She wants to continue working with this IMF and making her payments on time. Her wish for the future is to have an auto body shop in a larger space and other businesses on the side as well. She will invest 1,000.00 Peruvian soles into the purchase of bicycle paints, and use the other part for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the location of her business and to purchase merchandise/supplies.

loans.name: Paula Lileth

texts.es:
Paula Lileth es dueña de una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 4 años la cual la instalo debido a que la colonia donde habita no había ninguna tienda, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, las cuales con el transcurso del tiempo le generaron ganancias y fue así como decidió vender productos como café, pan, huevos etc.,y otros  artículos que la gente consumía, ella dice que inicio con 2 libras de cada artículo.

Su negocio ha crecido debido a la buena administración y al servicio que se les brinda a las personas. La tienda es atendida por toda la familia por ella sus dos hijos  y su esposo. Ahora Paula tiene necesidad de un préstamo ya que desea abrir otra tienda y solicita a FAPE  le brinde un préstamo.
texts.en:
Paula Lileth has been the owner of a general store for the past 4 years, which she established due to the fact that the neighborhood in which she lives did not have a store. She began selling fruits and vegetables, which as time passed generated profits and that is how she decided to start selling products such as coffee, bread, eggs, etc, and other items that people consume. She says that she began with 2 pounds of each item. Her business has grown due to good administration and the service that she provides people. The store is attended to by her entire family, that is, herself, her two children, and her husband. Currently Paula needs a loan given that she hopes to open another store and asks that the FAPE provide her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a neighborhood general store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph H. is married and has five dependents. He has received schooling through junior high school. Joseph sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market, which he has done since 1996. His wife is a trader. Joseph uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Joseph will use his loan to increase his stock of used clothing. With the profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to save towards a house he wants to build for his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of used clothing

loans.name: Paulina Fortunata

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Paulina es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Paulina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Paulina vende comida los días sábados y domingos en el estadio de su comunidad.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y aceite.
Los sueños de Paulina son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Orcasitas Community Bank. She lives in the community of Orcasitas about 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Paulina is 43 years old and is married with two children. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, meats, and vegetables every day with the help of her daughter. Paulina also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays in the community stadium. Paulina needs a loan of $300 that will be used to buy sugar, rice, and oil. Paulina's dreams are to give her children a good education and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia es una mujer que desde muy joven supo lo que es trabajar duro, vive en su propia casa, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, Elías de 12, Andrés de 10 y Luisa de 7 años, espera poder mejorar su vida, para darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos. Sale desde muy temprano de su casa a vender sus deliciosos panes, camina junto a su inseparable triciclo por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, en espera de encontrar un cliente que le compre su producto. Los deliciosos panes que vende Octavia son preparados por su esposo, quien desde las 3 de la madrugada hornea los panes con mucha paciencia y tranquilidad, para luego dárselos a su esposa para que los venda. Lo que más le gusta a Octavia de su trabajo, es que mientras vende puede ir saboreando los panes que horneo su esposo y así evita pasar hambre, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y anhela tener una panadería más adelante donde pueda vender sus panes con una mayor comodidad, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace por las mañanas, lo cual la ha llevado a estar enferma muchas veces. Octavia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida, puesto que con el primer préstamo pudo terminar de construir su horno, ahora espera pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y no perjudicar a su banco comunal. Con lo mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará un nuevo triciclo para llevar a vender sus panes, ya que hace unas semanas sufrió el robo del suyo, lo cual ha perjudicado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Octavia is a woman who learned to work hard at an early age. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three sons, Elias (12), Andrés (10), and Luisa (7). She hopes to improve her quality of life in order to provide her children with a good education. She leaves the house early to sell her delicious breads, walking with her inseparable tricycle cart on the streets of the city of Juliaca, hoping to find customers. The breads Octavia sells are made by her husband, who patiently bakes them at 3:00 in the morning to give to his wife to sell. What Octavia loves most about her work is that she can savor the bread her husband bakes and avoid hunger. She has spent 8 years doing this and longs for her own store where she can sell her bread comfortably since the most difficult part of her job is braving the intense cold in the morning, which has often made her sick. This is Octavia's second loan with MFP and she is very grateful; she used the first loan to finish building an oven. She will pay her loan back on time to avoid hurting her local bank. With this new 1500 sole loan she will buy a new cart to sell bread since her old one was stolen a few weeks ago, hurting her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace her stolen tricycle cart for selling bread

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод занимается ремонтом частных домов. Эта профессия была приобретена им когда не найдя постоянной работы он перебивался разными заработками. Тогда он стал учеником к одному мастеру по ремонту и за пару лет стал самостоятельно делать самые сложные виды ремонта. Сейчас он может выполнять наклейку обоев, стелить полы, уложить кафель и тп. Дилшоду 26 лет, еще не женат. На займ полученный в КИВА собирается приобрести строительный материалы (обои и кафель), которые он будет расходовать при выполнении строительных работ.
texts.en:
Dilshod works in residential construction. He took up that profession to make ends meet when he was not able to find steady work. He became an apprentice to a master craftsman and in a couple of years was able to independently handle the most complicated of jobs. Now he can hang wallpaper, and lay floors and tile, et cetera. Dilshod is 26 years old and unmarried. With the loan from Kiva, he is going to buy materials (wallpaper and tile), which he will use on construction jobs.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже третий год.Она занимается бизнесом продажи посуды по районам Карачкум и Канибадам.Закупает товар Зухро с Худжандского оптового рынка.Зухро каждый свой займ использует для увеличения своего оборота.Помогает ей по бизнесу её муж.Ездит она на рынки два раза в неделю.Остальные дни она работает на консервном комбинате.Зухро благодарна Микроинвест за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
This is the third year that Zuhro has had a loan with MicroInvest. She has a business selling tableware in the districts of Karachkum and Kanibadam. Zuhro purchases her goods from the Khujand wholesale market. Zuhro has used each of her loans to increase her turnover. Her husband assists her with the business. She goes to the market twice a week. On the other days, she works at the canning plant. Zuhro is grateful to MicroInvest for the funding and support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sale of tableware

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old. Her family lives happily in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Elybert A. and they have a 5-year-old child. Rowena is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This is her second loan request and she says it will be very helpful in sustaining her general store. Selling has been her passion since before she was married. She has also just started a hog-raising business and hopes that it will be able to help pay for her child’s schooling in the future.

She believes in the quotation that says, “a family that prays together stays forever.” Rowena believes that through praying together her family will create a strong bond and always have a good relationship. Moreover, Rowena also hopes that someday her child and future children will be successful with their studies and goals in life. This is why, together with her husband, she is working hard for the future welfare of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est célibataire. Pour satisfaire ses propres besoins, elle a commencé en 2006 le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adalawato. Elle réalise de bonnes recettes, ceci est du à l’emplacement géographique de son activité. Vu la manière dont grandit sa clientèle, elle voudrait agrandir sa clientèle, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 8 cartons de lait « Coco butter », 4 cartons de savons « fitso », 5 cartons de perruques, 3 Cartons de mèches tissages et divers produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in Kégué, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She is unmarried. To support herself, she started doing commerce in cosmetics in 2006. She supplies herself at the local marketplace of Adalawato. She makes a good income due to the location of her business. Given the way her customer base is growing, she would like to expand her business. She's therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy eight boxes of Coco Butter milk, four boxes of Fitso soaps, five boxes of wigs, three boxes of woven hair extensions, and various beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of milk, soaps, wigs, and hair extensions

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa L., 31, is married with  children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about 110 USD).  SPBD loans are Tiresa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1727070772) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is widowed and has two adult children.

H. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru: Бободжонова, целенаправленно используя займ увеличила товарооборот. Она хочет улучшить внешний вид торговой точки, для привлечение еще больше клиентов. На запрашиваемый займ она сделает мелкий ремонт места деятельности.
texts.en:
B. increased her goods turnover by using her credit purposefully. She wants to improve the outside appearance of her retail store in order to attract even more customers. She will use this loan to make minor repairs to her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minor repair of retail store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 38 años, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que junto a su pareja lograron adquirir cuando se casaron. Se dedica a la venta de comida en un local ubicado en la avenida principal de su localidad, aunque al principio tuvo temores por su falta de experiencia en la preparación de los platillos, su gran habilidad y deliciosa sazón le facilitaron desenvolverse en su negocio. Lidia tiene un socio, con quien trabaja todos los días desde las 11 de la mañana hasta la media noche, ya que las personas suelen salir con sus familias a degustar de una deliciosa cena en las avenidas principales. Sin embargo, la actividad que realiza no llena sus expectativas, pues compartir las ganancias es una desventaja, por lo que tiene proyectado invertir en la instalación de un restaurante, lo cual espera conseguir con el apoyo de su pareja. El buen animo y deseo de prosperar es una de las cualidades del grupo que conforma su banco comunal, donde ya tiene 13 préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando de la misma manera. Los 3500 soles que ahora solicita serán invertidos en la compra de los productos comestibles que necesita para su negocio, y otra parte para los repuestos de los motocarros que administra junto a su esposo.

loans.use: Compra de ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum U., age 36, and her husband, Kimheng Nhong, age 39, were married in 1997 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them attend school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhum and Kimheng are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to a middleman in the village, who then in turn sells it in the Phnom Penh market. Besides weaving, Kimheng is also a farmer. 

Sokhum doesn’t have enough capital to purchase raw materials (silk and cotton thread) for her weaving business. That’s why she is requesting a loan of $400 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Gildo

texts.en: Gildo is 32 years old and is still single. He also serves as treasurer officer in their Barangay while at the same time managing his general store business. He is requesting to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital. He would also like to expand his business into cell phone load retailing to further increase his daily income. With the amount of loan he hopes to avail, Gildo believes that his business will somehow become progressive by utilizing it wisely. Gildo is from the village of San Juan Quezon, Isabela. He hopes to give his future family a better living someday by his continuous maintenance in the business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a 28 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Bader has been working as a taxi driver for almost two years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Bader has requested a loan.
Bader is special in his work because clients feel comfortable being with him. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passer-bys. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Bader decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene T. is from the town of Motosawa, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 30 years old. Airene is married and has three young children. To make a living, Airene owns and operates a business raising crops. She plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale. Airene has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Airene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Airene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Airene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Airene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia Totado is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Cicilia is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a resturant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: C1190 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Felex is 35 years old and is married with three children aged 4, 8 and 12. He lives in Gicumbi in the Northern Province of Rwanda, a one-hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Felex is a hard working man and now he has become the president of a group called Twisungane.

The members of this group are well-known in their community and their restaurant business is a popular place for locals to hang out. This is their fourth successful year of operation! The hours of their restaurant require that they start early in the morning and work until late in the night every day of the week, oftentimes until the food runs out or the last customer is fed. They employ four people as helpers.

Felex and his group members have been in business since 2006 and they are ready to expand, but their operating profit is still too low for them to make some key purchases to enable the expansion. For this reason, they are requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders. With the loan, the group will be able to afford to buy modern cooking equipment and quality foods and supplies to satisfy their loyal customers. This effort will also help them to attract more customers as well as increase their monthly sales and profit.

With this profit, they all pledge to continue to reinvest in the business, pay school fees for their children, and build more secure futures for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To purchase modern cooking equipment and quality supplies

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es comerciante de todo tipo de peluches, que comercializa en la feria 16 de  julio de la ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja como transportista, estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de dos pequeños hijos que de pende de la pareja. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 16 de julio de la mima ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de más peluches para la temporada navideña y así incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Lucy is a vendor of all types of plush toys, which she sells at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a delivery driver. These activities are the main sources of income to cover the expenses of their two small children. Their home is located in the July 16th District of El Alto.
