This loan will be used to buy more plush toys for the Christmas season, thereby increasing her sales. Lucy is receiving her second from IMPRO. Her good payment history allows her to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plush toys to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra tiene la edad de 54 años. Y tiene 12 hijos y solamente 2 están a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo muy pocos productos por lo que ademas se dedica a la venta de guirilas con cuajada pues ella es una madre responsable y tenía que hacerse cargo de  todos sus hijos. Ella tiene muchas esperanzas de salir adelante con su negocio y lo ha logrado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y gaseosas. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren mejorar su condición de vida y que ella pueda continuar con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Sandra is 54 years old and she has 12 children; only 2 are in her care. She has a small grocery store and she has had this business for the past 7 years. She began the business on her own with very few products, which is why she also sells corn tortillas with cheese. She is a responsible mother and she had to take care of her children. She has great hopes for getting ahead with her business and she has achieved this. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, natural fruit drinks, and sodas. Her hope is that her children will be able to improve their living conditions and that she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, natural fruit drinks, and sodas

loans.name: Bekmat

texts.en:
Bekmat is 62 years old and the father of three children. Since 1996, he has had a livestock business. His wife and elder son help him with caring for the cows. 

Bekmat wants to increase the family's income in order to be able to improve their living conditions. He wants to purchase an additional two cows and is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD. Bekmat is a hard working man and will be able to repay the loan without any violations.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 48 years of age, married with four children ages 10 to 23 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in a five room house. Harriet takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  Harriet's greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children and medication. 

Harriet sells  school uniforms in Nalukolongo  to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She serves about five customers a day. She has been in this business for over fifteen years. Her main challenges are transportation and seasonality. When its school holidays no one buys uniforms.  Harriet sells all types of uniform clothing including sweaters and  t.shirts. She sells both retail and wholesale. 

Harriet has been with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of uniform material and yarn for sweater knitting. Harriet hopes to see her business grow and to start employing people to help her.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and yarn for sweeter knitting

loans.name: Jaime Alonso

texts.es:
Jaime Alonso R. Gravito, tiene 46 años vive en el barrio Recreo de la ciudad de Barranquilla, su negocio es la elaboración de picadas y pastelería  en general.
Inicialmente trabajó como entrenador de futbol, pero quedo desempleado y con la necesidad de generar ingresos, montó una panadería con sus ahorros  e hizo un curso en le Sena para aprender este oficio; como no le fue bien en este negocio porque quedó iliquido, acudió la asesoria del Sena e  incursionó en el ramo de la pastelería, actividad a la que se dedica hace 5 años, de ella vive y permanece actualizándose en diversas líneas de productos. Al principio tuvo mucha incertidumbre porque su familia no pensaba que progresaría, pero recibió mucho apoyo y esto ayudó a mejorar su nivel de vida en familia. En la actualidad  tiene un amplio mercado individual y provee a casas de eventos y fiestas. 

Simultáneo a su negocio, realiza asesorias u orientaciones técnicas en la elaboración de estos productos a pequeñas unidades empresariales o personas que así lo requieran. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo  para extenderse y comercializar sus productos  a nivel de empresas, con este propósito solicita un crédito por $1.000.000 para comprar en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos. Su sueño es tener un punto de venta estilo gourmet, pero tiene un gran desafío y es construir un capital de trabajo  para  expandirse. Su mayor satisfacción es haber sido escogido para participar en el programa Desarrollo productivo DIP, por la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jaime Alonso R. Gravito is 46 years old and lives in the Recreo neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. His business is the production of snacks and pastries. He started his career as a soccer coach, but he lost his job and needed to earn some income, so he started a bakery (just selling bread) with his savings and took a course at the Sena School to learn this trade. This business was not going well – he has some problems with liquidity – so he sought advice from the Sena School and signed up for a class on pastries. He has been selling pastries for 5 years, and this business now allows him to earn a living; he continues to expand his diverse product line. At first he was very nervous, because his family doubted the success of the business, but he received a lot of support anyway. With this business, he has been able to improve his family's quality of life. He currently has a large, independent shop and he also caters at reception halls. While running this business, he also offers consulting services and technical courses on pastry-making to small businesses or entrepreneurs who would like to learn these skills. His greatest challenge is that he does not have enough working capital to expand his operations and commercialize his products within the corporate sector. With this goal, he is seeking a loan of $1,000,000 (Columbian) in order to buy a larger inventory of ingredients and raw materials. His dream is to have a gourmet-style restaurant, but still faces this great challenge of insufficient working capital to expand. He is very happy to have been chosen to participate in the Desarrollo Productivo (DIP) program because of the quality of its loan products.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and ingredients for his pastry-making business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes C. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Lourdes is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lourdes is just starting this business. Lourdes was engaged in buying and selling coconut in her previous business. This time she has a sari-sari store business.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Daniel Kiptui

texts.en:
Daniel Kiptui is a man of twenty six years, married and with two children aged two years and nine months respectively.

Daniel has been farming for the last seven years. He grows maize and passion fruit which he later sells after harvest to earn income. He sells the maize to his neighbors. He also runs a barber shop as a secondary income-generating business in his home area in Sergoit location, Eldoret. 

Daniel is a client of KADET and he has applied for a loan which he will use in his maize business.

Daniel's goal is to buy more land, own another barbershop in Eldoret town, feed his family and educate them too.

loans.use: To be used for maize farming

loans.name: Similie

texts.en: Similie M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Similie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Similie owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motor-transport services to local community members. Similie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000.00 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Similie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Similie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Similie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts for better service for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Similie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for better service

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Go Try” group from the small-town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking for a loan SLL 3,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

M’balu K., 41, pictured in the middle, is the leader of the group. M’balu was born in a place call Masimgbi. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. M’balu has been a businesswoman for more than five years now. She owns a small kiosk where she sells provisions: milk, Ovaltine, sugar, butter, rum, canned drinks, etc. With this loan, M’balu will buy these items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy milk, Ovaltine, sugar, butter, rum, canned drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the town of Raniag Ramon. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yolanda D.'s group.
Yolanda is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios O. is from the village of Cartajena. She is 71 years old. Remedios is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Remedios raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2000, Remedios joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Le Xa 1-8 Group

texts.en:
Van T. N. is 48 years old. She lives in Le Xa village, Dong Anh district. She is married with two children who are going to school. She not only grows rice, but she also makes brooms to sell. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has repaid punctually. For her last loan, she borrowed 2,204,000 VND and has completely repaid that amount. For this loan, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to buy bamboo.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Huong T. N. is 33 years old. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND for her small business.

 Hoa T. T. is 38 years old, and she sells tea in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

 Suot T. C. is 46 years old, and she sells sugarcane in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata  S. est une jeune femme de 28 ans qui vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis mars 2010 et elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle est marie et mère  d’un enfant de 2 ans. Elle évolue  depuis 3 ans dans l’achat et la vente de légumes (piments, choux, aubergines, etc. Auparavant elle a choisi cette activité  pour ne pas rester inactive. Et ses bénéfices  lui permet de se payer des habits et souvent des bijoux. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son activité de commerce de légumes.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata S. is a young woman, aged 28, who lives in the Bambilor locality. She has been a member of the local group fund since March 2010, and has not benefited from any loans from the institution so far. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. She has been involved for 3 years in buying and selling vegetables (peppers, cabbages, eggplants, etc.). Originally, she chose this business to keep from being inactive. Also, her profits allow her to pay for her clothes, and often jewelry. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 frs with the goal of strengthening her vegetable-selling business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin K. (shown in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Hor Leng, have been married since 1994 and have one daughter, who attends school, and one young son. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophoin sells gasoline to travelers. To earn extra income to support her family, Sophoin is a silk weaver as well. She weaves silk at home. Her husband has been a motorbike and bicycle repairer since 2006. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She also will use a part of the loan to buy additional motorbike and bicycle spare parts for her husband’s motorbike and bicycle repairing business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy additional spare parts for her husband’s motorbike and bicycle repairing business

loans.name: Cristales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CRISTALES porque la hija de la tesorera se llama Cristal, y en honor a la niña el grupo eligió ese nombre. Esta ubicado en  el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 13 integrantes.

La señora María R. M. ocupa el puesto de Presidenta del grupo tiene 24 años de edad, casada, estudió hasta la Secundaria, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos

La señora Doris Arlen J. T. conocida por sus amigos como Doris, tiene 20 años y vive en unión libre,  trabajaba en una tortillería cuyos ingresos no le alcanzaban, por lo que inició con la venta de cosméticos, al paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que los ingresos por sus ventas eran mayores que el sueldo por su empleo por lo que decidió dejar de trabajar y dedicar el 100% del tiempo a sus ventas, mismas que hoy en día le permiten atender a su familia, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, y su objetivo es tener un mejor nivel de vida.

En la actualidad esta diversificando el giro del negocio ya que esta iniciando con la venta de tupperware, sin descuidar la venta de los cosméticos, misma que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Con este crédito va a pagar sus pedidos de cosméticos y el primer pedido de Tupperware

En la fotografía de izquierda a derecha
Ma. De los Ángeles C. C.
Alejandra R. G.
Nataly C. C.
Cristina N. C.
María Teresa F. M.
Doris Arlen J. T.
Mercedes H. A.
Lucero R. C.
Noemí C. T.
María R. M.
Eufrosina J. L.
texts.en:
This group is called 'CRISTALES' because the treasurer's daughter is called Cristal, and the group elected this name in honour of her. CRISTALES is located in the Morelos state and is made up of 13 members. Señora María occupies the post of group President. She is 24 years old and married. María studied until secondary school and now works selling Mexican snacks. Señora Doris Arlen J. T., known to her friends as Doris, is 20 years old and lives with her partner. She used to work in a tortilla shop didn't earn enough so she began selling cosmetics. There came a moment when Doris realised that the earnings from her cosmetic sales were better than her salary as an employee, so she decided to leave her job and dedicate 100% of her time to selling cosmetics. This job also lets her attend to her family, as she has a 2 year old son. Doris's objective is to have a better quality of life. She is diversifying her business path and is beginning to sell tupperware, without neglecting her cosmetic sales. These have allowed her to move forward. In the photograph from left to right: Ma. De los Ángeles C. C. Alejandra R. G. Nataly C. C. Cristina N. C. María Teresa F. M. Doris Arlen J. T. Mercedes H. A. Lucero R. C. Noemí C. T. María R. M. Eufrosina J. L.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for cosmetics and Tupperware orders

loans.name: Gyaviira

texts.en:
Gyaviira B. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Gyaviira has a business owning a computer shop dealing with internet, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Gyaviira has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more computers and tables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gyaviira hopes to generate greater profits and to educate his children.  In the future, Gyaviira hopes to expand his computer business.

loans.use: to buy more computers and tables

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda J. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Lourinda is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lourinda owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lourinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6100 PHP a month for these activities.

Lourinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. Lourinda is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid is married with two grown up children. He lives and works in Berdyansk, which is a great resort place on Azov Sea. Leonid owns a small business selling various electrical goods such as outlets, wires, drills, and so forth.

He started this business 15 years ago. Affordable prices and excellent client service have been the keys to success. Leonid enjoys his business and plans to develop it further. Leonid's business goal is to start another location. 

Leonid is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase  additional inventory.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent   dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I, un des quartiers de la  ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents  se sont bien dénoués. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels la restauration avec DJENEBA T., la couture, les articles de fête, le bois de chauffe, les chaussures etc.
DJENEBA T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  200kg de riz  + 5 paquets de condiments alimentaires + 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe pour faire la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO et dans les villages voisins. 
Les plats sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et  quelques fois en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, le plus souvent au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi group are all married, average 35 years of age and have on average six children each. They live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region). They are on their sixth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. All their previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women have a variety of trades, including restauration in the case of Djeneba T., sewing and selling party items, firewood, shoes etc. With her loan Djeneba T. is planning on buying 200kg of rice, five packets of condiments and one barrow load of firewood for her restauration business. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's large market and in neighboring villages. Her dishes are sold, mainly for cash, at Sikasso's large market and sometimes within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, of which part will be used for daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is the resident of Pakpattan which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its sugar production. She owns a 2 room brick house (in the area named 14SP) and lives in it with her 2 daughters, a son and her husband. Naseem is a 28 year old skillful lady. She operates her embroidery business at her home to support her family, financially. She couldn’t enroll her children into school due to financial constraints. 

Naseem's husband is a milkman by profession. He has a milk shop in the market. He has a contract with the milk suppliers who supply milk to him for his shop. His business is going well but, he has to pay the amount to the supplier before selling the milk. So he has decided to buy a buffalo for the purpose of milk production. This will mean that he never has to pay the amount to the supplier, but will sell milk from his own buffalo. Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah to help her husband in his business. With the loan, her husband will buy the buffalo for producing milk and will sell it through his shop. Naseem hopes that her husband will receive a good profit by implementing his new idea for his business. 

Naseem is a regular loan user from Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Naseem”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married and has a one-year-old son named Vladislav. He is a businessman from Drogobych. Sergyi sells men’s and women’s footwear and clothing items at three different vending locations in his home town. All his kiosks are located in busy public places where hundreds of potential customers pass every day. Sergyi launched his venture six years ago. Currently, he has 60,000 UAH in inventory. His gross income amounts to approximately $3050 a month. 

Sergyi is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase additional clothing and footwear merchandise in order to re-stock inventory at the three vending locations that he owns. He sells shoes and clothes at affordable prices, focusing on low-income social groups in his town. Sergyi started out small and has been consistently growing his business. His venture is a good example of entrepreneurial enthusiasm, persistence and determination.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Baido Comfort Araba

texts.en: Baido Comfort Araba D. is married and has four children. She has received a junior high education. Baido sells provisions and secondhand clothing at Elmina. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her husband is a policeman. She assists her husband in the general well-being of the home. The loan will enable her to increase the supply of her goods for her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To increase the supply of her goods for her customers.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina N. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and piped water. 

She runs a school, which she established three years ago. Her neighboring children attend her school. She took a photo with her school children. Victorina faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing text books for reading. She hopes to establish a big education center and open another school in the future. 

Victorina decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase books and furniture (tables and chairs) for her school.

loans.use: To purchase books and furniture (tables and chairs) for her school.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy fish, palm-oil, bananas and used clothes for her business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette K. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Bernadette is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadette owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bernadette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bernadette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods

loans.name: Rosario De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosario Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

La Señora. Rosario tiene 34 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14, 9 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y es mas para sus gastos, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rosario es comerciante, vende ambulantemente repuestos de ollas de presión y más artículos, labora en esta actividad hace 7 años desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, después de laborar en esta actividad trabaja en un hotel desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche  de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra 6 años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio en la compra de mas repuestos. Su meta es engrandecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario Z. is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Triumphant Women) community bank and lives in Cuenca city center.  This city has a cold climate but its people are very kind and friendly and they maintain their culture and traditions.  The historic city center is known for its architectural beauty.

Rosario is 34 years old, divorced, and has 3 children aged 18, 14 and 9.  Her eldest child works.  Her middle child is studying in high school and her youngest daughter is at an elementary school in the city.  She does not own her own home but rents instead.

Rosario is a saleswoman.  She sells spare parts for pressure cookers and other items as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She works from 9.00am to 3.00pm.  After she finishes this work, she works in a hotel from 4.00pm to 7.00pm every day of the week.  She has been a member of her community bank for six years and she likes it because she has good friends there.  She will invest her loan money in her business, in buying more spare parts.  Her goal is to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for pressure cookers

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown daughters. She is a farmer from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine. Ludmila grows early spring vegetables for sale in her region as well as other regions of Ukraine. She owns four big greenhouses, ten smaller ones for cabbage, and two more separate ones for seedlings. Ludmila has been in this farming business for 22 years. She has already invested about 60,000 grivnyas in this enterprise. Her annual expenses for seeds and film amount to a total of 30,000 grivnyas.  

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to fix one of the greenhouses and purchase seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film. Ludmila is very energetic. She never stops and always moves forward aiming at new horizons and pursuing new accomplishments. She is hoping to construct an additional greenhouse some time this year. Moreover, in addition to her farming business, Ludmila raises chicken broilers and 30 minks for the purpose of getting their skins and selling their expensive fur.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Mrs. Din S. was born in 1970. She lives in Ampil village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. In order to support her farm, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and rice seeds.

Mrs. Din S.’s husband, Mr. Chroeng Oeung, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a little income to support their family.  He also helps his wife with the farming.  The couple have four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a laborer, and the other two are attending the local school. The couple appear together in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and rice seeds for growing rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy: mens shoes, womens trousers, womens blouses, mens blue jeans, mens shirts, girls dresses.

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en:
Age:                            36
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      6
Business:                    selling fried foods in the local community
Loan purpose:              to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale
Weekly profit:              600 WST (US $250)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.7 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:          1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:               2.25 out of 3

Sapani owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Sapani needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or about $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sapani joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sapani's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: fish vending, pig fattening and a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Nora is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase fish, feed for her pigs and stock for the store.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fish, feed for her pigs and stock for her store

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra M. M., tiene la edad de 24 años, está casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son mayores prioridades. Ella  pretende con el crédito comprar unos cerdos para su crianza y engorde para su posterior venta. Ella cuenta con las instalaciones y los chiqueros para su instancia, también ella cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para su explotación y será un proyecto de ella y su esposo. Ella pretende es generar ingresos para su bienestar familiar y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos por lo cual quiere ir creciendo  con su negocio para en un futuro poder darles su estudio y que sean profesionales en  alguna área especifica.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sandra M. M. is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children who are her main priorities.  She plans to use her loan to buy some pigs to raise, fatten and then sell.  She already has the facilities and the pig pens.  She also has the experience she needs to carry out the project.  She will carry out the project together with her husband.

Sandra plans to make income for her family so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.  She is thinking of her children's future and, for this reason, she would like to grow her business so that, in the future, she can provide her children with an education and see them become professionals in a specific field.

This is Sandra's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn't had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better repayment terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona B. is from the village of Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Chona is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Her husband is providing motorela (moto-taxi) or habal-habal service. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Chona is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages for the retail store. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages for the store

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling shoes, handbags, and cosmetics door to door. Her clients are her neighbors and friends. Seasonality and the high cost of transportation present the primary challenges to her business. 

She decided to join Yehu so she could access loans that would allow her to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she intends to purchase bundles of shoes, handbags, and cosmetics for her cosmetic shop. She dreams of becoming self-reliant and meeting her customers' needs in the future.

Fatuma lives with her husband and family in a house that they own. The house has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes, handbags, and cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad; La socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8, 7 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia vende mates frescos hechos por ella misma, la socia compra hierbas naturales medicinales la socia vende de forma ambulatoria, la socia compra manzanas y maíz morado; La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz morado para los refrescos , manzanas, para los mates, hierbas naturales para los otros mates. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" (Hard-working Mothers) community bank which is located in Tica Tica district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children aged 10, 8 and 7.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling fresh mate infusions which she makes herself.  She buys natural, medicinal herbs and sells her drinks as an itinerant street vendor.  She also buys apples and purple corn.  She would like this loan to invest in buying purple corn for her soft drinks, apples for her mate infusions and natural herbs for some other mate infusions.  She is requesting the loan to buy supplies.

The borrower is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Vive en casa propia la cual esta  ubicada e una comunidad pequeña del distrito de Chepen.

José se dedica a  brindar servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) que es su propiedad durante la semana de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana se dedica la venta de verduras en el mercado  de su localidad. Su esposa lo ayuda al sostenimiento del hogar con la venta de comida, actividad a la a que se dedica hace 8 años.

José está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500  nuevos soles para poder realizar un mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, con sus respectivas actualizaciones de documentos y para comprar más mercadería para su negocio de verduras.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old, and is married with two young children.  He lives in his own house which is located in a small community in Chepén district.

During the week, from Monday to Friday, José works providing public transport with a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a cab for transporting people), which is his property.  Weekends are spent selling vegetables at the market in his area.  His wife helps him with the household by selling food, an activity that she has been working in for 8 years.

José is requesting a loan through Alternative Edpyme of 2,500 New Soles to perform maintenance on his mototaxi, with the relevant updated documents, and to buy more merchandise for his vegetable business.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is a hardworking married man who lives in a rented house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a secretarial shop for three years and the business has been profitable. With the income generated he has been able to provide for his family. He has challenges in terms of limited capital. His dream is to buy land and also expand his business. Ronnie is requesting a loan to buy land for resale.

loans.use: to purchase land for resale.

loans.name: Atadior Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Gloria qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de  sucre et de tissu teinté. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises fifteen women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Gloria (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She also supports three other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

Ms. Gloria is active in selling sugar and dyed cloth. She has good experience in this work domain, since she has been working at it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.)

loans.use: to buy sugar and dyed fabrics

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married lady and a beautiful mother of two school-age children. She is 41 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  To make a living, Conchita has a beauty salon.  Her income  comes from manicure and pedicure services, which she has been doing for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP10,000 at GDMPC to purchase manicure and pedicure equipment.

Conchita has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Conchita hopes to gain more income from her services, and to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase manicure and pedicure equipment.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 34-year-old single lady. Linda runs a nursery school in Changamwe, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last eight years. Her business has been doing well.


Linda has already been a KADET client and this marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing textbooks and more desks. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks and more desks.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson has practiced maize farming and also keeps livestock in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 34 years old, married to Rebeccah, and they have two school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan with which he plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.  

He will later sell the produce at the local market. In the future, Evanson hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 59, is a mixed crop farmer, married to Josphat who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged 28. Nancy has been a farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy seedlings and farm manure. With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy a dairy cow. Her hopes are to buy another piece of land and venture into dairy farming which will help her increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and farm manure

loans.name: Jesús Ronald

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor Jesús Ronald se dedica a laborar como contador en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 10 años. Casado con  dos personas a su cargo a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la decisión de iniciar la  obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines .para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia  .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Jesús Ronald works as an accountant at a business. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He is married, with two people in his charge that he needs to provide the necessities for.

One of the needs that he has is to make improvements to his house because it is in bad condition. He has made the decision to begin making improvements. This is why he has come to Ceprodel, to request a loan so he can buy construction materials such as tin roofing and roof beams. He will change the roof and thereby provide improved living conditions for his family.

It is important to mention that through this project he will provide his family with a dignified home to live in with all of the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala  is 30, and she is engaged in poultry breeding. Poultry is very popular among Azerbaijani people and most of the everyday meals are made of chicken or turkey. She has 4 years of experience in this field and her father, who is helping her now, was the one who brought her the idea of starting the business. Now her monthly income is 200 USD and she is on the way to increasing it.

 Kamala has a lot of customers and their demand is rising very fast. Kamala needs additional financial support to cover this high market demand. For this purpose she applied for 1100 AZN. She will use the loan to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys to cover market demand.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a hardworking business woman aged 31. She is married and blessed with four children. 

For the last ten years, she has been renting out temporary houses to earn a living. She has been able to grow her business and educate her children with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add more rental houses.

loans.use: To acquire more temporary housing to rent out

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 36, is a hard-working mother of four school-age children who aims to become successful someday. She wants to continue sending her children to school and earn degrees to become professionals in the future. To generates income, the family members help each other in managing their rice farming business within their village. They have operated this business for more than 10 years and usually earn a profit of P26,000 every harvest season. They want to increase their yields and income to satisfy their needs, and finance the childrens' education. Elena wants to ask for additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the maintenance of their farm. They hope that they will be able to increase their yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farming business

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda tiene 73 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es eminentemente urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Leonilda tiene como meta, el poder hacer unos cambios para mejorar su casa, pero no ha podido ya que ha tenido problemas económicos, lo que quiere decir que se le hace muy difícil realizar su proyecto por financiamiento propio.

Es por eso que Leonilda está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción como block, arena, entre otros, para asi mejorar su hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Leonilda es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su primer préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Leonilda is 73 years old and lives with her family in a community in the Hatillo district, which is quite urban and residential. However, it is also an area of growing commercial activity, chiefly concentrated in the shopping centers. Many furniture stores, tortilla shops, bakeries, bookstores, repair workshops, auto repair shops, gas stations, dentists, pharmacies, medical clinics, bars, restaurants, stores and print shops have opened here. 

Leonilda has the goal of making some changes to improve her house, but she has not been able to do so since she has had economic problems; in other words, it has been very difficult for her to carry out her project with her own funds. 

For this reason, Leonilda is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 (four hundred thousand) colones, to buy construction materials such as concrete blocks and sand, among others, in order to improve her home and provide her family with a better quality of life. 

Leonilda is a member of the Hatillo communal bank, one of EDESA's 110 communal credit organizations in Costa Rica. This is her first loan with the organization, and she gives many thanks for all the support provided to her.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Francis Gichia

texts.en:
Francis used his second loan to buy a heifer to boost his dairy farming, and his milk production has increased, thereby allowing him to make a good profit.

This being his third loan, Francis plans to buy another heifer to boost his large-scale dairy farming and milk production.

In future, he hopes to expand his dairy farming and buy a big ranch to establish a milk production industry and become one of the leading milk producers and distributors in the country.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marina  es separada,  tiene 45  años D. edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Esperanza y progreso D. Huaycan”  grupo  conformado por 6  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Marina  trabaja vendiendo ceviche los domingos, este negocio surge a raíz D. su divorcio ya que ella tenía que sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, marina nos cuenta que empezó vendiendo a sus vecinos y poco a poco se hizo conocida  hoy en día tiene una gran cantidad D. clientes fidelizados,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos economicos sus hijos han puesto su propio negocio, ha construido su casa y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida, Marina a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia,  mesas, sillas para su negocio. Sabemos que Marina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Marina is 45 years old, separated, and a partner in the communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso D. Huaycan" ("Hope and Progress of Huaycan").  The group is formed by six partners who work in diverse commercial businesses.  

Marina works selling ceviche on Sundays.  This business emerged due to her divorce because she had to proviD. for her two children.  Marina tells us that she began selling to her neighbors and bit by bit, she became known.  These days, she has a large number of loyal clients.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has achieved a better income, her children have started their own business, she has built her house, and above all, her family's quality of life has improved.

Marina has requested a new loan to purchase merchandise, tables, and chairs for her business.  We know that Marina will achieve her goals with much work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina 38, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Augusto, a tricycle driver, and has a 6-year-old daughter currently studying in grade one. While attending to her husband and daughter, Carolina also keeps busy with her business as her way of helping her husband with the family's daily expenses. 

Carolina owns a variety store. She buys groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. Her husband’s income in his tricycle business is also a big help. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Carolina is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items to increase her stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy from her. More sales will result in better profit and will help her to save more money for her future. 

Carolina hopes that her business will maintain good income and become a grocery someday. It would also be a great help to have an additional tricycle.  Carolina dreams of maintaining enough income to send her daughter to a good school and for her to be able to finish college, have work and a stable life. Carolina is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Before becoming a member of CCT, Carolina never opened her Bible, but she does now as it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es: Doña Luz, originaria de León, de oficio comerciante alegre, dinámica y preparándose para la época navideña encontramos a  Luz, acomodando su pulpería para las ventas del día. El cambio que ha vivido atravez del préstamo Kiva ha sido muy positivo para su vida y negocio pues logro uno de sus objetivos surtir su pulpería e invertir en compra de ropa nueva para vender las ventas han ido mejorando pues comprobó que al invertir en variedad de productos de mucha necesidad la afluencia de clientes es mas continua y los ingresos mejora a pesar del alza de los precios que se sufre constantemente pero aun ha si el negocio se administra bien se puede ver buenos cambios. Ella esta requiriendo un segundo crédito para invertir en ropa ya que se aproxima las fiestas de Diciembre donde las venta se elevan bastante además de ofrecer variedad de productos en pulpería comestibles para preparar la cena navideña, vender piñatas para los niños pues quiere introducir poco a poco artículos que la competencia no ofrece. Pues tiene bien firmes sus metas como son prosperara y crecer su negocio, reparar su casa y cambiar el nivel de vida a su familia para vivir de manera digna y honrada.
texts.en:
Doña Luz, from León, is a retailer who is happy, dynamic, and is preparing herself for the Christmas season.  We meet Luz getting her convenience store ready for the day's sales.

The changes that she has experienced through her Kiva loan have been very positive for her life and her business.  She has been able to accomplish one of her objectives by stocking up her convenience store and investing in the purchase of new clothing for resale.  Her sales have improved, as she was able to invest in a variety of products which were much needed by her influx of customers.  Her sales have become more steady and her income has improved, even in spite of the increase in prices which she is constantly facing.  However, even as the business has been going well, she can see other good changes.

She is requesting a second loan to invest in clothing, as the December holidays are approaching when her sales increase significantly.  She also wants to offer a variety of products for sale in her convenience store: foods to prepare for Christmas dinner, piñatas for the children.  Little by little, she wants to be able to introduce items that her competition don't sell.

She is holding firm to her goals such as prospering and growing her business, fixing up her home, and changing her family's standard of living so that they can live in a dignified and honorable way.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for sale as the December holidays are approaching, and buy products for her convenience store such as foods to prepare for Christmas dinner and piñatas for the children.

loans.name: Lenlie

texts.en:
Lenlie is 41 years old and married with 5 children.

Lenlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell. Lenlie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail business for a year and also earns an income from a sari-sari store and farming rice.

Lenlie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada hace 32 años con el señor Pedro de 50 años, tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos fallecieron, dos están casadas y viven en forma independiente y los otros viven con su padre.
Cuenta que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas de vestir, calzados, ropas interiores y demás. Ella junto con su marido salen por las ciudades aledañas y otros mas distante a llevar sus productos de mercerías, roperías y artículos de bazar, realizando su recorrido en una camioneta que el matrimonio cuenta, ya tiene su clientela formada  y semanalmente les visita para llevar los pedidos que tiene.                                                                          Solicita este préstamo para la compra de championes, remeras, blusas, calzas, ropa interior, toallas, toallas, vaquero para damas y caballeros, edredón y  otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.-
texts.en:
Catalina is from the city of Caaguazú. She is 48 years old and had been married for 32 years to Pedro who is 50 years old. She has six children of which two have died. Two are married and live independently while the others live with their father.

She says that for a long time she has made a living selling all kinds of products door to door, like clothing, shoes, underwear and more. Together with her husband they go out to the neighboring cities and others that are further away. They bring their sewing materials, clothing and stationery products and make their rounds in a truck that the couple has. They have a steady clientele and make their visits weekly to deliver the orders they have.

She is requesting this loan to buy sneakers, t-shirts, blouses, nylons, underwear, towels, jeans for men and women, quilts and other items that will allow her to offer variety to her customers and be able to improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy sewing items, shoes, and more to supply her stock of products.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single young woman. She describes herself as a social and polite woman. She runs a retail shop and sells items such as sugar, books, bread, tea leaves etc. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her business challenge is the high price of home products. 

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more tea leaves. In the next five years, Rosemary hopes to be selling tea leaves at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Teresita has a general store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Beatriz de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad por quienes se esfuerza día con día. Beatriz es una madre muy responsable quien en busca que a su familia no le falte nada presta sus servicios en un negocio de venta de tortilla, también presta sus servicios domésticos lavando ropa en diferentes viviendas de su comunidad, gracias a estos negocios logra mantener la economía de su hogar. Y es por lo que en busca de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para construir un corredor en su vivienda, logrando así mejorar su estilo de vida. Con el crédito anterior Beatriz logró construir su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida y espera continuar mejorando su calidad de vida con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 25 years old, she lives with her domestic partner and their son who is 3 years old. She works hard for them each day. Beatriz is a very responsible mother who tries to ensure that her family wants for nothing, and works in a business selling tortillas. She also offers her domestic services, washing clothing in homes around her community. Thanks to these businesses she is able to support her family economically. 
She is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to improve her living conditions. She will invest it in aluminum sheets, wood, nails and labor in order to construct a passage in her home, hopefully achieving this goal of improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in aluminum, wood, nails and labor to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha, 52 year-old man, from village Patara Kanda. He lives with his pensioner mother. Gocha works as a truck driver and gets approximately 400 GEL monthly. In order to get another source of income and more effectively meet the daily costs of his family, Gocha decided to be involved in agricultural activity and start dairy farming with his mother. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 
This credit will be a great support for the family. Gocha is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to increase the living condition and monthly income of his family.

loans.use: To purchase milked-cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana F., who was born in Quevado, Ecuador, is a 22 year-old single woman who resides with her parents. She runs a small gift shop in the Municipal de Bastión Popular that is known for its selection of perfumes. She has been in business for 5 years. Every morning from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm Diana and her mother operate their shop. Ms. F. wants this loan to buy more products and diversify her stock. This hard-working young woman not only runs this business; she is wrapping up her studies at the University in Business Administration.

loans.use: Diversify supply of perfume

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has 8 years of experience in cosmetic sales. On her own iniciative she decided to work so she would be able to help her household while her husband was out of work. She works every day from 2 pm to 5:30 pm; in the morning she does her chores around the house.

Rosario wants the loan so that she can invest part of it in her business. She also wants to give some capital to her husband so that he returns to his work crafting suitcases. He has the machines he needs for his work but had to leave it because he lacked capital.

Rosario is 29 years old. She is married with 2 sons, one of whom is in school. Her husband is currently working for a longshoreman business and hopes with the loan to be able to manage his own business. They have been renting their home for 9 years and hope to be able to save so they can buy themselves a plot of land and build their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el comercio y la venta de cosmeticos. Por iniciativa propia decidió ponerse a trabajar para poder ayudar al hogar ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo. Su negocio lo hace todos los días de la semana en horario de la tarde de 2 p.m. hasta las 5:30 ya que por la mañana deja hecho los quehaceres del hogar.

Rosario desea el crédito para una parte poder invertir en el negocio. También quiere darle un capital a su esposo para que vuelva a trabajar en la elaboración de maletas que es su profesión. Inclusive el ya tienen las maquinarias pero tuvo que dejar de elaborar por falta de capital.

Rosario tiene 29 años, es casada con 2 hijos uno de los cuales ya estudia. Actualmente su esposo esta trabajando en una empresa de estibador y espera con el crédito poder ya manejar su negocio propio. Ellos viven alquilando por 9 años y esperan poder ahorrar para comprarse un solar y comenzar a construir su casita.

loans.use: Invest in her own business and help her husband restart his

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Lizzy (lady holding bowl of tomatoes) is a resident of this town and sells mainly tomatoes produced on her farm, in the market. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
A. Nuriniso has been an active client of Microinvest for the past 2 years. She has been an entrepreneur for 6 years. She orders candies and cookies from her vendors. She started her business after she was left alone with her two children. Now all the responsibilities of the children are on her shoulders. Her children are going to school. She dreams about giving them an education, but she doesn’t have enough money for it. She needs $300 for opening a new stall in the market. She is hoping to get a maximum profit from selling her products and she will use this profit for her children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ахмедова Нуринисо, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 6 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Предпринимательской деятельностью начала заниматься после того, как она осталась одна с двумя детьми на руках. Теперь вся забота о детях лежат на ее плечах. Ее дети учатся в школе. Она мечтает дать им высшее образование, а для этого ей не хватает средств. Ей необходимо 300$, для открытия новой торговой точки. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров, а полученную прибыль потратит на образование своих детей.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening a new stall in the market

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Ms. Graciela M. is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of which are still in elementary school, while the oldest is attending the last years of high school. Her children going to school demand a great effort on the part of the family, and they hope they will make it to college. Graciela started her microbusiness 7 years ago, with a small volume of merchandise, which has increased with time; she was also able to acquire some equipment, such as refrigerators, shelves and scales, which have contributed to the good image of her business. Thanks to her long trajectory and great dedication to work, Graciela presently possesses the basic infrastructure required to build up her stock of merchandise, mainly composed of rice, sugar, meat, eggs, produce, etc. In order to do so, she is requesting a $100 loan, which she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise. Graciela belongs to a committee of female entrepreneurs, through which 15 women request solidary loans to invest in their microbusinesses, and meet the credit modality in a responsible way.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.
