La Señora Graciela M. tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos; dos de ellos están aún en el nivel escolar, pero el hijo mayor ya está cursando los últimos años de la secundaria. Los hijos estudian con un gran esfuerzo de parte de la familia, y esperan que estos lleguen a la universidad. Graciela comenzó su microempresa hace 7 años, con escasa cantidad de mercaderías, la cual fue aumentando con el correr del tiempo; también pudo adquirir algunos equipamientos como refrigeradores, estantes, balanzas, lo cual ayudó a dar una mejor imágen a su negocio. Producto de su larga trayectoria y gran dedicación al trabajo, Graciela ya posee la infraestructura básica para incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende, que entre ellos podemos citar arroz, azúcar, carne, huevos, verduras, etc. Para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías, solicita el crédito de $100, que invertirá en la compra de los mismos. Graciela forma parte de un comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde 15 mujeres adquieren préstamos de forma solidaria y los invierten en sus microempresas, cumpliendo responsablemente con la modalidad del crédito.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una señora D. 62 años D. edad, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijos que son mayores D. edad. Celia cuenta con una venta D. abarrotes donD. ofrece productos D. la canasta familiar, juguetes, material escolar y paralelamente también negocia con alquileres D. algunos cuartos D. su domicilio. La cliente tiene más D. 30 años D. experiencia en este rubro y cuenta con todos los conocimientos basicos que requieren estos negocios, esta es la razón por la cuál maneja muy bien ambos negocios. Debido a la demanda en la zona por los productos básicos que ofrece en su venta constantemente necesita D. financiamiento para surtir su mercadería, D. acuerdo a la época. Con la presente solicitud del crédito la cliente adquirirá más regalos, juguetes, distintas bebidas y productos D. la canasta familiar y D. bazar. Esta es la cuarta secuencia D. Celia con Agrocapital y ha demostrado tener un excelente comportamiento crediticio, ya que pagó sus cuotas D. maner puntual, actualmente no tiene más deudas en el sistema financiero.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler , Kiva Volunteer.

Celia is a 62 year old woman, who is widowed and lives with her two oldest children. Celia runs a grocery store where she sells common products for families, toys, and school supplies, and also runs a business with which she rents out rooms in her home. She has over 30 years of experience in this role and has all the basic knowledge that these businesses require, which is why she can run her businesses so well. Because of her area's high demand for the basic products she sells, she constantly needs funds to maintain her stock and stay up to date. With this loan Celia will buy more gifts, toys, a variety of drinks, groceries, and other miscellaneous products. This is the fourth time that Celia, with Agrocapital, has demonstrated an excellent credit history since she has always maD. her payments on time and currently has great faith in this financial system.

loans.use: Pay off previous credit and increase working capital

loans.name: Kapka

texts.en: Together with her husband Kapka A. has built a café and a grocery in their house. Her husband is a  construction worker. They have two kids. Now they have the idea to start a farming business and need $750 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Viola's Group

texts.en:
Viola N. is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock of items like tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and matooke (cooked, mashed bananas) in her business. She hopes that this will lead to an increase in her earnings.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock in her store

loans.name: “Jetypeka” Group

texts.es:
The “Jetypeka” group was formed 6 months ago. A majority of the original members of the group will continue working with the group into its next phase. The group has accumulatively saved 714,527 Paraguayan Guaranis (Est. $150 USD). Hard work and dedication help form the foundation of this group of enterprising women.

The women who form this group dedicate themselves to a diverse array of productive activities. The loan will be used as capital to assist them in purchasing additional merchandise in some instances or ingredients for those who dedicate themselves to the sale of edible goods.

Among the professions they practice we find: cosmetic sales (lotions, makeup, perfumes), clothing sales, fast food sales, sales of “chipas” (chipas: traditional Paraguayan breads; small balls of cheese bread made from tapioca starch), operating neighborhood markets and women who wash clothes.

These women desire a better future for their children. Because of this, they exert double the effort to earn sufficient income to permit them to pay for the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “Jetypeka” tiene 6 meses de formación mantiene a la mayoría de las primeras integrantes aun trabajando con el grupo, pasan al 2º ciclo con capacitación realizada y un ahorro acumulado de Gs.714.527; su trabajo y dedicación son las bases mas fuertes de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras.

Las señoras que componen este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo comprando mas mercaderías en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboración de productos en el caso de las señoras que se dedican a la venta de comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta de cosméticos (cremas, maquillajes, colonias), venta de ropas, venta de comidas rápidas, venta de chipas (comida típica paraguaya,), despensa, lavanderas (lavan ropas).

Estas mujeres anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar suficiente ingresos que les permita pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of fruits, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, cheese, meats, canned goods and a washer

Compra de frutas, verduras, ropas, cosmeticos, queso, carne, productos enlatados y un lavarropas.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba A. is 37 years old and is married with four children.

The husband of Nasiba is currently unemployed which is why Nasiba became the main bread-winner. She sells clothing for women. Nasibahas been in this business for 15 years. One of her trading places is located in the local market and another is in her store. Being very friendly with her clients Nasiba has obtained her clientele through years of work. The business is stable and is generating significant income allowing the family to improve living conditions. 

Today Nasiba is planning to travel to Bishakek which is located in the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan, and Dubai located in Arabian Emirates in order to purchase the new clothing for for sale. With this purpose, she requests $900.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Nasiba has borrowed from IMON several times and has proven herself as a reliable client. Nasiba thanks everyone for the support and promises to pay the loan on time

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Femia's W/taifa Group

texts.en:
Femia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Femia is a clothing and handbags seller that started her business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Femia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Aziza and Fatuma, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more more items for her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin es un señnor que tiene 30 años viviendo en la comunidad de Wisamaya.  El tiene 46 años de edad, y tiene 8 hijos - 3 mayores y 5 que todavia estan al lado de sus padres.  Martin ha solicitado un prestamo de 6000 bolivianos para el comercializacion de carne.  Este credito es el  primero que tiene este esñor con el institucion Fundacion Diaconia - FRIF. Con este dinero, el espera mejorar su nivel de ingreso economico para su familia.

loans.use: Compra y venta de carne de ovino, queso y otros productos

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Гулова Давлатой Каримовна жительница района Рудаки. Возраст  50 лет, замужем, имеет 8 детей.Образование средние. Клиентка имеет небольшой участок земли,который  засеивает  картофелем. Имеет опыт в сельском хозяйстве более 15 лет.  Сельское хозяйство  является единственым источником дохода ее семьи. Собрав урожай Давлатой  использует для собственных нужд,а остатки продает на местном рынке .В данный момент ей нужны деньги для покупки минеральных удобрений. Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: покупка мин.удобрений.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun H., 57, and her husband, Mr. Sean Sou, 61, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1969 and have six sons. Four of the sons are married and live outside the family home; the other two have full-time employment.

Mrs. Saroeun and her husband have been farming for 39 years. They grow rice on their farm, far from their house. In addition, Mr. Sean is also a carpenter. Saroeun is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase rice seed and to pay fees for plowing and transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.use: To finance the next rice crop

loans.name: Rimber Joel

texts.es:
Joel is a young man with a great desire for self-improvement. At 19 years of age, he has his own cuye (guinea pig) farm and at the same time he cultivates alfalfa. He has been raising cuyes since he was ten years old, having been motivated and taught the trade by his parents who he lives with. His dream is to serve his country by becoming a policeman. In the meantime, Joel will continue to tend to his farm while simultaneously working toward making his law enforcement career dreams a reality. Joel needs to plant alfalfa to feed his cuyes, which is why he is seeking this loan with the promise that he will be punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Joel es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, a sus 19 años posee su propia granja de cuyes y a la vez cultiva alfalfa, la crianza de cuyes lo realiza desde que tiene 10 años porque sus padres lo motivaron e inculcaron, él vive con sus padres y tiene el sueño de servir a su patria siendo un honesto policía. Mientras tanto, Joel seguirá trabajando en su granja y a la vez preparándose para que su anhelo sea una realidad. Joel necesita sembrar alfalfa para sus cuyes, para ello, es que solicita el presente préstamo, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa to plant, as it is the food he uses for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a single mom with one grown son. She is in the business of selling sweets, candy, and cookies in the central city market in Melitopol. Every holiday gives Ludmila a great chance to get extra sales and keep her business stable.

Ludmila has been in this business for quite a while, almost 15 years total. She knows all the wholesale distributors and that helps her get high quality products at reasonable prices. Her good managerial skills help her be a successful salesperson. Ludmila has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for a couple of years. She has never had a single late payment since she started using lending services.

Ludmila needs 5000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. Since she does not charge high prices, she has many loyal customers who trust her and keep coming to buy yummy goodies at her kiosk. The loan will give Ludmila's business a good economic boost and will help meet the high demand for her products this season. Moreover, the loan will give Ludmila a chance to buy a new vending location which she has been planning to do for quite a while.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending spot

loans.name: Lidia Cledy

texts.es:
L. señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz:L Lt.17, distrito D. Yarinacocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es madre D. 1 hijo que aún depenD. D. elL., es casada y su esposo es profesor jubilado. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en L. venta del  producto AVON (producto D. belleza). Tiene 8 años en ManueL. Ramos.
 
En L. actualidad continua con el negocio D. venta D. productos AVON, a L. vez  empezó comprando pollos y gaseosas al por mayor para vender y enviarlo al río Alto Ucayali. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en L. compra D. los  productos AVON, también comprará 100 pollos y 80 cajas D. gaseosas.  

Lidia manifiesta que recibe un apoyo incondicional D. ManueL. Ramos y agradece al banco comunal por L. ayuda y por L. confianza que depositaron en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia belongs to the Las Brisas ("The Breezes") Communal Bank, located at Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz:L Lt.17 in the Yarinacocha District of the Ucayali Department. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of one son. Her husband is a retired teacher, and their son is still a dependent. With her first loan from ManueL. Ramos of 300 soles (about US $100), she decided to buy AVON beauty products. She has been working with ManueL. Ramos for eight years. Lidia still sells AVON products, and has also started to buy chickens and soda in bulk to sell and send to the Alto Ucayali River area. With this loan of 1,800 soles (US $600), which she will repay in four months, Lidia will buy more AVON products, 100 chickens and 80 crates of soda. Lidia says that she receives unconditional support from ManueL. Ramos, and is grateful to the communal bank for the help they have given her and the trust they have placed in her.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon beauty products, 100 chickens and 80 crates of soda

loans.name: Mrs. Phon Loan Group

texts.en:
Five members from Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang province make up this group L.. Mrs. Phon L. is group leader and she owns 2-hectares for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Chheun, is a fisherman who can catch only a little fish because he does not have enough fishing tools. In order to improve his business, his wife decided to ask for a L. to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. Mrs. Phon L. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is three years old.

All the members in this group L. have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the L. until the very end of the L. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the L. term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
D. 41 años y con 1 D. ellos en L. crianza y ventas D. cuy, L. señora María cuenta con una gran predisposición para cualquier tipo D. negocio así como L. fuerza D. voluntad y perseverancia para sacarlo adelante. Tal esfuerzo lo viene realizando años tras año para poder solventar L. educación D. sus 2 menores hijos: D. 16 y 12 años. Volviendo a lo D. su negocio, le está yendo muy bien, lo que ha causado una gran demanda que, lamentablemente, no pueD. abastecer por sí soL..

Con ánimos D. darle el empujón que necesita a su negocio, dándoles así L. oportunidad D. una educación a sus hijos, L. señora María necesita 1000 soles y, así, poder acariciar tan añorada realidad D. unos hijos bien educados.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, and with one year of experience raising and selling guinea pigs, Maria counts on her strong disposition towards any kind of business, as well as her desire and perseverence in improving the quality of life for her family. Her work ethic comes from year after year of effort to pay for the education of her children, ages 12 and 16. Her business is now going very well and she has a lot of customer demand. Unfortunately, she needs some help to meet that demand. She is motivated to give her business the push it needs, so that she can continue to proviD. a good education for her children. She is requesting 1000 soles to invest in her business and help her achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more guinea pigs and feed so that she can continue to invest in her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un solo hijo, y vive en la casa de su suegra. Desde los 20 años se dedica al trabajo en construcción a base de cemento, y hace como 5 años se perfeccionó en enchapados, y también llevó cursos adicionales de pintado, por ello puede realizar los trabajos más exigentes de sus clientes, con acabados impecables.  Le agrada su labor, trabaja con mucho arte y armonía para que el cliente quede satisfecho, y sobre todo trata de ser muy cumplido, cuando recién empezó era difícil, porque las personas no lo conocían, pero ahora reconocen su buen trabajo y lo recomiendan. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y paga en las fechas indicadas sus cuotas. Solicita este dinero para comprar una herramienta cortadora de mayólica, que le ayude a realizar los enchapadas en las lápidas para difuntos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old, has a partner and an only son, and lives in his mother-in-law's house. Since he was 20 years old he has worked in cement construction. About 5 years ago he became real good with veneers and also took additional classes in painted coatings, he now can perform the most demanding jobs for his customers with impeccable finish. He loves his work and performs it with art and harmony so that his customers are satisfied. Above all else he is very courteous. When he fist started it was difficult, because people did not know him, now they know his good work and recommend him. This is his 5th loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he makes his payments on a timely basis. He is requesting this loan to purchase a cutting tool for tile, which will help him make veneers for tomb stones.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his trade.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La Señora Paquita es una socia del Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, vive en la región y provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región, ella tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad, a donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/.  3,000.00 nuevos soles, que pagara en 6  meses, comprará frutas como coconas, plátanos, papayas, granadillas, mangos, shicacashica y demás frutas de la zona, así como también invertirá en ropas, que ya tiene pedidos entre sus clientes, quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año y atender  las exigencias de sus clientes. 

Paquita  tiene  43 años,  tiene 04 hijos, ellos aun dependen de ella por que están estudiando, esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer en su negocio a ella así como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Paquita A. A. is a member of the "Siempre Unidas" ("Always United") communal bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells fruit from the region. She has her stand in the central market of the city, where customers who visit the market come to buy her produce. With this loan of 3000 soles ($975), which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy fruit like cocouts, papayas, passion fruit, mangos, shicacashicas, and other fruit from her region. She will also use the loan to invest in clothes, that her customers have already ordered. She wants to take advantage of the end of the year festivities and attend to the needs of her customers. Paquita is 43 years old and has four children, who are dependent on her because they are studying. She is grateful for the support from Field Partner Manuela Ramos for allowing her business and businesses of other working women to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling diverse fruit from the region.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroeun S. was born in 1974, and she now lives in Chress village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Svay Horn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Since his career is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more bamboo to make palm juice containers for his current business. Thus, Mrs. Sroeun S. decided to ask for a loan for to buy more bamboo for her husband's business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions. She has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for to buy more bamboo for her husband's business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Helena sells plastic products and slippers at Abura, which she has been doing since last year. Her husband is a commercial driver. Helena uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses; her husband takes care of the rest of the family’s financial needs. Helena will use this loan to purchase more plastic products and slippers to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic products and slippers for resale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es socio del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Esteban tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende calzados para todas las edades, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Trujillo y Lima. Además Esteban es maestro constructor, actividad que realiza en sus tiempos libres.
Esteban necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados escolares.
Esteban sueña con tener una tienda en un local propio y tener los ahorros suficientes para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esteban is a member of the community bank “30 de junio”. He has a booth at the Nery Garcia market where he sells shoes for all ages. He gets his products from the cities of Trujillo and Lima. He is also a master builder in his spare time. Esteban needs a loan for 1,000 soles that he will invest in shoes for schoolchildren. He dreams of having his own store and of saving money for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: shoes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia MARIBEL; Es natural del distrito de Calca de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene 39 años  de edad y es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos  de 18 y 3 años.

La socia Maribel solicita el préstamo en razón de que ella tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de carnes rojas, para lo cual el préstamo solicitado le servirá para comprar carnes rojas (vaca, ovinos, alpaca, cordero), esta actividad ella comprarte con sus labores de ama de casa.

Ella esta muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y así mismo esta comprometida con este medio para hacer efectiva su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Maribel is from the Calca district in the Urubamba province. She is 39 years old and lives with her partner and her two children, 18 and 3. In addition to housework, she owns a small business selling red meat. This loan will help her buy more meats (beef, mutton, alpaca, and sheep). She is very grateful for this loan and is dedicated to paying her debts back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell beef, mutton, alpaca and sheep

loans.name: Manju Thapa

texts.en:
Manju Thapa M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery store to upgrade the living standard of her family. She opened her grocery store five years ago. She sells different types of grocery items in her grocery store. She feels proud to help her husband in fulfilling the needs of family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits etc in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 10000.00 to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. Manju Thapa M. lives in a single-family house with her husband and four children. Her husband works in a private office. She has two sons and two daughters. All of them are now studying.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Mavdjigul

texts.en:
Mavdjigul M. has operated a clothing sales business in the market of “Muboriz” in Gissar for 2 years. Enterprising and hardworking, Mavdjigul has succeeded in her business due to her experience and a joyful spirit. With the profits of her business, she supports her parents. Mavdjigul is currently seeking a loan for $500 USD to enlarge the assortment of her clothing. She promises that she will repay the loan in 10 months and thanks everyone for their support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothes for the spring season.

loans.name: Guillermo Agapito

texts.es: El señor Guillermo Agapito Narváez , tiene la edad de 33 años habita en le barrio planes del Arenal , ubicado en le municipio de Nindirí , junto a su esposa , que trabaja  en la costura en su casa de habitación , ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , que actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace cinco años , don Guillermo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de sus tierras . Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para comenzar a sembrar la siembra la espera sea una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
33-year old Guillermo Agapito Narváez lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Arenal, located in the municipality of Nindirí. His wife is a seamstress and works at home. They have three children who currently attend school. In the future they would like to have a better standard of living. Guillermo has worked in agriculture for five years, and the greatest problem that he faces is the lack of credit. He would like to improve the condition of his fields, so he plans to use the loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizers and begin planting his crops. He is hoping for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Fortaleza Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fortaleza RSR” esta  conformado por doce personas y representado por la señora Dominga que al igual que el resto del grupo radica en la zona D. San Nicolás. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a comercio D. productos como verduras frescas, ropa, abarrotes y a la confección D. chompas tejidas a mano, matas y accesorios. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es elevada pero las socias tienen diferentes puntos D. venta en ferias y mercados locales con bajos precios por lo que cuentan con la experiencia para salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercadería y materia prima que ayuD. a incrementar sus ingresos para mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser su primer crédito con la institución la socias ya cuentan con experiencia en créditos grupales gracias a financiamientos D. instituciones financiera similares a al Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The "Fortaleza RSR" group is maD. up of 12 people and represented by Ms. Dominga, who just as the rest of the group lives in the San Nicolas region. Most of the members of the group sell products such as fresh vegetables, clothes, groceries, the confection of hand knitted jumpers, and accessories. The competition in these spaces is high but the partners have different points of sale in fairs and local markets as well as low prices, so they have the experience to succeed. The use of the proceeds is to purchase articles and raw materials that will help increase their income to improve their families' quality of life. Despite this being their first loan with the institution, the partners already have experience with group loans from other financial institutions that are similar to Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Fua

texts.en: Fua I., 21, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the Canteen business.  She sells to village people, school children and the public one day per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~100 USD).  SPBD loans are Fua’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase big fryer, pot, oven, flour, sugar and ingredients for business.

loans.name: Valentín Antonio

texts.es:
Al señor Valentín Antonio G. tiene poco tiempo que le entregaron su casa por medio D. un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta acabados del interior y exterior hay que L. casa esta en muy malas condiciones y no L. pueden abitar. 
   Están solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar los acabados del interior que es poner el cableado D. L. luz ya que no tiene y posterior mente toda L. pintura del exterior, y así poderL. abitar lo más pronto posible. 
   Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera D. su empleo como locutor D. radio. 
Cuando se realizo L. visita a L. vivienda quien nos atendió fue su esposa, L. señora Norma Leticia Mendoza, es L. persona que aparece en L. foto.
texts.en:
A short while ago, Valentín Antonio G. was given a home through a government loan. But, the interior and the exterior of the house are not finished. The house is in very bad condition, and they cannot live there. They are asking for a loan to be able to finish the interior, which is to install the wiring for the lights. Later they will paint the exterior. That way they will be able to live there as soon as possible. He plans to repay the loan with the income generated from his employment as a radio broadcaster. His wife, Norma Leticia Mendoza, is the person in the photo. When they maD. the visit to the house, his wife was there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the wiring in the house

loans.name: Хосият

texts.ru: Одилова Хосият 1948 года рождения. Замужем имеет семерых детей. ЕЕ муж пенсионер.Хосият 3 года является активной клиенткой в МЗФ Микроинвест. Она закупает рыбу и в домашних условиях коптит, сушит, засолевает затем готовую продукцию сдает продавцам на рынке. В этом ей помогают дети и муж. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить рыбу.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы.

loans.name: Cabasan

texts.en:
Cabasan J. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Cabasan is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cabasan owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cabasan has been engaged in her business for over 1 year.

In 2009, Cabasan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cabasan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cabasan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce G. is from the village of Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Joyce is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Joyce owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Joyce has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Joyce joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joyce is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joyce from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meas' Group

texts.en: S. is a group leader of three members, she is teacher of primary school. She lives in thatch roof house alone next to her group members houses. Besides her work, she trade another small daily activity as a rice middle trader from the village to to market sell. She is taking a loan to invest in her rice middle trade for a more income. The other two members are Y. and L. all of them two are the traditional cake sellers.

loans.use: to invest in her rice middle trade for a more income

loans.name: Balabas' Group

texts.en: K. Balabas is a hard-working and devoted leader of his lending group in Kayunga. He is a married man with 5 children. He has been a businessman involved in the motor vehicle transportation business for a long time now. His main business is using his car to transport agricultural produce from the villages to the markets. He transports people that are going to the daily markets as well as any other services that need his attention. At the moment, this is not his personal car but he would like to work hard to ensure that he can have his own vehicle, to increase his savings. Apart from being able to pay school fees for his children, he has been able to acquire household items as well as land that is used by his family to grow food and cash crops. Balabas needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizers and to employ labor on his farm for better production.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and employing labor on his farm for better output.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman S. is a 38-year-old man who has been in business for six years selling market foods such as palm oil, rice, and peppers. He has three children, two of whom attend school, while the third is too young for school. Osman is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to invest in his business, expand his inventory, and grow his income.

loans.use: Expansion of business inventory

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe R. D. L. resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Morena D. 32 años D. edad es madre soltera y vive sola con sus dos hijos Wendy D. 13 años y Marvin D. 7 años D. edad. Esta joven madre trabajadora maneja su propio negocio en productos D. primera necesidad, en su puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. San Martin, son ocho años D. experiencia los que Morena lleva a cargo D. su negocio lo que le permite mantener una estabilidad en clientes que prefieren D. sus productos, el destino del crédito que ella solicita es para incrementar productos para su tienda y así seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe R. D. L. lives in the town of San Martin in the department of San Salvador. She is 32 years old and a single mother of two children, Wendy (age 13) and Marvin (age 7).

This young working mother manages her own business selling basic necessities from her vending post in the San Martin area. Morena has 8 years of experience looking after her business. She has been able to maintain an established clientele who prefer her products. The loan she requested will be used to increase the inventory of her store so that she can continue strengthening her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Percinita

texts.en:
Percinita enjoys taking care of her farm. She is 54 years old and has been married for 36 years now. She has 5 children with her husband Ernesto. Like any other mother, she wants to have a happy home and hopes to improve her family’s living condition.

Percinita joined CEVI in order to benefit from its financial services. She joined in January and is grateful that she gained access to its program. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. The money will be used to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: purchasing farm supplies

loans.name: Valle Del Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Valle del Sol” esta representado por la señora Eufronia y conformada por 10 miembros los cuales se dedican a la comercialización  y venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa interior, celulares, CDs,  comida y a la atención en hostales en el mercado como ambulantes, en algunos poseen puestos fijos habilitados precariamente en sus domicilios. La competencia existe en el mercado pero los socios tienen la capacidad para mover su puesto o diversificar su mercadería para encontrar la forma D. rescatar su capital y obtener la ganancia diaria que necesita su familia para su sustento. El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. capital para realizar compra D. materiales y mercadería para agrandar sus negocios y obtener una mejor y mayor ganancia. En cuanto a la experiencia D. los miembros ellos van cursando su segundo ciclo juntos demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos, cada una D. las socias tiene una visión a futuro D. hacer crecer sus negocios y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Valle del Sol" [Sun Valley] group is represented by Ms. Eufronia. It's maD. up of 10 members that deal in the commercialization and sale of products such as cosmetics, underwear, cell phones, CD's and food. They also offer their services in hostels. They are mostly peddlers, although some have fixed stalls precariously set up in their homes.There's a lot of competition in the market but the members of the group are able to move their stalls and diversify their merchandise in order to find a way to recover their capital and obtain the daily income needed to sustain their family. The loan will be dedicated to increase their capital to purchase prime matter and merchandise to expand their businesses and obtain larger and better earnings. Regarding the experience of the members, they are currently in their second loan cycle together, and they have proved their responsibility and honesty in their repayments. Each of the members has a view of the future in which they make their businesses grow and offer their children a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa.

Rufina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  ropa y así aumentar su mercadería.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Rufina, 52, has been a member of the “Santa Bárbara 2” communal bank, which is in Chucuito district, Puno province and department, for the last 4 years. She is a single mother of one son. She finished elementary school and she is a clothing merchant. Rufina tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now needs 1800 new soles to buy clothing to increase her stock. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and to live in peace and worry-free. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the meetings with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Mamatov

texts.en:
Mamatov O. is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children. O. works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. The role of father, which he has carried out for 15 years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He grows potatoes, onions, carrots, and other kinds of vegetables in his garden. O. dreams of all of his children being well-educated with a bright future. That’s why he works from early morning till late at night. He wants to borrow a loan of 4500 Somoni so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and O. is asking for help from your generous heart.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: In Jesus Name Group

texts.en:
Victoria T., the leader of a group of five borrowers called In Jesus Name, is a 53-year-old widow with four children aged 14 -23 years whose educational levels are 5th – 11th grade. She also cares for a nephew.  Victoria and her family live in the Pipeline community but work in the Red-Light market, the largest market in Paynesville near Monrovia, Liberia. She could not continue her education through 9th grade due to poverty.

Victoria’s business is the sale of quality charcoal by the bag, an enterprise she started with 2000.00 Liberian Dollars as her working capital given to her by her brother. She buys her product from rural Liberia, bringing it to town to be sold in the Red-Light market, the largest market in Liberia. Having operated this business for four years now, she hopes to expand it in the near future. Victoria needs this loan to purchase more charcoal for resale to improve her business, and she dreams of giving her children better education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Victoria is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale to improve her business.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Águilas lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que han ido progresando poco a poco una de ellas es Mariela Cecilia O. M.  quien tiene una carnicería desde hace tres años. Las otras integrantes son  Flora María A. Domínguez quien comercializa nacatamales platillo típico a base de cerdo, maíz, arroz, chiltoma, etc. y Yadira del Carmen Z. vende cosméticos de las marcas Avon y Zermat.

Ellas invertirán el crédito para la compra de mercadería para sus respectivos negocios los cuales desean ver crecer y para ello trabajaran arduamente.
texts.en:
The group Las Águilas is made up of three strong and hard-working women who have been slowly but surely developing their businesses and improving their lives. One is Mariela Cecilia O. M. who has owned and managed a butcher shop for thee years. The other members are Flora María A. Domínguez, who sells nacatamales , a traditional local dish made of pork, corn, rice, red pepper, etc., and Yadira del Carmen Z., who sells Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics. They will use this loan to purchase merchandise for each of their businesses, which they hope will grow. They will work diligently to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Juana Aurora

texts.es:
Esta cliente esta ubicada en la comunidad de Malpaisillo y siempre se ha dedicado ha dar clase en la educacion primaria.
Y ella con los prestamo ha mejorado su nivel de vida  y ha logrado mejorar su casa  y tambien al mejorar su casa para mejorar su negocio que ella tiene para crearle condiciones mejores sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client lives in Malpaisillo and has always been a primary school teacher. The loans have improved her standard of living and have made improvements to her home possible. Also, in improving her home, she also improves the business she has in order to create better conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her home.

loans.name: Sènami T. Carine

texts.fr: K. Sènami T. Carine est née le 29 Juillet 1981 et vit depuis 27 ans environs à Vodjè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Carine est une célibataire qui est mère d'un enfant, scolarisé. Carine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Carine a fréqenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Mais depuis 13 ans, afin de se prendre intégralement en charge, Carine vend des tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou, que Carine achète ses produits. Carine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Carine reçoit des demandes de plus en plus importantes de la part de sa clientèle, mais elle n'arrive plus à répondre à toutes ces demandes. Dans le but d'augmenter le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face aux exigences des clients, Carine sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Carine Sènami T. K. was born on the 29th of July, 1981 and for the past 27 years she has lived around Vodjè, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Carine is single; she is the mother of one child, who is attending school. She lives alone with her child and takes care of her child's needs alone. Carine attended school just until high school. But for the past 13 years, in order to take care of her needs, Carine has sold cloth in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She purchases her products from the market of Missèbo in Cotonou. Carine is an old client of ALIDé and has already received 3 loans, all of which were properly repaid. Carine has growing requests from her clientele, but she has not been able to respond to all of their demands. In order to grow her business and to better respond to her client's needs, Carine is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Mrs. Nirmala T. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur, Nepal. Sanepa is one of the busiest bazaars of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. T. has three daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 12 and the two younger daughters are studying in grade 10 and 8.

Mrs. T. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses (legumes), biscuits and noodles in her shop. Her daughters also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in her area, so she is requesting a loan of NPR 10,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mariscal Sucre Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Mariscal Sucre  está integrada por 11 socios, actualmente  asume el cargo de presidenta la señora  Marta L., quien es casada y tiene 6 hijos, trabaja con  Edaprospo desde hace 3 años y ocho meses
Ella en su pequeño terreno donde habita, se inicio con la crianza y venta de aves (gallinas, patos), su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos balanceados. Posteriormente logra abrir una pequeña Bodega con 5 cajas de cervezas 5 cajas de gaseosas, y poca cantidad de golosinas y abarrotes, al transcurrir el tiempo y viendo la mejoría de su negocio  fue adquiriendo más productos y también la  mejoría en la infraestructura de su vivienda.
A pesar del mal de diabetes  que padece,  sigue adelante  esforzándose cada día más. 
Su actual préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra de mercadería (abarrotes, golosinas) y otros para surtir su bodega 
Marta anhela comprarse un auto para poder trasladar su mercadería del punto donde lo compra para su casa, y sobre todo en apoyar a su hija a de 15 años de edad  en sus estudios secundarios y superiores.
texts.en:
The Mariscal Sucre communal bank is made up of 11 members. Currently holding the position of president is Marta L., who is married and has 6 children. She has worked with Edaprospo for 3 years and eight months. On the small plot of land where she lives, she began by raising and selling birds (hens and ducks). She invested her first loan in buying balanced feed. Later, she was able to open a small store with 5 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft drinks, and a small quantity of snacks and groceries. As time passed and her business grew, she acquired more products and also improved the infrastructure of her home. Despite the fact that she suffers from diabetes, she continues to get ahead by increasing her efforts each day. Her current loan will be invested in buying merchandise (groceries and snacks) and other items to stock her store. Marta's desire for the future is to buy a car so that she can transport her merchandise from the point of sale to her home, and above all to support her 15-year-old daughter in her secondary and university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of groceries for her store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov E. and her husband, Mr. Chor KoE., live in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. They have three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. The third is studying in a local public school. Mrs. Pov E. is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land. On the land, she cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they still need to earn more income. Thus, they want to start a new business, but they do not have enough money to support it. To improve their family's living situation, Mrs. Pov E. is requesting a loan to buy a piece of agricultural machinery. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy agricultural machinery

loans.name: Vicky's Group

texts.en:
Vicky L. is from the town of Macabacle, Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 26 years old and the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vicky is married and has 3 very young children. She owns and operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Vicky has been involved in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Vicky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a business vehicle. This will be the first loan taken out by Vicky from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of planks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor vida. En los verdes campos del poblado de Zona Patria (Distrito de la provincia de Chanchamayo), Lucia tiene sus cultivos de café, en donde se dedica a sus plantas todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima, puesto que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 25 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es cuidarlos de las plagas, ya que a veces lo perjudican en la producción. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para ampliar su  producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old; she is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with her 4 loving children and what she wishes for most is to give them a better quality of life. In the green fields of the Zona Patria town (District province of Chanchamayo), Lucia has her coffee crops. Every morning despite weather conditions she takes care of her plants since it is the only source of income for her family. What she enjoys most is working her land and she does it very carefully. Lucia has 25 years of experience and considers that the most difficult part is protecting the crops from plagues since they hurt production. In the future, she hopes to buy more land to increase production. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is saving to pay her quotas on time since she does not want to cause problems to the other members of her communal bank, where she is very happy. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy more fertilizers to protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertlizers to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar lives in the small city of Chichawatni Pakistan. 
She is the mother of five children. Three of them work while the other two are getting an education.


She is a housewife and takes care of her home and family. She is very supportive of her family and is always ready to help her husband and sons if they face difficulties. 


One of her sons is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw needs to be repaired but his income is not high enough to pay the maintenance charges. So, Parveen is applying for a loan from Asasah to help her son repair his auto rickshaw. 


She always loves to see smiles on the faces of her children and she is sure that this help will make her son’s life easier and will put a smile on his face.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Bertha es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora de su propio negocio, tiene la edad de 33 años, con dos hermosos hijos, su esposo es albañil.
Desde hace varios años comienza a vender ropa y zapatos con el objetivo de aportar en los gastos de su hogar ya que solo con el trabajo de su esposo no da, ya que la canasta básica ah incrementado.
Lo que desea es  aumentar la compra de ropa, logrando captar clientes nuevos como aumentar sus ventas. Comprando variedad de estilo de mujer como caballero, ropa de niño, y cosméticos.
Contenta por que podrá dar otro jiro a su negocio ya esta logrando con el apoyo de la institución. Y que será de muchos beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is a hard working woman, and owner of her own business. She is 33 years old, with two beautiful children. Her husband is a builder. Several years ago she started to sell clothes and shoes with the goal of contributing to the household expenses as the work of her husband alone is not enough, since the basic food basket has increased. What she wants is to increase the purchase of clothes, and manage to gain new customers to increase her sales. Buying a variety of women's styles as well as men's, children's, and cosmetics. She is happy because she will be able to give a new focus to her business as she is managing to already with the support of the institution. And it will be of great benefit to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy women's, men's, and children's clothes and cosmetics to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Juliry

texts.en:
Juliry P. is currently in the business of selling fruit like pineapples, pears, jackfruit (fruit of a tree in the mulberry family) and green vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pears and jackfruit to sell.

Juliry is 41 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To stock more pears and jackfruit to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 29 years old. To make a living, Michael owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Michael has been engaged in his business for over 5 years.

Michael joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Michael is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Michael from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kadévi

texts.fr: kadévi est un homme  de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. il est chauffeur, voulant gagner plus de revenu il s'est lancé en 2000 dans l'élevage et le commerce de lapin. ce commerce marche bien pour lieu. il vend les lapins à de grands restaurant de la place. il sollicite un premier crédit chez WAGES pour acheter 10 sacs de son cubé, 30 cages pour les lapins et divers.
texts.en:
Kadévi is 33 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a driver. Wishing to increase his income, in 2000 he started breeding rabbits for sale. This business has been going well for him. He sells rabbits to big local restaurants. He is seeking his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 bags of bran cubes [feed], 30 cages for rabbits and other miscellaneous items.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing feed and supplies necessary for breeding rabbits

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy N. is a married woman who lives in Gingaw, Central Tabao, Zone 4, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living selling fish. Her husband, Johny N. Sr., who is 66 years old, helps with his wife's business and works as a fish vendor. They have 11 children who are 19 to 41 years old. Nancy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Nancy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her increase her monthly profit to 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fish vending business. She plans to continue to save up for future home repairs. Nancy N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia S. is from the city of GANGO OZAMIZ CITY. She is 57 years old. Emelia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she has for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Emelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en: Willis is 32 years old and a member of 'Amani Pumwani' group in Faulu Kenya.  He irons second-hand clothes before they are sold.  He has been running the business for eight years.  He also runs a retail shop so as to boost his income.  He has been able to serve his customers well because he has been trained by Faulu Kenya in good customer care.  He hopes to start a business selling second-hand shoes hence he has requested 20,000 Kes to buy shoes.  He describes himself as a hardworking, honest and God-fearing man.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is married and has five dependents. She has been through senior high school. Rose sells smoked fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Rose uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Rose will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to further her children's education.

In this photo, Rose is standing beside her traditionally-built oven, showing the fish she has smoked for the day.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ruri Mae

texts.en:
Ruri Mae, 24, is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till a farm to raise money for the entire family's needs. She is doing the best she can to be a good mother and a good wife. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks who charge higher interest rates.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with one child, who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent. 

She has operated a pharmacy shop for the last three years, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her pharmacy inventory in the future. 

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase packets of medicine, a glass mirror and building materials to renovate her pharmacy. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine, a glass mirror and building materials to renovate her pharmacy.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Laura is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of coconuts and bananas in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Laura is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka S. is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai.  She is married with no children. To make a living, Eka operates a family member's fishing business — primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. Eka has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 310 WST a month.

In 2008, Eka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD and is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST to rent a fishing boat. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eka from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to rent a fishing boat

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is the wife of M. H. and she lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house and lives with her family in the area Zia Nagar. A very active and talented lady, Manzooran operates an embroidery business in her home. Despite her old age, she does this work to support her family financially. She enjoys doing her work. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes. Many girls in the community come to her to learn her embroidery skills as well which gives her excitement and happiness. 
 
Her husband is in the business of selling sanitary supplies. He runs a shop in the market where he sells sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes, etc. to his customers for a profit. He also knows sanitary fitting services which he offers to his clients. Both of them are very hardworking and manage their businesses well. They want to set a good legacy for their children so they feel proud of them. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a larger quantity of sanitary supplies to put in his shop for sale. She is hopeful that this investment will take her husband's business to a more profitable position.
 
Note: In the photo, Manzooran is the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy more sanitary supplies for sale

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en:
Rodolfo T. is from the village of Nagbukel, San Isidro. He is 47 years old and the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rodolfo T. group.

Rodolfo is married and has 4 school-aged children. He owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP when he sells one of his raised animals.

In 2009, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase feed and other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila C. is from the village of Serran, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 53 years old and widowed with three adult children. Lucila owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2011 Lucila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods. This will be the first loan taken out by Lucila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & snack foods to sell

loans.name: Maksat's Group

texts.en:
Maksat A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised seven sons. Five sons are married, four of them are working in Russia and the others work in a café. 

Maksat and her husband have been engaged in farming for a long time. They cultivate potatoes and corn. By selling part of their harvest they make an additional 7,500 KGS per month.
