With money received from the loan, Maksat will purchase mineral fertilizers for farming. In the future she wants to see her two younger sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Johanna Sagun's Group

texts.en:
Johanna S. is 26 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Calaocan within Angadanan municipality, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Johanna raises pigs for fattening and sale. She is just starting this business.

Johanna is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, Johanna joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Johanna is requesting a new loan, her second from ASKI, of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other related supplies

loans.name: Angel Armando

texts.es: Angel Armando M.:de 51 años inicio su negocio hace 20 años comenzo vendiendo articulos de usos momesticos pequeños como sabanas,ponchitos,vajillas,etc con el transcurso del tiempo las ventas han aumentado y ahora el solicita un credito para poder Comprar mas productos de usos domesticos y asi formalizar su comercial y vender articulos mas grandes y poder tener sus vendedores y cobradores ya que abarca gran parte de su municipio agradece a Dios primero y a su familia por el gran apoyo que le han brindado para poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Angel Armando M. is 51 years old and it was 20 years ago that he started his business, selling various household items such as bed sheets, ponchos, dinner ware, etc.  With the passage of time his sales increase and today he requests a loan to purchase more household products. He wants to make his business more formal and to carry larger items and to have salespeople and accounts receivable to supply a large part of his community. He is firstly thankful to God and to his family for the great support that he has received to find success.

loans.use: to purchase home products for resale

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en: Jenty P. is 35 years old. She is currently in the business of a food market. She is married to a soldier, and they have five children. Three of them are receiving schooling. Her future goal is to build a house for rent.

loans.use: stock more foods int the market for resale

loans.name: Tawapaneh Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of the “Tawapaneh Group.” They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The group has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to request a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member. The loan will be used to improve the size and quality of their individual businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed T.. He is 28 years old and was born in a village called Konta. Mohamed is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are not yet school-going age. For the past nine years, Mohamed has sold sweets, biscuits, chewing gum, batteries, cigarettes, etc. With his share of this loan, Mohamed is going to expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to increase his store inventory.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, gum, batteries, and cigarettes to increase store inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la comunidad de Arin departamento del Cusco(Perú), tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto con su único hijo, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. 

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive, han sido en la vida de Elizabeth un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Ella viaja y lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Quillabamba los días jueves y viernes.  

Elizabeth solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, comprará abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the community of Arin in the department of Cusco in Peru.  She is 27 years old.  She is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her only son, who is her motivation for all of her efforts.

The green fields of the community of Arin, located in the Valle Sagrado de los Incas, where she lives currently, have been a nice place to work for Elizabeth.  Since she was very young, her parents taught her this work, and now she has her own land where she works with her partner.  With great care, they grow vegetables and also raise small animals.  The thing she likes best about her work is harvesting her land, because she feels that her hard work has been worthwhile.  She has done this work for many years, and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the collection centers in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco.  She travels and brings her products to the city of Quillabamba on Thursdays and Fridays.

Elizabeth is asking for this loan to realize one of her plans, which is to increase her business in raising animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She has an obligation to make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so because she wants to take another loan.  She is thankful to the institution for giving her the loan.  With the loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira D. 63 años D. edad, es casada sin carga familiar, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Chepén, la misma que pertenece al departamento D. la Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Elvira es ha la venta D. todo tipo D. productos para el consumo diario D. las personas (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas, etc), en su propio domicilio desD. hace varios años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa pueD. atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse D. otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos diarios.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño D. Elvira es tener más adelante una tienda mayorita que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Elvira is 63 years old, married, and does not have any dependents.  She owns her own home which has water and electricity services and is located in Chepén district, in La Libertad department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and work in tourism.

Elvira's business activity is selling all kinds of essential household products (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, soda, etc).  She makes her sales from her home and has been in this business for several years.  As her business is located in her home, she is able to serve in it at any time which allows her to differentiate herself from other stores and she is thereby able to make more income with which to cover her daily expenses.

Elvira has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and she will use it to buy a larger quantity of merchandise and expand her business with other products once her sales increase.  Elvira's dream for the future is to own a wholesale store which will make her more income and enable her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Takuru” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Issa. Issa was born in a town call Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 32 years of age. Issa is married and has 3 children – 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Issa has been a businessman for 21 years. He sells used clothes. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business. 

The inset photo is a snapshot of Santigie, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Margelina Anaelva

texts.es:
Las señora Margelina es socia del banco comunal La Positiva del distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo.
Lleva tres años perteneciendo al banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda bien surtida instalada en su casa, la misma que hace poco implementó, solo tiene un hijo y tiene tiempo como para atenderlo sin ningún contratiempo.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevo comprará: 4 cientos de platos descartables, 3 cientos de vasos descartables, 3 cientos de cucharas descartables, 2 cientos de tenedores descartables, 2 cientos de fuentes descartables, 2 cientos de copas descartables, 2 paquetes de servilletas.
Esta vez quizo agregar este nuevo producto (descartables) en su tienda para poder surtirlo un poco más.  Nos dice que en cada ciclo ira comprando más cosas para abastecerla más.
Solo espera que Manuela Ramos siga ayudando a las mujeres trabajadoras que quieran surgir y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Margelina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Positiva” (The Positive) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child.

Margelina has been part of the Communal Bank for three years. She sells groceries and has a store established in her house. Over time she has been able to keep it in operation. Since she only has one child, she has the time to look after him without any problems.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, Margelina will buy 400 disposable plates, 300 disposable glasses, 300 disposable spoons, 200 disposable forks, 200 disposable serving dishes, 200 disposable cups, and 2 packets of napkins. At this moment, she wants to add new disposable products to the inventory of her store so that she can be stocked with more products. She says that with each loan cycle, she is able to buy more products to add to her inventory.

Her only hope is for Manuela Ramos to continue helping working women who want to improve and succeed.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of disposable products.

loans.name: Juamonie

texts.en:
Juamonie is 28 year- old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Juamonie has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON.

Juamonie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juamonie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlinda is 43 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married, with 3 children. To earn a living, Merlinda has a business selling fresh fruits. She earns about PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. Merlinda has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase fresh fruits to sell.  Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Benkola I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA I sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  43 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées par ces femmes du groupe BENKOLA I sont le riz, le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA  qui est la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola I Group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have six children. They live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, millet and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Awa, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Awa expects to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benita Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Benita es soltera, tiene 43 años, tiene una hija de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela.
Anteriormente ella era empleada en un supermercado, gracias a sus trabajos anteriores y con los ahorros que pudo juntar abrió para su propia despensa en el mercado, después cambio de ramo dedicándose a la compra y venta de ropas usadas y nuevas, en lo cual se desempeña actualmente. Cuenta con varios clientes que de forma habitual compran de ella las prendas que vende.
Le gustaría seguir creciendo en el área comercial ya que ella se considera una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ansias de salir adelante. Le gustaría que su hija culmine sus estudios ya que ella no pudo estudiar por ser madre soltera y que pueda ampliar más su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación de invierno, con lo cual podrá abastecer su stock de mercaderías. Está contenta por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da.
texts.en:
Benita is single, 43 years old, and has an 11 year old daughter who's studying in school.

Previously she was an employee at a supermarket. Thanks to her previous jobs and the savings she saved up, she opened her own store in the market. Afterwards she changed areas, making a living buying and selling new and used clothing, which she currently does. She relies on several customers that regularly buy the clothing she sells.

She would like to continue growing in the commercial area as she considers herself a very entrepreneurial woman with a yearning to get ahead. She would like her daughter to complete her studies as she couldn't study since she was a single mother and would like her business to be able to expand.

She is requesting the loan to purchase winter clothing with which to supply her merchandise stock. She is happy for the opportunity that the Fundación has given her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for future sales.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: En la ciudad de Masaya, reside doña  María Inés S.. Casada con dos hijos menores, trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias. Ella se ha preocupado por mantener su negocio y así siempre mantener la venta diaria ya que del negocio ha podido darles los estudios y alimentación a sus hijos. La señora tiene la necesidad de comprar  mercadería para surtir el negocio con productos que el cliente necesita y el crédito ayudara al negocio para surtirlo con mas variedad de productos y así brindarle al cliente un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Maria Ines S. lives in the city of Masaya, she is married and has two children, she works hard to provide for their needs.  She has worked to keep her business and maintain the daily sales, from the business she has been able to provide education and food to her children.  She needs to buy merchandise to stock the business with products that the clients need and the loan will help her to stock with a variety of products to provide clients with better service.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soda, oil, gatorade, nevax paper, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Behzod

texts.ru: Бехзод умный и добросовестный муж. Он занимается услугой перевозкой пассажиров на местном городе. Он еще предоставляет услуги перевозкой молодожены для свадебных мероприятий и загса. Более 2 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и от этого получает хороший доход. Его автомобиль находиться в хорошем состояние, и этот бизнес является единственным источником его дохода. Бехзод хотел бы получить займ для покупки запчастей и автошин для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Behzod is a smart and conscientious husband.  He is involved in providing passenger transportation services in his local town.  He also provides transportation services for newlyweds for wedding events and registry office.  He has been in this business for two years and earns a good income from it.  His car is in good condition, and this business is his sole source of income.  Behzod wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of auto parts and tires for this car.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and tires

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A. is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives in Bint Jbeil. A. has intermediate education. 

A. provides a service: He does construction work for hire. A. specializes at painting work. He has been in this business for 11 years already. These 11 years of experience have helped a lot in gaining customers' trust and encouraging more customers. 

He is asking for a loan to buy special construction machines and materials, such as a compressor and iron pillars necessary for his business.

With his requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, he will be able to continue expansion of his business and further increase his productivity.
 
In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: To buy special construction machines and materials.

loans.name: Bidii Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii OAF Group in Western Kenya! Ahmed is the facilitator of Bidii OAF group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ahmed takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ahmed had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Ahmed was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ahmed and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ahmed will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii OAF group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: California Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALIFORNIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Claudia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de salchipapas, tienda de abarrotes, elaboración y venta de gorras, pensión.

La señora Claudia  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de un amigo.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “CALIFORNIA” are beginning their fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer [For Women], as part of the Patacamaya regional office. It is made up of eight members and it is run by a board of directors among whom is Señora Claudia, the president. The members of the communal bank have various different businesses, among which are: a neighborhood store, selling salchipapas, a grocery store, making and selling hats and a guesthouse.

Señora Claudia states that this is her first time to work in Pro Mujer and that she joined the group after being invited by a salesperson. She currently has a neighborhood shop in which she has been working for the past four years, having learnt the trade from a friend.

The loan is being taken out to increase her resources (to buy noodles, rice, sugar, etc.) which she will get from La Paz and subsequently sell in her store. This type of works allows her to generate an income that supports her family as she lives with her partner and she has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the loan training and the advice.

loans.use: to buy noodes, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 43-year-old woman who is married with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary.

Heyam wants to change her old home furniture and purchase new items such as: living room seats, dinning room furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Heyam gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and improve her family's living conditions. Heyam is a conservative woman, so her husband Adel is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de  22 años es un hombre soltero y responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Bernardina y su hermano Rubén en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. A pesar de su corta edad, trabajó con ahínco para tener lo que ahora posee. Terrenos productivos, 5 parcela medianas, además de una moto y un televisor. Sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura, con la siembra de papa y maíz, los cuales cuida con esmero. Asimismo la elaboración de leña, que es donde obtiene mayores ganancias, cuenta que vende un promedio de 7 millares al mes, con ello obtiene un dinero extra para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Además desea estudiar, aunque no tenga las posibilidades. Pues vive muy alejado de la ciudad, planea con el tiempo ahorrar lo necesario para lograr su objetivo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para así pedir nuevos crédito futuros. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Víctor de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios árboles para elaborar leña.
texts.en:
Victor, 22, is single and responsible. He lives with his mom, Bernardina, and his brother, Ruben, in the home they own in the village of Tapo. In spite of his young age, he worked hard to achieve what he has now: farmland, 5 plots, as well as a motorcycle and a television. His main business is farming; he plants potatoes and corn which he takes good care of. He also makes firewood to earn additional income. He sells 7,000 a month on average, which gives him extra money to help with their household expenses. He also wants to study, though he doesn't have the chance because he lives very far from the city. His plan is to save over time what he needs to meet his goal. 

He belongs to the group "Santa Rosa" and this is his first loan with MFP. He hopes that you will help him to realize his plans. On his part, he promises to make his payments, so as to receive additional loans in the future. He is grateful to be a part of this association because all of the members are responsible and united. Victor will invest the requested loan in the purchase of some trees to make firewood.

loans.use: to buy trees to make firewood.

loans.name: Nym

texts.en: Nym, 24, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Nym is employed at a factory and her husband is a construction worker. Nym is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase groceries to sell when she stops working at the garment factory. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa tiene 49 años de edad, vive en barrio la providencia de la ciudad de choluteca y se dedica a la venta de comida como ser desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, tambien vende ropa usada, su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico en donde transitan muchas personas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de comidas y ropa usada, en esta epoca de navidad se vende bastante la ropa y desea tener variedad para tener mayores ganancias.
Junto a ella vive su esposo y su hijo, por quien trabaja muy fuerte para sacarlo a delante, dandole una buena educacion y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old.  She lives in La Providencia neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca, and her business is selling food (breakfasts, lunches and sweet treats).  She also sells used clothing.  Felipa's business is in a strategic location and there are a lot of passersby.

Felipa will use her loan to buy food and used clothing.  During the Christmas season, Felipa sells quite a lot of clothes and she would like to have a good variety available so that she can make more profits.

Felipa lives together with her husband and her son.  She works very hard in order to get her son ahead in life and provide him with a good education and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, oil, beans, eggs, tortillas, seasonings and used clothing

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Taguitic, Lanao del Sur, Philippines. Jerry owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this work.

He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jerry wants to save money so that he has a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel  tiene 23 años es soltero, vive con los padres. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache,Tiene una hija.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
23-year-old José Manuel is single and lives with his parents. He lives in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Cantón Mocache, and he has one daughter.

The community bank 'El Progreso' is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, and the members work with short cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

José Manuel farms corn and rice. He purchases his products in Mocache and sells his crops at Mocache market. 

He has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for his crops. The loan will help him to increase his family's income and invest in growing his crops. His dream is to buy land.

In his spare time, José Manuel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for growing crops.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Beth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Beth has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Beth to generate greater profits and boost the business. Beth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shopping mall. 

Beth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale,

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: She has managed to expand her business, she is now dealing with a larger area of customers who come to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Aharon

texts.en: This young farmer is 28 years old and with his parents he lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. His name is Aharon. He used to do hired constructional works but now he is busy only with farm works, which he manages very cleverly and with great pleasure. In his farm he has cows, a calf, pigs, sheep and chickens. With his mother Aharon sells his farm products right from his farm; he sells milk, meat, cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and eggs. Land cultivation is also part of his every day work in his farm and Aharon from his land collects good harvest of potato, tomato and cucumber for sale. This young man is full of energy and a lot of new plans of his farm development. With this Kiva loan of 600.000 he decided to buy one more cow for his farm and also a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and also a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Kyaziike Joan is a remarkable young woman. She is very responsible and dedicated even for her young years. She joined Life in Africa in November of 2005 and has been an active member being employed by the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She has just finished her secondary schooling and she now longs to go on to the University to complete her education.

She lives at home with her parents and she is the eldest of their four children. Her father's income in somewhat unsteady so she gladly helps financially using her salary. Her father wisely worked hard and built a two room house next to their family home. This is rented out and the income from this rental has paid the school fees for Joan so far. However, the University fees are much higher and they are looking at ways to increase their income to provide for this.

The plan is to add two more rooms to the existing house. This will double the amount of rent they will earn. Housing is in great demand in Kampala so they know they will have no problem finding tenants. The money from this rental will be used to pay the University fees for Joan's education and for her younger siblings who will follow her. She has carefully saved as much of her salary as she could and has 400,000 to put into this project. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to complete it. She will be able to repay this loan in 10 months.

Below is her break down.

1: 16 Iron sheets @------11000------------176,000/

2: 16 bags of cement @--------18500-------296,000/

3: 4000 bricks @--------------60----------240,000/

4:15 Pieces of timber for roofing 8(3x4)-3000-24,000/

7(4x2) -----5000------35,000/

5: 2 trips of sand @---------60000-------120,000/

6: 2 windows @ 10,000-------------------20,000/

7: 1 door ----------------------29,000/

8: Labuor ------------------------------200,000/

9: Transporting materials to the site-- 60,000/

Total ------------------------------1,200,000/

WE Team to benefit:Internet4change Team

loans.use: Buying materials to expand tenant's room

loans.name: Astolfo

texts.en:
Astolfo has 18 years of experience in this business. He makes roofs for houses, sliding doors, folding screen room partitions, and windows. He learned this business when he worked in a factory. When the factory was liquidated, he bought some of the machinery and started his own workshop. For the past five years he has been running his own business, which is open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM, depending on the urgency of the orders he is working on. He has two employees who help him. The business has been growing bit by bit and he has invested all of his earnings in heavy machinery.

He needs the loan to buy raw materials, such as iron. He would especially like to produce windows that he could showcase at his shop.

Astolfo was born in Simón Bolívar-Juian. He is 49 years old and is married. His wife works in the home. Astolfo is a hard-working and responsible person. Thanks to his hard work, he has his own house that is built of cement and he also is the owner of his place of business. He has been able to manage his finances very well. His hope is to maintain his business and that it will prosper so that he will be able to provide jobs to other people.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Astolfo tiene 18 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Él elabora: techos para casas, puertas corredizas, acordeones para casas, ventanas. Él aprendió esta actividad cuando trabaja en una fábrica. Cuando lo liquidaron compro unas máquinas y monto su propio taller. Desde hace 5 años esta con su propio negocio que lo atiende de 6:00 AM a 6:00PM todo depende de la urgencia de entrega. Tiene 2 empleados que le apoyan. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, toda su ganancia las ha invertido en el negocio comprando sus maquinarias pesadas.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima que es el hierro y desea producir especialmente ventanas y exhibirlas en su local.

Astolfo nació en Simón Bolívar-Jujan. Tiene 49 años. Esta casado. Su esposa no trabaja pero le apoya en el hogar. Astolfo es una persona trabajadora, responsable en sus actividades. Gracias a su esfuerzo él tiene casa propia y actualmente es de cemento y además el local del negocio es propio. Él ha podido manejar muy bien sus finanzas. Su deseo es seguir con su negocio que siga prosperando y poder dar trabajo a otros.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as iron and solder.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Doris A. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells "kenkey", which is a fermented food. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
A 28-year-old mother of two children who are students, Soeun K. T. lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the entire family income, she runs a tailoring business and makes on average about $6/day, while her husband drives a passenger trailer attached to a motor-bike and typically makes about $3 each day.

In order to maximize profit, Soeun K. T. has an idea to replace the trailer to a car so that she can make much more revenue. To do so , she is currently requesting a loan amount of $1200. Combined with her savings, she thinks it enables her to purchase a simple car for her husband to operate a taxi business which offers a big amount of profit in return. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a simple car to operate a taxi business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Tatyana has operated a kiosk selling kitchenware in the central market of Melitopol. With her husband’s assistance, Tatyana has developed a successful business and a strong clientele base. Tatyana is cheerful and hardworking. With her hard-earned profits, Tatyana supports her daughter’s college education as well as her elderly parents.

An established client of Nadiya Ukraine, Tatyana has repaid all microloans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a $500 loan to re-supply her inventory. With the additional profits, Tatyana plans to expand her profitable business.

loans.use: Re-supply inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more display cases for breads and sweetbreads.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca I. is 42 years old, a married mother of 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and has been in business since 1991. She has been a member of LAPO for 4 years.  She is in need of $475 to enable her buy foodstuffs, which she hopes to cook for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy G. sells milk from her shop. She wishes to add an awning to the shop and buy more milk to sell.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To add an awning to her shop

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia Chavarría A. is a young married woman with 2 school age children. Her business is vegetable sales. She's had this business for 5 years. She comments that from the time she was very young she worked selling in the streets while she was studying in school. When she married she wasn't able to continue studying because she had to look for a way to earn a living and give her children her support.

Ana founded the business 5 years ago and reports that it has always gone well for her, since she has the right character to tend to clients and provide them the best possible service. Ana has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. She feels very satisfied with the loans she has received, since they have been provided to her at the ideal moment, helping her to restock her business and satisfy her clients every day. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Patricia C. A., es una joven casada y con 3 hijos en edad escolar. El negocio de esta señora es la venta de verduras, tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta que desde muy pequeña a ella siempre se dedicó a vender en las calles y al mismo tiempo estudiaba pero cuando se casó no pudo continuar estudiando porque en estas circunstancias tenia que buscar la forma de sobrevivir y darle a sus hijos su apoyo.

Este negocio lo comenzó hace cinco años y nos cuenta que siempre le ha ido bien ya que tiene buen carácter para atender a su clientela y brindarle la mejor atención posible. Ana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of  vegetables

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa has a store in the central market of the city. She sells curtains and the fabrics used to make Tajikistan's national dresses. The dresses are very beautiful and bright, and a popular and an important item of the dowry of any girl. She has run her business for about nine years. It is successful and providing a stable and significant income for her family.

Two or three times a month, Sharifa travels to the neighboring city to purchase goods. She will use this loan to increase her inventory by purchasing fabric and curtains.

Sharifa is 35 years old and married with three children. She thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make and sell national dresses and curtains

loans.name: Eno

texts.en:
Eno operates a very successful red-red stand outside of Kumasi. Red-red is a popular Ghanaian dish that consists of Ghanaian cowpeas (black-eyed peas), palm oil, and red chilies. Eno operates near several schools, and her young customers often line up to try her delicious food. In an average day, she estimates she sells 500 servings from her small stand.

She believes that her shop's success is due to the care she takes to purchase and use quality products. She told us that she cooks the food as if she's cooking for her own family.

Eno is married and has 2 children. She hopes to begin buying larger quantities of her products to begin stockpiling and guard against price increases. In addition, by not buying products on credit, she can buy the products at a lower price.

Eno is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

Eno is pictured in the brown dress. Next to her is her Sinapi loan officer, Annastasia.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and palm oil for her red-red stand

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 65 years and is married to Angel Benitez (who is also 65); Inocencia’s husband works as a driver. The couple has five children who all graduated from college. Inocencia and Angel knew that they needed to work very hard to give their sons a good education. That motivated Inocencia to open her shop thirty years ago; she called it “Despensa Rios”.

Inocencia saw a great business opportunity because there was a lack of mini supermarkets in her neighborhood. Now she has many customers who know her very well, and every time they need something they go to the “Despensa Rios”.

In rural areas of Paraguay, despensas are a meeting point where people not only do their shopping but also gather and gossip. The money provided by this loan would be used to buy more products for the shop, including sugar, yerba, rice, pasta, bread, milk, and cheese.

loans.use: To purchase products for a general store, including sugar, yerba, rice, pasta, bread, milk, and cheese

loans.name: Yavi

texts.fr:
Born in Adokpoe in 1962, Mrs. Yavi A. presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). She is married and the mother of 3 children. Since her parents were not financially able to send her to school, she began working at a young age in agriculture and the processing of manioc into the flour commonly known as "gari". Her husband, who is also a farmer, contributes more or less to supporting the family. In order to help him, Mrs. A. is asking for a loan to expand her manioc-processing business and enlarge her field of corn and manioc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1962 à Adokpoe, Madame A. Yavi vit actuellement à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Mariée, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants. Ses parents n’ayant pas les moyens pour la scolariser, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’agriculture et la transformation du manioc en farine communément appelé « gari ». Son mari cultivateur aussi contribue tant bien que mal à la charge familiale. Pour le soutenir, Madame A. sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son activité de transformation et agrandir son champ de maïs et de manioc.

loans.use:
Processing manioc into flour and enlarging manioc and corn field

Transformation de manioc en farine et agrandisement du champ de manioc et mais

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas C. Lim and her husband raise ducks to produce eggs. Together they earn approximately $6 per day from the sale of these duck eggs. She raises the ducks behind her house in Toul Damnak Village, Kampong Thom Province.

C. is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase duck food to feed the ducks she raises.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for her ducks

loans.name: Ranty

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranty L. lives in Kraing Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 44 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. She buys rice in bulk which she later sells at a better price.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Ranty L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more husk-rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Saveuorn Nhoeb, rears pigs in the local village. Mrs. Ranty L. obtained a previous loan from AMK to buy piglets for her husband's business and she fully repaid that loan. Mrs. Ranty L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more husk-rice to hold in stock and sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Madame H. Bernadette est née en 1950 à Agbanakin. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle pratique le commerce d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 25 ans.

Actuellement, son pouvoir d’achat très limité ne lui permet plus de faire face aux multiples besoins élémentaires de sa famille. C’est dans la perspective d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin de dégager un bénéfice conséquent pour répondre aux besoins sans cesse croissants de ses enfants qu’elle sollicite un prêt.

Ce crédit lui servira également de fonds de roulement indispensable à l’exercice de son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Madame Bernadette H. was born in 1950 in Agbanakin. The married mother of four children, she has traded in basic foodstuffs for more that 25 years.

As of now, her limited purchasing power no longer allows her to meet her family's many basic needs. She is requesting a loan with an eye to improving her purchasing power, in order to turn larger profits and meet the ever-growing needs of her children.

This loan will likewise serve as working capital vital to her commercial activity.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Narcisa Silvia

texts.es: La señora Narcisa R., tiene 43 años de edad, es casda, tiene dos hijos, la mayor tiene 21 años de edad cursa el tercer años de la carrera de trabajo social en la universidad, y su otro hijo tiene 8 años de edad cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer para la alcaldia municipal de leon, la señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad dando inicio como una herencia de su señora madre quien se dedico a esta actividad tambien, su sueño ha sido poder ampliar y mejorar su condiciones de trabajo ya que ella solo trabaja con una pequeña maquina sencilla de pedal confeccionando delantares, juego de cubre camas, cobertores y fundas, la cual comercializa a personas que tradicionalmente le han comprado, con el financiamiento ella lo utiliza para la compra de materia prima como tela de esta manera ir adquiriendo un poco mas ganancias e ir dandole estudios a sus hijos, pero tiene la esperanza que ira ampliando su pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
Narcisa R. is 43 years old, she is married, has two children, the oldest is 21 years old and is in her third year of university studying to become a social worker, her son is eight years old and is in 3rd grade of elementary school, her husband works as a driver for the municipal government of leon. Narcisa has worked in her business for 25 years; she started with inheritance money from her deceased mother, who also worked in this activity. Her dream is to expand and improve her working conditions, because she only works with a small sewing machine to design and create aprons, bed sets, blankets and covers, which she sells to her usual clients. With the loan she will buy materials such as fabric, this way she will slowly generate more income and provide studies to her children, she hopes to expand her small sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase materials

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey R. P., 38, is a widow and lives in Phnom Penh with her child and her elderly mother. She has a business renting out rooms from her house and selling fried bananas to earn a living and is able to make US$ 8 each day. Mrs. Chey would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to build more rooms to rent out.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Akoele N. est une jeune femme couturière à Atakpamé, une ville située à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir et des mèches pour la commercialisation. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Akoele N. is a young seamstress in Atakpamé, a town situated about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one child. With this loan she wants to buy a dryer and some hair extensions to sell. That will allow her to earn more money so as to participate in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a dryer and hair extensions for re-sale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 33 years old, is a mother of three children (Alvin, 15; Esterika, 8; John Paul, 5) and the wife of Arnel, a tricycle operator. They are living in the urban area of Barangay Compania Tumauini, Isabela.

In order to support their family’s needs, Rowena engaged in "bangus" (milkfish) and barbecue selling. She has been in this business since 1998 and it is really her dream to make her business grow. However, her weekly gross income of Php2,500 is just enough to maintain her business and provide for the family's needs. Rowena applied for a loan of Php8,000 to buy a large volume of milkfish and maintain her barbecue business. She believes that if she could properly use the money in her business, her dreams of a successful business and the realization of her children's college education will all come true because she will be able to earn more profit and save more.

Rowena said that she has to sacrifice and be patient in order to maintain her business so that they will have a progressive life someday. Through the success of her business, Rowena is able to pay her weekly amortizations and monthly bills. “The financial assistance to be given to us is of great help to those people in dire need like me," she added.

loans.use: Buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Ruty

texts.en:
Ruty is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros (“Our Father of Miracles”) Village Bank.  Ruty is 30 years old and widowed with one daughter. Ruty and her mother have a stand at the front door of their house, where they sell baby clothes and different kinds of hats, as well as seasonal items like flags, talcum powder and colorful leis (both used during Carnaval—people are soaked with water balloons, then covered in talcum powder). Ruty’s house is located on a busy street in the city of Ayacucho. 
 Ruty needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy paintings and stuffed animals.  Ruty dreams of expanding her business, of buying her own home, and of providing her daughter with a good education. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ruty es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Los Milagros. 
Ruty es viuda, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Ruty tiene un puesto en la puerta de su casa que esta ubicada en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa de bebe, gorras, sombreros, y en temporadas dependiendo de la demanda vende banderas, talcos, serpentinas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. 
Ruty necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadros y peluches. 
Ruty sueña con ampliar su negocio, comprar su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: Buy paintings and stuffed animals

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith and her family are living in Barangay Moldero, Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to a man who  works as a passenger van driver.  They have a three year old daughter named Kate. The couple is helping one another in improving their lives and for the future of their child.  

Judith manages her dry goods business located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela.  She sells different types of locally made clothes for men and women.  She wanted to buy more stocks for her business so she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 12,000.00. The said amount will assist her financial needs.  She hopes that her business will grow for them to have a better life and for them to support the education of their child and future children.  For Judith, she considered hard work and patience as some of the keys in reaching her dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing machines and to fix up a workshop

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C., 36, and her husband, Mr. Mony Chhum, 40, married in 1993 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children study at the school in the village and the others are still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver since 1990. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Sreymom is asking for the loan of US$ 350 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia ROSARIO, es natural de Calca, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de (17,15, 13) años.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella ha aperturó una pequeña tienda abarrotes en su domicilio de la calle Grau 670; la socia necesita implementar su negocio para lo cual requiere el préstamo, ella implementará su pequeño negocio para tener mayor productividad.

L a socia Rosario queda muy agradecida con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a pagar su préstamo en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosario is a native of Calca. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 children of 17, 15, and 13 years old.

She alternates her household activities with retail trade. She has opened a small general store in her home at 670 calle Grau. She needs a loan to set up her store and make it more productive.

Rosario is very grateful for your support and promises to pay back her loan within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up her general store

loans.name: Mrs. Sith Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Trapeang Lean village in TaK. province comprise this village bank loan and they will use the loan for various purpoS.. Mrs. Sith V. is a 59-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. U. Chhim, is a construction foreman. In his work, he needs some construction supplies to better his work. Thus, Mrs. Sith V. decided to ask for a loan to buy construction supplies for her husband’s work. She has six children, two are employed in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school and the last is too young to work or study. 

Fourteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband’s work.

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo S. is thirty-one years old and married with two children, both of whom go to school. She lives in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband sell rubber. Typically, they make only about $20 in revenue each day.  In light of these economic difficulties, Bo is asking for a loan to purchase rubber in bulk in order to get a special discount. This purchase can help increase her daily income.

loans.use: To buy rubber in bulk.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel P. owns and operates a business primarily providing beauty services to local community members. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Mohon, Aloran Misamis Occidental. Liezel has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Liezel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Liezel is now requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new materials needed for her beauty services. This with be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a beauty service

loans.name: Taritolay

texts.es: Taritolay se dedica a la Fruticultura (durazno, peramota, damasco, manzana y tuna). Taritolay no solo cultiva esta producción también la comercializa en diferentes localidades aledañas a donde el vive. La venta de frutas generalmente esta concentrada  en los mercados de las ciudades principales y ocasionalmente en Cochabamba. Taritolay  radica en una comunidad lejana desde hace 43 años atrás, junto a su familia el codeudor es el hermano del titular ambos trabajan juntos en la comunidad dedicándose íntegramente al chonteo y cuidado de  frutales en su comunidad. También cuenta con cuarenta años de experiencia en su actividad actualmente el negocio con el que tiene es el cultivo y la cosecha de  la variedad de frutas en el ciclo potencialmente productivo durante 6 mese s al año. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado, él tiene su propia clientela ya que por la forma de atender a sus clientes y principalmente la calidad y puntualidad en la entrega de frutas a sus clientes es la mas preferida tomando en cuenta el mercado seguro. No existe un precio fijo en las compras de  la variedad de frutas, este varía de acuerdo al ciclo productivo del año. El prestatario no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en el buro de informes confidenciales.
texts.en:
Taritolay grows fruit (peaches, pears, plums, apples and prickly pear). Taritolay not only grows this fruit but also sells it in different local villages near his home. The sale of most fruit usually takes place in the central markets of larger cities and occasionally in Cochabamba. Taritolay has lived in a remote community for forty-three years, near his family and his brother, with whom he applied for this loan.. Both men work together in the village dedicating themselves to growing palm trees for wood and caring for their fruit trees. They have forty years of experience in the maintenance and harvest of fruit.

The prime fruit growing cycle lasts six months of the year. While he has success in the farmers' market, which he attributes to the attention he gives to his customers and the quality and timeliness of the delivery of his fruit, he would like to always be dependable. The price of the fruit varies according to the time of the year.

The borrower does not have previous bad debt or bad reports with the credit bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 44 years old, married, and has two adult children. Marlene owns and operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Marlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amys Lucila

texts.es:
Con mucho empeño, como toda mujer nicaragüense la señora Amys M. labora para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Ella se dedica a la venta de tomates en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua.

Actualmente requiere de la compra de tomates para ofrecerlos en su localidad y por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos tomates y así surtir su establecimiento para venderlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Like all Nicaraguan women, Sra. Amys M. works extremely hard to support her family. She sells tomatoes at the wholesale market in the city of Managua.

She wants to buy more tomatoes to sell from her vending location. For this reason, she has approached CEPRODEL in hopes of receiving a loan. She will use the funds to buy a supply of tomatoes to restock her vending stall so she can continue selling to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Yilian Group

texts.es:
La señora Josefina G. es Viuda tiene 60 años, vive dede hace 20 años en la Colonia Santa C., la cual pertenece al Municipio de Valle de Chalco, esto en el Estado de Mexico es una zona semiurbana. La Señora Josefina emprendio una actividad, elaborando ricos buñuelos para vender casa por casa,  gracias a esta actividad le ha dado estudios a su hija que a un vive con ella y que se apoyan para los quehaceres de la casa y gastos que se tienen, como alimentación y vestido entre otros. Su necesidad es comprar la harina por bulto, para la elaboración de buñuelos ya que actualmente lo ha comprado solo por kilo, ella sabe que si lo compra por bulto le origina mayor ganancia que le ayudara para poder comprar un triciclo para poder seguir vendiendo sus buñuelos y cansarse menos,ya que asi ella no cargaria sus buñuelos, sino que tendria un medio para poder transportar sus buñuelos, asi mismo vender pan por las tardes en su casa y contar con ingresos que le ayudaran a tener una mejor calidad de vida, por esta razón se une a otros compañeros con los mismos deseos de Emprender o seguir desarrollando su actividad, por lo que se unen para solicitar un crédito a travez de Fundación Realidad A. C. El grupo se conforma por 5 integrantes. las cuales son: Monica D. que se dedica al bordado de bolsas de manta, Sarai Susana M. tiene una estetica, Mario B. vende paletas y helados y la señora Teresa C. que se dedica a la venta de nieve. 
Monto que Solicitan 14000 pesos.
texts.en:
Josefina G. lives in the semiurban zone of Santa C. colony, municipality of Valle de Chalco. She belongs to the YILIAN group, which consists of five members. Josefina lives with her son, and they support each other in covering household expenses. Not able to find permanent work, Josefina started making doughnuts to sell door to door in the mornings, and in the afternoons she sells bread outside of her home. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase a tricycle so she will be able to offer her products more comfortably. This way she can also purchase flour by the sack, which would be cheaper than buying it by the kilo, which is what she currently does, and she wouldn't get tired as much.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar harina por bulto para elaborar buñuelos, materia prima para la elaboración de helados y paletas entre otros.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia M. is from the village of Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 59 years old. Celedonia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Celedonia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas, coconuts and vegetables for sale. Celedonia is also engaged in buying scrap materials and sells them to neighboring junk shops. Celedonia has been engaged in her businesses for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Celedonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celedonia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Celedonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Bulao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Topista

texts.en: N. Topista is aged thirty-eight years old, she owns a supermarket located a long Zziriddamu street in Kalisizo town which mainly deals in house hold items like glasses, plates, cups, sauce pans and other items like bathing soap, sugar, drinks and various others on the retail basis. She is using the loan to purchase more goods purposely to increase on the supply and more so milk and yoghurt which are on high demand presently. Her future hope is to expand her business and accumulate profits which she will use to finish the construction of her house and then hopes to acquire a plot of land and construct rental houses for extra income generating.

loans.use: To purchase more goods purposely to increase on the supply and more so milk and yoghurt which are on high demand presently.

loans.name: Dobi

texts.en:
Dobi C. is currently in the business of selling various items such as: plastic plates, cups etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell. Dobi is 40 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more plates to sell in her shop

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort F. sells banku with fish and pepper sauce at a castle near Eguase.  Comfort has received a junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Comfort has been selling banku with fish and pepper sauce for quite some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and the settlement of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and fish to prepare her banku for sale. She wishes to re-invest her profit into her business.
To prepare her banku, she makes sure she gets her corn dough (maize that has been milled and left to proof) and cassava dough.
She makes a mixture with the cassava and corn dough in a porridge form, stirs it on fairly hot heat for some time to get a firm but fine texture, firm enough to be eaten.
The accompanying dish can be any kind of soup or sauce of your taste such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize and fish to prepare her banku for sale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom’s passion lies with children. A married mother of four, Dilorom opened her business selling men’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past 15 years, Dilorom has successfully operated her business at the market.

With her profits, she not only has improved the living standards for her children but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well. Dilorom has requested a loan of 7000 Somoni to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman, Dilorom plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for men

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 23-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon with her husband and one child.

Sanaa has been selling accessories for three years. She sells perfumes, beauty products, makeup, hair accessories and lots more. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop.
This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Sanaa is special in her work because of the diversity of her merchandise. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and people from her region.  Sanaa decided on doing her business because she likes working in sales but she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 47 years old and married with two children. Her husband is an agriculturist. She sells cosmetics and kitchen utensils. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Augustina is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jesus Divino Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Jesús Divino” esta representado por la señora Marioly y  conformado por 15 miembros los cuales van ingresando a su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, cada uno D. los miembros posee su propio negocio D. venta D. pan, ropa, venta y elaboración D. artesanías, verduras y a la prestación D. servicios como la también venden empanadas, otras venden ropas en el mercado como la costura, el transporte público, operador D. maquinaria pesada y el servicio D. lavado D. ropa a domicilio.
