Local residents know that she always sells high quality, fresh produce at her stall in the local market. Since she is an agronomist, she only buys high quality goods from wholsaler providers. Now she would like to increase the variety of produce at her market stall. To do that she would like to take out a loan to be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Кузина Рима жительница района Гиссар . Возраст 45 лет,незамужем. Образование высшее,по специальности агроном. Рима занимается куплей продажей овощей и фруктов.На местном рынке Гиссара имеет торговую точку,местные жители знают что у Римы всегда можно купить свежий и качественный товар.Так как Рима по специальности аграном она закупает только качественный товар у оптовых поставщиков. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей тороговой точки.Для чего хочет взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев

loans.use: Expanding product variety

loans.name: Todohoundé

texts.fr:
Née en 1972 Madame D. Todohoundé est une revendeuse de condiments très dévouée et dynamique. Elle a 3 personnes à charge aux besoins desquelles elle subvient avec son maigre revenu. 

    En vue d’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants, elle se propose d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat grâce à un crédit qu’elle sollicite. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter substantiellement son bénéfice pour répondre aux multiples besoins des membres de sa famille.

    Ce financement lui servira également de fond de roulement indispensable à la sécurisation de son revenu
texts.en:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Todohoundé D. is a dedicated and dynamic retailer of condiments. She has 3 people in her care, whose needs she meets with her meagre income.

With the goal of providing better living conditions to her children, she intends to increase her purchasing power thanks to this loan she is asking for. This will allow her to substantially increase her profit in order to respond to the multiple needs of the members of her family.

This loan will also serve as indispensible working capital to guarantee her future income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell condiments

loans.name: Matilde Jacqueline

texts.es:
La dama Matilde A. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido con mucho esfuerzo en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ha llevado el sustento a sus casa de habitación brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos pequeños.

Hoy en día, consciente de la necesidad de invertir en su negocio, busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual obtener sus productos para comercializarlos. Es de suma importancia destacar que al ser beneficiada por medio de los créditos logra suplir la pulpería de productos y además lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación en su municipio.
texts.en:
Matilde A. works with much effort in her mini-market business, which is located in her home in the city of Managua in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. Since she began her business she has be able to get ahead and has supported her home providing better living conditions for her two little ones.

Today, conscious of the need to invest in her business, she is seeking the support of Ceprodel to get a loan with which to obtain the products to sell. It is important to point out that through this loan she will be able to stock the mini-market and support her household in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat H., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Kimhoin Houn, 30, live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter studies in a local school.

Mr. Socheat has been farming since he was young. He grows many types of vegetables and rice in his farmland. His wife assists him in their farming business. He is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a water pump, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for farming.

loans.use: To purchase a pump, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for farming.

loans.name: Benita Juana

texts.es:
Benita es comerciante minorista de carne de res,tiene una tienda y un puesto de venta en la feria popular de su zona, el esposo es albañil. La pareja cubre la manutención de sus cinco hijos, vive en la Zona 16 de febrero, Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito será usado para comprar una maquina de cortar carne que le facilitara la comercialización de este producto.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado
texts.en:
Benita sells beef. She has a store and a sales counter at the local fair in her area of town. Her husband is a bricklayer. They both take care of their five children. They live in the 16 de febrero area in Rio Seco in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy a meat cutting machine that will facilitate the sale of cuts of beef.

She passed the evaluation that allowed her to apply for this loan. It's her first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a meat cutting machine

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María C. originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega labora en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende su propia pulpería que la ha venido desarrollando desde hace varios años y ha logrado salir adelante en este negocio.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización y es por este sencilla razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. comes from the city of Chinandega. She works in her home, where she takes care of her own general store, which she has carried out for some time, and she has succeeded in going forward in this business.

She has requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy her products to market. She is also hoping that her credit will be granted satisfactorily so that she can continue with the business in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Luz Marcela

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Desarrollo (“Development”) Village Bank.  Luz is 39 years old and married with three children; she lives with her mother. Luz has a store in her mother’s house, where she and her children sell dry goods, vegetables, spices and meat. She works seven days a week, and her children help her with the store.  Luz needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Luz’s dreams are to educate her children and to expand her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo. 
Luz es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Luz tiene una tienda en la casa de su mama en donde también vive, Luz vende abarrotes, verduras, especerías, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar. 
Los sueños de Luz son educar a sus hijos e incrementar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Курбонова Нигина жительница Гиссарского района. озраст 35 лет , незамужем , детей. не имеет. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует парфюмерией. Имеет хороший товарооборот , но почти вся прибыль уходит на обеспечение семьи. Она живет с родителями и семьей брата. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт помещения. Это поможет ей улучшить имидж магазина и привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nigina Q. lives in Gissar region. She is 35, single, and has no children. Nigina Q. has been in business for 12 years. She owns a perfumes store. The business brings a good profit, but almost all the money goes to provide for Nigina's family: Nigina lives with her parents and her brother's family. Nigina Q. plans to use this loan to renovate her store. This will help her to attract new customers. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Bolivianita Group

texts.es: El grupo " Bolivianita" esta conformado por 14 miembros y están representados por la señora Martha Carola y vienen cursando su primer ciclo. Entre las actividades que realizan los miembros del grupo esta el servicio público D. transporte, confección D. ropa y la venta D. productos como frutas, zapatos, abarrotes, dulces, cinturones y otro. La competencia es en la venta D. productos es alta pero las socias hacen prevalecer la antigüedad en sus puestos D. venta. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. mercadería y la compra D. herramientas D. trabajo más modernas para brindar un mejor trabajo. Entre las socias hay quienes tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios y otras que reciben su primer financiamiento pero se sienten capaces D. poder cumplir con su grupo y con la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda la oportunidad D. un financiamiento con grandes ventajas
texts.en:
The "Bolivianita" group is composed of four members. Their representative is Martha Carola. Among the activities the group performs are public transportation, clothes-making and the selling of products like fruit, shoes, groceries and more. The competition in the business of selling their products is high but the Bolivianita members have prevailed in the past with their businesses. With their loan money they hope to expand their merchandise and to buy more modern tools so they can do their jobs better. Among the members are individuals that have experience being part of solidarity groups that request loans as a group and others that are first time members. However, they all feel capable to be able to serve their groups and the Agrocapital Fondation, the organization that has given them the opportunity to receive financing with huge advantages.

(Translated by Ally of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Businesses

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
A modern wooden house located in Kompong Cham Province belongs to Mrs. C.'s family. C. is 30 years old and a mother who has given birth to two children. The children are still young and are pupils. She is married to Bun Thorn, 30, who is a taxi driver for a company.

C. currently is a domestic produce trader: She always buys produce in bulk from the farmer to store in the family home and then resell to make an income.

C. is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase potatos and green beans to sell. The loan will help C.'s family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase potatos and green beans to sell

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Yao a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de friperies, il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1998 et fait ce commerce au marché local de hedzranawoé qui constitue en même temps son lieu d’approvisionnement. Actuellement son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 ballots de friperie. Il est marié, c’est ce commerce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres charges et à ceux de sa femme.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Yao earns an income from commerce in second-hand clothing. He started in this business in 1998 and works at the local marketplace of Hedzranawoé which is also where he stocks up. Currently, since his stock of merchandise is exhausted, he’s requesting his first loan with WAGES to buy three bundles of second-hand clothing. He is married. His commerce is what enables him to support himself and his wife.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Đường
loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe  Badeya  sont toutes mariées dans des familles  monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et  4 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine  un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  onzième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de la  clientèle et augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  remboursés sans difficulté. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de savons, de fruits, de tubercules (pomme de terre et igname). 
Elles comptent acheter,  50 cartons de savons, 20 colis de fruits, 15 sacs de pomme de terre et 200 kg d’igname. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, Bamako et dans  les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Badeya ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The four women of this Badeya group are all married and come from monogamous families with an average age of 42 and on average, 4 children. They live in Médine, a neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their 11th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele and increasing their profit. All the preceding loans were reimbursed without difficulty.

They have diverse businesses, among others selling soap, fruit, root crops (potatoes and cocoyams). They intend to buy 50 cases of soap, 20 containers of fruit, 15 sacks of potatoes, and 200 kg of cocoyams. They do their buying at the big open-air market of Sikasso, in Bamako, and in the surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold for cash, retail and for credit in the big market of Sikasso town where they live, out of their homes, and door-to-door, to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 F CFA of which part will be used to help their husbands support their families and the rest will be reinvested into their businesses and used to reimburse the loan. The ambition of the women of this Badeya group is to become wholesalers in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita S. lives in a single family with her husband and one son in Tangal Lalitpur.  Her son is studying in grade 11.
Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dinesh S. are engaged in their own electronics shop. They opened their electronics shop more than five years ago. They sell electronic goods such as irons, rice-cookers, and lots of other kitchen utensils in their shop. Nowadays, the demand for these items is increasing among working women. So to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. S. is requesting Rs 20000.00 to invest in their shop.

loans.use: To buy electronic goods for her business

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Humberto G. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian
  Con dos créditos anteriores de FPV le ha hecho mejorar a su vivienda, pero le esta haciendo falta un cuarto. Tiene el proyecto de construirlo de buen material, para que la recama sea más segura y duradera. 
  El está solicitando un préstamo para la construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos de chofer de camión de carga. Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
  Cuando se realizo la visita la domicilio del solicitante el estaba en su trabajo quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Evangelina Martinez y un hijo de ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto Galvan is a father whose two adolescent sons are currently studying. With previous credits from FPV he has been able to make some home improvements, but he still needs one more room. He plans to build it using good materials so that it is safer and longer lasting. He would like a loan for this construction and he plans to repay it with his earnings as a truck-load driver. His desire is for his kids to have their own room and to live better.

When the visit to Calos' house was carried out he was working and his wife, Evangelina Martinez, and one of their sons attended to us.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room at the front of the house/Construcción de una cuarto al frente de la casa

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old. He is married with one child. He has been working as a house painter since 1990 and services the neighboring villages.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an air compressor and other equipment to expand his business after this long experience in the field.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and other equipment.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La microempresaria Vilma E. R. tiene 46 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales aun conviven con en la misma casa, tiene algunos años de estar dedicándose a la venta ambulante de productos lácteos (Queso, crema y cuajadas), productos que viaja a comprar al departamento de Chontales en donde los compra a mas bajo precio.

Con este negocio la señora E. ha podido ir dándoles los estudios  a sus hijos y manteniendo los gastos de su hogar, ya que por su nivel académico (No puede leer y escribir) le es difícil tener un trabajo que gane para sus gastos. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza con Kiva y el anterior lo cancelo en tiempo y forma. Ella manifiesta estar contenta con las personas que le han apoyado financiando su préstamo, el cual le ayudo en poder comprar mas productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando le puedan financiar para comprar los siguientes productos lácteos: 300 libras de Queso a US 1 dólar cada libra, 300 libras de  crema a US 0.60 cada libra y 100 cuajadas a US 0.70 cada libra.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Vilma E. R. is 46, is a single mom and has five kids, whom she lives with in the same house, for a few years she has worked in selling dairy (cheese, cream and milk curd), products that she travels to purchase to Chontales, where she buys them at a lower price. With this business, Mrs. E. has been able to provide for her children's studies and cover her home expenses, because of her academic level (she can't read nor write) it is difficult for her to have a job that makes enough for her expenses. This is the second loan with Kiva and the previous one was paid back on time and in full. She indicates being content with the people that have helped her finance her loan, which allowed her to purchase more product and make more profit. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase the following dairy products: 300 pounds of cheese at $1 US/pound, 300 pounds of cream at $0.60 US each and 100 creamy milk curds at $0.70 US per pound.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, cream and milk curd

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: Fusena, 23 years old and married with two children, lives in Lagos where she sells cooking pots. She has been borrowing from LAPO for a year, and the loans have boosted her business. She is now requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cooking pots to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking pots to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the village of Katipa. She is 48 years old. Josephine is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Mkunde is a member of the Ebeneza borrower group in Sakina, Arusha, she is 46 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 29,27,25 and 23 years old.

Mkunde has owned a Grocery business for 8 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mkunde second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mkunde hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Lea, Naishiye are also the  member of the same borrower group, they also requested the amount of 450,000 to each one in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en:
Mumina is married and has three children. She owns a place at the central market in Shahrituz, where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Mumina has been working in this business for 5 years. She is always seeking to grow and develop her business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Mumina is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase a wider range of goods. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase a wider range of goods for her store

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Antonieta es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Antonieta tiene dos puestos en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. pollo, carne, embutidos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Antonieta necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pollos y embutidos.
Los sueños D. Antonieta son seguir mejorando, comprar una sierra eléctrica para cortar la carne.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos y embutidos.

loans.name: Bobokhon

texts.en:
B. Bobokhon is 49 years old and the father of 4 children. His spouse is a housewife. Bobokhon owns a field for cultivating potatoes, onions, and wheat in order to earn a living. On this plantation, Bobokhon now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for cultivating his crops. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 1200 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer. Bobokhon counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente vive en Anticrético con su esposa y sus  hijos en la c/ Guaman Poma de Ayala de la  zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en el edificio San Antonio en el cual percibe un sueldo de 1722, ingresos con que  mantiene a su familia; la esposa no trabaja, es ama de casa.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de pensiones en los colegios donde  sus hijos estudian.
 
Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 y su historial de pagos refleja una conducta intachable.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente lives with his wife and children on Guaman Poma de Ayala Street in the Villa Nueva District of the city of La Paz. He works at the San Antonio Building and earns a salary of 1772 BOB, which enables him to support his family. His wife is a homemaker.

He is requesting a loan to pay for the cost of room and board at the high school his children attend.

Clemente has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and has an excellent payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for room & board at the school his children attend

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem N. is 39 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional weaver who is able to make about US$2 of profit every day, while her husband, pictured here, is a construction worker who builds houses. He typically makes US$3 a day. This couple has six children and all of them are in school. Chhem N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase silk clothes to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase silk clothes to sell

loans.name: Faafiapoto

texts.en:
Faafiapoto is 32 and married with 3 children.  She owns & operates a plantation and a vegetable garden.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Faafiapoto needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Faafiapoto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faafiapoto's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Portia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Portia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crops to sell

loans.name: Francisca Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Francisca M. M. de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia junto con sus hijos y su esposo en P.J. Botijeria Angulo Sur – Cercado de Ica su negocio queda ubicado en su mismo domicilio.
La sra se dedica a la venta de chanfaina patasca y otros desde hace mas de 10 años por motivo del terremoto ella fue operada y dejo de lado un poco su negocio que actualmente mantiene ella es apoyada por su esposo ya que dos de sus hijos son profesionales y estan en plenas practicas.
La Sra. siempre a ayudado a sus hijos les ha costeado sus estudios ya que desea que se superen cada día más.
Los esposos son bien trabajadores desean el financiamiento para poder invertir un poco mas en el negocio como es la compra de gaseosas por la Temporada de verano ya que en este tiempo estos productos tienen bastante salida y de esa manera ella obtendría una mejor ganancia que le permitirá seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca M. M. is 53 years old and lives with her children and her husband in her own home in the new settlement Botijeria Angulo Sur, located in the Cercado de Ica area. She runs her business out of this same home. For over 10 years, she has worked selling traditional South American soups such as chainfaina and patasca. When the earthquake hit, she had to have an operation, and was obliged to put her business aside for a moment, but today she once again maintains it. Her husband helps her with the business, since her 2 sons are professionals who are too busy to help with her business. Señora Franisca has always helped her children, paying for all their education, always hoping to see them achieve more every day. Señora Francisca and her husband are good workers. They hope for a loan so that they will be able to invest a little more in their business, purchasing sodas to sell in the summer, since they are very popular items during that time of year. By doing this, Señora Francisca would earn more income from her business, permitting her to continue helping her children to strive for success.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVERSION EN SU NEGOCIO

loans.name: Dania Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Dania H. R. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal es asistente del área de recursos humanos, está embarazada de su primer bebe va hacer madre soltera, es el segundo crédito que tiene con nosotros y si le han ayudado ya que con el crédito anterior hizo su cuarto independiente en la casa de sus padres con este crédito lo solicito para compra de medicamento.
texts.en:
Dania H. R. works in the Human Resources department of the Mayor's office. She is expecting her first child and will be a single mother. This is the second loan she's had with us; she used the previous loan to build a bedroom in her parents's house so she could be independent. This funding will be used to buy medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda C. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. She is 51 years old. Nelda is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Nelda owns a specialized retail store which primarily sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Nelda has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.  She previously had a business in which she made and sold processed food such as chorizo and other items.

In 2009, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Awa D.  est une aide-infirmière  au niveau de l’hôpital régional de Thiès. Elle est née en 1972 et c’est après sa formation en 1994 qu’elle a été recrutée dans cet hôpital. 
Elle est à sa troisième demande de prêt pour, dit-elle, régler des besoins personnels.Cependant, elle voudrait bénéficier d'un crédit d'urgence (produit de U-IMCEC mis en place pour faire bénéficier très rapidement un prêt inférieur ou égal à 150 000 fcfa à ses membres qui ont un revenu régulier).  Ainsi, Mademoiselle D. sollicitait 100 000 FCFA pour régler des charges d’électricité de la maison.
texts.en:
Miss Awa D. is a nurses' aide in the regional hospital of Thiès. She was born in 1972 and following her graduation in 1994, she was recruited to this hospital. She is requesting her third loan, in order to manage personal needs. She would like to receive an emergency loan (which the microfinance group U-IMCEC can offer its members with steady incomes very quickly for loans less than, or equal to 150,000 FCFA.) Therefore, Miss D. has requested a loan of 100,000 FCFA in order to pay for electricity for her home.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for electricity for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: EL SR. MARTIN NACIO  EL 3 DE ENERO DE 1955  ES COCHABANBINO,  CASADO CON DOÑA ALBERTA  CON 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA EN LA LOCALIDAD 1RO. DE MAYO A 30KM DEL TORNO, HACE 11 AÑOS QUE TIENE SU PARCELA EN ESA COMUNIDAD, TAMBIEN TIENE GANADO, Y SU ESPOSA SE ENCARGA DE LA CRIANZA DE LOS ANIMALES,  EN LA AGRICULTURA EL SIEMBRA JOCO, MAIZ, AROS, Y MANI. Y TODOS SUS PRODUCTOS LOS COMERCIALIZA EN EL  MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TABAJADORA QUE TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION, TRABAJA CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS HIJITOS QUE TAMBIEN AYUDAN EN EL RIEGO DE SUS CULTIVOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA ESTE ES UN NUEVO PRODUCTO QUE SE ESTA ANIMANDO A SEMBRAR YA QUE ES SU EPOCA DE SIEMBRA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y  KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin was born January 3, 1955 and is a native of Cochabamba (Bolivia). He is married to Alberta, and they have two school-aged children. He works in agriculture in the town of 1st of May, 30 kilometers from Torno. He has had his plot of land in this community for 11 years. He also has livestock and his wife is in charge of raising the animals. For agriculture, he sows pumpkin, corn, rice and peanuts. He markets all of his products in the Torno market.

He is a very hard-working person, that has a lot of desire to get ahead. He works with his wife and their small children who also help to water the crops. With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds for the sowing of potatoes. This is a new product that he is inspired to sow, since it is the sowing period. He is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow potatoes.

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alou Sangaré est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier N’tentou de Ouelessebougou.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente de céréales qu’il a appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
 Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de céréales auprès des producteurs à Ouelessebougou et dans ses villages environnants. Sa clientèle est composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs.Il vend en détail au comptant et souvent à crédit
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Alou Sangaré is married, 34 years old, and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in the the neighborhood of N’tentou in Ouelessebougou. Not having attended much formal schooling, very early on he began business ventures, notably the sale of grains, which he learned from his uncle. With seven years of experience, he has mastered his trade. In order to strengthen his business, he has decided to rejoin Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he had his first individual loan. He intends to use his loan to buy bags of grain from producers in Ouelessebougou and the surrounding villages. His clientele is made up of consumers and resellers. He sells smaller quantities to individuals for cash or often credit. With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 32,500 FCFA which he will use to buy a house.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various commodities for resale

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung L. N. was born in 1980 and lives with his parents. His family has a bicycle repair shop and he and his father work there. His mother is a tailor who makes gloves. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND).

Since 2009 Ung L. N. has participated in SEDA and has repaid punctually. For this loan, he wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand his bicycle repair shop.

loans.use: To expand his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She runs the Glory to God shop where she sells cereals. Her business has been running for only one year. Joyce belongs to the Mlachake group in Faulu, Kenya, and the group's members guarantee each other's loans. With her first loan of KES 20,000, Joyce plans to buy more cereals for sale.  She hopes to expand the business into wholesale in the future. She dreams of becoming the main supplier of cereals in her area in ten years. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Juan Ventura

texts.es: Juan es de 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos varones y una mujer, se dedica a la actividad de comercio compra venta de traje típico cortes y güipiles, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente 10 años de experiencia, en ASDIR solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, el crédito anterior lo pago sin problema de atraso,
texts.en:
Juan is 55 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. He earns his living by buying and selling traditional clothing, güipiles (woven ponchos) etc. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Juan is seeking a second loan with Kiva partner ASDIR, and the money will be used to increase his working capital. There were no problems with repayment of his previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra is the wife of M. R. and lives in a Pakistani city called Chichawatni. She is a very talented lady, and manages both her home and a successful sewing business which generates income to support her family. She is committed to share with her husband the financial challenges of raising their children, and also leads a loan group made up of the five people we see here. Her husband makes a living by driving a rickshaw. He has 15 years experience in this trade, and gets up early every morning to begin working at 9:00 a.m. and continues until 9:00 p.m. Bushra is applying for a loan from Asasah to repair her husband’s rickshaw and replace older parts with new ones.

loans.use: To make needed repairs to a rickshaw

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
J. is from the village of Balugo, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Daylinda raises crops, primarily from planting and harvesting corn. Daylinda has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be her third from GDMPC.  Daylinda plans to use the additional revenue to improve her general living conditions. 

--------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jabor

texts.ru: Шоймардонов Чабор проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Жена работает в колхозе. Сам Чабор занимается выращиванием риса. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеет и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Jabor S. lives in the town of Tursunzade. He is 47 years old, married and has two children. His wife works on a collective farm. On his own, Jabor grows rice. He has rich experience in this area. The loan will be used to purchase mineral fertilizers. He wants plant seeds and receive a good harvest to sell.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma R., 43, resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a tractor operator working at the local pier, and mother of two adults, already working and settled down with their own families. By the grace of God, Emma has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level, a dream for most Filipino parents like Emma as she herself was a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Emma operates a business buying various merchandise from wholesalers and selling it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Emma dreams of being able to have her own house and lot someday. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: La señora Ángela E. M. tiene la edad de 53 años , habita acompañada de su pareja de vida, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad de los cuales el mayor le ayuda en su negocio y el de en medio labora independientemente y la menor estudia la primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 7 años, ellos habitan en un humilde hogar que ha construido con mucho esfuerzo y edificado desde hace años atrás, es para su vivienda que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para enladrillar el piso de su casa e instalar portones de hierro para ofrecerle una mayor seguridad a su casa y proteger a su familia de los antisociales que amenazan con la seguridad de los habitantes del barrio donde habitan.
texts.en:
Ángela E. M. is 53. She lives with her life partner. They have 3 grown children. The eldest helps in her business, the middle child works independently and the youngest is in elementary school. Angela has sold tortillas for over 7 years. They live in a small home which they worked very hard to build and they have been working on it for several years since. She is requesting this loan for her home, for the purchase of materials to lay bricks on the floor of her home and install wooden doors to provide better security and protect her family from the antisocial elements that menace the security of the residents of her neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home remodeling

loans.name: James Kamau

texts.en:
James Kamau has been rearing chickens for six years in Riabai, one of the rural areas a few kilometers from Kiambu.  He sells the chickens to brokers who take them to Nairobi town centre, and he earns an income of Kshs. 15,000 per month. The other source of income for his family is through a transport business which is his secondary business.

James was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the KADET clients who happened to be the treasurer of a group that is already with KADET LTD. He is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase more broilers and layers. He plans to save the income he earns to buy another car for his transport business.  

James is 44 years old and married to Hellen Kanyi and they have four children aged 16, 12, seven and five years old. In future, James hopes to grow his business and taxi company. He is very hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more broilers and layers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man and the father of three school-aged children. Since 2001, he has owned a car repair shop that specializes in vehicle bodies. He has been repairing cars for the past 25 years. His business income is vital for his wife and children. He works hard to earn a good profit in order to pay school fees. Since starting his business, he has worked hard to develop it, and he has many more customers now. Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. In the future, he is planning to open a larger store where he can also sell spare car parts.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Victoria Hayde

texts.es:
La señorita Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, del distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali.  Victoria tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su  primer préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos fue de s/. 300 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar golosinas.

Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 meses.  Debido a la demanda, ha decidido vender otros productos, tiene pensado vender pollo broaster (comida al paso) para lo cual cuenta con una freidora. 

Con éste crédito de  s/. 1000 nuevos soles, comprará 6 cajas de panetones para venderlos a crédito en los asentamientos humanos de la zona, porque vio que es un negocio muy rentable en esta época de fin de año. 
Gracias a Manuela Ramos y a su esfuerzo está generando sus propios ingresos, por eso agradece la oportunidad de ser socia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" [Brave Women] in the Yarinacocha district of the department of Ucayali. At her 21 years of age, she is single, and she sells basic grocery items. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy candy.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for the past 8 months. Due to high demand, she has decided to start selling other products, and is planning to start to sell broasted chicken (fast food), for which she already has a deep fryer. 

With this loan of 1,000 new soles, she will buy six boxes of panetón [a fluffy Peruvian fruit cake] to sell on credit in populated areas, as she has seen that it is a very profitable business in this end-of-the-year season. 
Thanks to Manuela Ramos and her own efforts she is generating her own income. She appreciates the opportunity to be a member of the organization.

loans.use: To purchase fruitcake

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es: Moisés Elías tiene 32 años, el es responsable de 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra, venta y crianza de cerdos, pues siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante. El tiene más de 10 años de estar en este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar la condición económica de su familia, como padre responsable siempre le ha gustado trabajar. El financiamiento que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para los mismos ya que esta caro, por lo que tiene una buena demanda hasta los momentos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y además poder ofrecerles a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Moisés Elías, 32, has three minor children in his care.  He raises pigs because he’s always looking for ways to get ahead.

He has been in this business for over 10 years always looking for ways to improve his family’s economic condition.  As a responsible father he has always liked to work.

The loan he is asking for now is to buy pigs and feed for them because it’s currently quite expensive; to date, demand for them is good.

He dreams with improving his business and to be able to provide for all his children’s needs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Mwanambahazi

texts.en:
Mwanambahazi is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

She sells clothes, hand bags, shoes and Kikoi’s from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanambahazi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred during transportation of goods from the market to her place of operation.  She hopes to open a boutique someday.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bale of clothes, shoes, hand bags and Kikoi’s for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes, shoes, hand bags and Kikoi’s for resale.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de consultorio dental, ella trabaja junto con su esposo que atienden el consultorio dental, la socia también trabaja en una tienda que vende productos naturales, la socia quiere mejorar el consultorio dental. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el consultorio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Bernardina is 34 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her dental office where she works together with her husband.  She also works in a store that sells natural products but would like to use this loan to supply her dental office.

Bernardina is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To supply her dental office

loans.name: Luba

texts.en: Luba, a widow with two children, sells women's clothing, her only source of income, in a small store in Korolyovo town, Western Ukraine. In business for five years, her net profit is 6,000 Grivnas per month. Luba, who lives with her daughter in the house she owns, would like to borrow 14,000 Grivnas to increase her clothing assortment. She hopes to generate additional income to support her household needs.

loans.use: To increase her clothing assortment

loans.name: Paola Del Milagro

texts.es:
Paola tiene 27 años de edad. Es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de camino desde la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta al público en general artículos como prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños y diversos artículos de pasamanería. El negocio cuenta con varios años de creado y durante este tiempo ella ha podido sacarlo adelante. Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a solventar los gastos económicos familiares.

Paola desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar adelante su negocio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha vistoen la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Paola is 27 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Paola has a small establishment in her home where she sells general merchandise such as men's, women's and children's clothes, decorations and trimmings to the general public.

Paola has been in her business for several years and during this time she has been able to get ahead in life.  She uses the profits that she makes from this business to help her family cover their expenses.  Paola would like to expand her business, acquiring more merchandise so that she can expand her sales and make more profits that will allow her to make progress in her business.  In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business, acquiring more merchandise

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman who lives in Naga City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Ermesito, who is 41 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children, between the ages of 2 and 21 years old. 

Marife joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marife has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 28,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, with which she intends to buy fresh fish to sell at a market so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marife is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her fish vending.

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Neng V., born in 1973, is the group leader selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Patt Long, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice and corn. To sustain the farm, Mrs. Neng V. is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, fertilizers and pesticide to grow rice and corn. This couple works hard with the farm to support their three children: one is a farmer, one attends a local school, and the youngest is 5 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fertilizers and pesticide

loans.name: Jeanet

texts.en:
Jeanet B. is from the town of Surallah. She is 42 years old. Jeanet is married and has a 13-year-old child. To make a living, Jeanet owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas and pineapples for sale. Jeanet works hard to build her business.

Jeanet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanet has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jeanet is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling meat and frozen foods.  She lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in the meat and frozen foods business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 10,000. Salvacion is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase meat and frozen foods for her food stall.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro P. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 30 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Genaro owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Genaro has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Genaro joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Yosip; él tiene 30 años de edad, soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja con el sector turismo él es guía oficial de turismo y ya lleva unos años ejerciendo su carrera ,el es una persona bien alegre, entusiasta y se siente feliz ya que trabaja realizando la actividad que a él le gusta, el trabaja en turismo de aventura guiando Camino Inca,Choquequirao,tours Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado y City Tours, el socio desea continuar trabajando para así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra y renovación de algunos equipos de camping.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano communal bank, located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, in Cusco department.

He is Yosip, 30, single, and he has 1 son.  He has worked in tourism as an official tourist guide for some years.  Yosip is a cheerful, enthusiastic person who feels happy working in what he likes.  He is an adventure guide on the Camino Inca (Inca Trail) for Choquequirao tours, in Machupicchu, the Sacred Valley and City tours.  He wants to continue working so that he can offer his son a better quality of life.

The member is requesting a loan to buy new and repair some camping equipment.

Yosip is happy with the loan and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: To buy new and repair some camping equipment

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Phorn is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living. 

Mrs. Phorn is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice for her own family. Her husband, Mr. Bun Ly, is a construction worker and an iron welder. Since her husband’s business is going well, he wants to expand. So, Mrs. Phorn is applying for a loan to buy more iron welding machinery. 

She was born in 1983. This couple has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more iron welding machinery

loans.name: Jashon

texts.en:
Jashon K. is 32 years old and married to Eunice, who supports him in his business. He operates an M-PESA, which is a mobile money transfer operation. He works from Nairobi’s city center. His business is very busy because most people, and especially those in business, use mobile banking instead of carrying around currency. He has been in business for the last three years.

This is Jashon’s first loan with KADET, and he plans to increase his floating capital that he gets from Safari.com. He also wants to venture into the furniture business, so he plans to buy timber for making beds, chairs, etc. Jashon hopes to have his own business premises instead of renting, which will grow in expense in the future. He hopes from his returns that he will expand his businesses and give his family a better life.

loans.use: He plans to increase his float for the M-pesa business and also buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 65 años, es una mujer que lucha contra las dificultades, ella vive con su mamá y su nieta en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Hace 40 años se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como habas y arvejas; los cuales vende en el mercado central de su ciudad, ahora necesita expandirse más, ya que tiene mayores responsabilidades, pues perdió a su hija, dejándole a cargo a su nieta del cual se esfuerza para que no le falte nada, su deseo es verla como una profesional exitosa; por ello está invirtiendo en la compra de un pequeño terreno para poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y llevarlas a la capital de su país, donde las verduras tienen mayor demanda. A pesar de su avanzada edad, quiere seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, “es una diversión”, asegura. Además de dedicarse al cuidado de animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas, carnero y burros, para engordarlos para luego venderlos a los carniceros y vecinos de su localidad, que constantemente le solicitan. Ahora ella desea mantener las fuerzas para seguir adelante, ahorrar lo necesario y cuidar de su madre que está un poco enferma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde está segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su asociación que es muy unida y solidaria. Epifania, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de espinaca y zanahoria; que cuesta un promedio de S/. 120 soles cada lata, de la misma manera invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Epifania is 65 years old and is a woman who struggles against difficulties.  She lives with her mother and her granddaughter in her own home, located in the town of Palcamayo.  For 40 years, she has grown vegetables such as broad beans and peas, which she sells at her city’s central market.  Now that she has greater responsibilities, she needs to expand her business further.  After she lost her daughter, she was left in charge of her granddaughter, whom she strives to provide for so that she will not lack anything. Her desire is to see her become a successful professional.  

For this reason, she is investing in the purchase of a small field in order to be able to cultivate a large amount of vegetables and take them to the capital of her country where there is a great demand for vegetables.  Despite her advanced age, she wishes to continue devoting herself to agriculture.  “It’s a hobby”, she assures us.  In addition, she cares for small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, rams and donkeys, which she fattens and then sells to the butchers and neighbors in her town who constantly request them.  

Now she wants to maintain the strength to go forward, to save what is necessary, and care for her mother who is mildly ill.  She belongs to the Patrón San Cristóbal Communal Bank, and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is sure that she will be able to get ahead with the help of the association as they are very united and supportive.  Epifania will use the loan to purchase spinach and carrot seed, which costs an average of S/. 120 soles per can.  She will also purchase several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy cans of spinach and carrot seeds as well as bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pheakdey

texts.en:
Pictured here is Pheakdey, age 31, years old and her husband Rady, age 24. Pheakdey is a garment factory worker and her husband is a construction worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have been married for almost two years. They have no children as yet. 

Pheakdey is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a motorcycle for herself and her husband to utilize for commuting to and from work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for herself and her husband to utilize for commuting to and from work

loans.name: Syprine

texts.en:
Syprine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business; her potential customers are travelers and neighbours. In addition she also sells clothes and shoes, her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Las Fresitas De Dolores Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS FRESITAS DE DOLORES" LA SEÑORA EULALIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, SU GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 PERSONAS TODOAS ELLAS MUY DEDICADAS A SUS TRABAJOS. SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN HIDALDO EN MÉXICO. UNA DE LAS ATRACCIONES MAS IMPORTANTES QUE TIENE LA COMUNIDAD ES EL 2 DE FEBRERO DONDE SE HACE UNA FIESTA MUY GRANDE Y SE FESTEJA A LA VIRGEN DE LA CANDELARIA. LA SEÑORA EULALIA TIENE 42 AÑOS, ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, 2 HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA INTERIOR PARA DAMA, SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN ROPA INTERIOR Y COMPRAR EN MAYOREO YA QUE ASI LE ES MÁS ECONOMICA, SUS CLIENTAS LA PREFIEREN POR QUE TIENE DE TODAS LAS TALLAS, MODELOS, COLORES Y LOS PAGOS SON MUY ACCESIBLES. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA QUIERE AHORRAR PARA CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO Y APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y EN LA EDUCACIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Fresitas de Dolores".  Eulalia is the group's president.  Her group has eight members who are all very committed to their work.  The group is located in Hidalgo, Mexico.  One of the most important attractions of their community is the big fiesta which is held on the 2nd of February, when they celebrate the Virgin of Candelaria.

Eulalia is 42 years old.  She completed elementary school, is married, and has three children (two sons and one daughter).  Her business is selling ladies' underwear.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying underwear wholesale since it is cheaper.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she offers all sizes, styles and colors and her payments are very affordable.  She would like to save the profits that she makes so that she can continue investing in her business and support her husband in covering their family expenses and paying for their children's education.

loans.use: to invest in buying underwear wholesale

loans.name: Shiela Marie

texts.en:
Shiela Marie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Shiela Marie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Shiela Marie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Shiela Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She is still quite young, but she has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with her amusement shop.  She has owned and run this business for the past two years. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase sweets, hubble-bubbles (water pipes) etc. She is intent on further expanding her business and adding a small corner where customers can visit her shop not only to play but also to chill out and have a good time. She is positive about her business prospects and hopes to be able to open a new branch of her shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, hubble-bubble water pipes, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 41 years old, married to Kamau, and they have two school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last six years.  She is also building rental houses to supplement her farming income. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and materials to continue building the rental houses.

In future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area and also build more houses for rent, translating to more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and also buy materials for building rental houses.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hija, ella vende tortillas en su casa desde hace 8 meses, antes se dedico a la venta ambulante de atoles, tamales y leña, pero por el momento está en un solo lugar vendiendo las tortillas.
Ella necesita invertir un préstamo en maíz y leña, para su negocio, ya que son los insumos que a diario necesita, con esto mejorara su negocio, pues al tener suficiente materia prima puede aumentar la producción. El propósito de ella es mejorar la casa y ayudar a su hija para que estudie.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and daughter. She has sold tortillas in her house for 8 months. Previously, she sold atoles, tamales and firewood as a street vendor, but at this time, she is only selling tortillas.  

She needs to invest the loan in corn and firewood for her business, since these are the materials she needs every day. With this, she will improve her business, by having enough raw materials to increase production. Her aim is to improve her house and help her daughter go to school.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela tiene 56 años de edad, está casada con el señor florentino, tienen 2 hijos Juan y librada, quienes ya están casados y tiene su propia familia, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas como son: frijol y maíz, desde hace mas de 25 años, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio.
Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio, buscando apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a su familia, también para mejorar un poco mas su solvencia económica y asegurar su futuro, ya que son un poco mayores, el crédito que recibió decidió invertirlo en la compra de mas semillas como son: maíz, frijol y semillas de calabaza.
El deseo más grande que tiene doña Ángela para su negocio, es de incrementar su inversión, para hacer crecer rápidamente su negocio, ya que quisiera poner una bodega de compra y venta de semillas, para así mejorar e incrementar aún más sus ganancias, y apoyar a su familia.
Esta muy satisfecha por contar con el apoyo de los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a esto ahora goza de una mejor producción y surtido en el negocio, que le ayuda, para ir apoyando a su familia y continuar ahorrando algo de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ángela is 56 and is married to Florentino.  They have two children, Juan and Librada, who are already married and have their own families.  She sells seeds, such as corn and bean, which she has been doing for more than 25 years.  She started this business to help her husband and family with day-to-day expenses so as to improve their economic situation a bit and make their future more secure, especially now that they are getting older.  The money she receives will be invested in increasing her stock of seeds, such as corn, bean, and squash seeds.
