Ángela would like to increase her working capital so that her business can grow rapidly, as she would like to have a store to buy and sell seeds; this would offer her the chance to improve and increase her income even further and thus help her family.  She is very grateful for the assistance she receives from Kiva donors, which allows her to enjoy better production and to grow her business, so she can support her family and save some of her income for the future.

loans.use: to buy more corn, bean, and squash seeds for her business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa is a married man with nine children, four boys and five girls. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, he has operated a restaurant business.  His customers are neighbors and students from the neighboring school. Yawa faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business to meet his customers' demand. 

With the Kshs 15,000, he wants to purchase construction materials to renovate his restaurant. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate his restaurant.

loans.name: Burenjargal

texts.en:
Burenjargal is 25 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in a small house with her family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her spouse is self-employed. 

Burenjargal has worked at a few popular beauty salons in the city for three years.  She currently rents a small salon and supports her family by operating it. Head massages, facial treatments, and eye brow tattoos are the main services offered at her salon. Burenjargal has many customers, so she wants to expand her beauty salon in order to buy additional beautician equipment. 

Burenjargal is requesting loan for 1,300,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase beauty apparatus and necessary beautician equipment. "If I will buy these things, I have an opportunity to serve to many customers and improve my business as well," she said.

loans.use: to purchase beautician equipment.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa is 51 years old. She is married and has two children below 15 years of age. She lives in a seven bedroom apartment in Ntamulung, in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenges she has faced in her life have been the lack of capital to start up her business, sicknesses in her family, the death of some close relatives like her elder sister and her aunts and uncles, and also when thieves broke into her house and made away with some of her valuables.

She joined Kiva's partner, GHAPE, in 2005 and has received and successfully repaid empowerment credits (ECs) four times. She invested her past ECs into frying and selling gateaux and also into poultry farming. She used the profits from these past loans to cater to her family, sponsor her children in school and to support her husband in the construction of their family house.

With the requested loan, she will stock up on red oil and vegetable oil, as well as buy fowls and pigs for her poultry and piggery. She strongly believes this business will be a success because she has so many customers already. This business activity will also be of great help to the community because it will increase the availability of ready-made food to the people in her area and their distance to the market will be reduced.

With the proceeds from this loan, she will be able to provide for her family, pay her children’s school fees, and support her husband financially. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate is relatively lower and also because the monthly installment method of repayment is convenient to her.

loans.use: to buy oil, fowls and pigs

loans.name: Aurora Lucila

texts.es:
Aurora es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto con sus 2 hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Aurora cuenta con su negocio de comida la misma que a colocado en el interior del mercado de la zona donde vive, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, sus clientes son las personas que trabajan en el mismo mercado y transitan por esa zona, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio con la compra de más insumos y realizar algunos arreglos en su puesto de comida para seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que se han ido incrementando y con sus ganancias cubrirá sus gastos familiares.  Aurora con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado el respeto y la fidelidad de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante su negocio sea más grande y pueda brindarle otras oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurora is a 50 year old mother who lives in her own home with her two children. She receives water and electricity services. Aurora resides in the urban section of the District of Bambamarca, which is part of the Department of Cajamarca. This area is known for agriculture and livestock breeding.

Aurora has a food business inside of the market that is located in the area where she lives. Her customers consist of people who work at the same market and travel throughout the area. She is known for her cleanliness and the good flavor of her food. With the income she generates, Aurora is able to have a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 PEN so that she can keep her business in operation. Aurora will buy more supplies and make few repairs to her food stand so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. Her clientele has already increased, so she uses her profits to cover the family expenses.

Because of her work and her desire to succeed, Aurora has gained the respect and loyalty of her customers. In the end, she wants have a larger business in the future so that she can provide additional educational opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and to make a few repairs to her food stand.

loans.name: José Norberto

texts.es: Uno de las prioridades en un hogar es el mantener la vivienda en perfectas condiciones para que albergue a toda la familia y en especial a los pequeños del hogar. Consciente de esto, el señor José Norberto ha acudido a Ceprodel porque atraviesa el problema en el que su vivienda requiere la mejora y para ello está solicitando el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción en especial cemento y arena y de esta manera fortalecer dicha vivienda y darle una mejora completa. De esta forma beneficia tanto a su familia como a él mismo proporcionándole mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: One of a home’s main priorities is keeping the dwelling in perfect conditions to shelter the entire family, especially the little ones in the home.  Conscious of this, José Norberto has called upon Ceprodel because he’s going through a problem with his house: it needs improvement and this is why he’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies, especially cement and sand, to strengthen said dwelling and do a complete improvement.  In this way he will benefit his entire family giving them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Duo El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
DUO EL TRIUNFO
El grupo está conformado por 2  personas quien es  La señora Santa Silvia que se dedica a la venta D. productos cosméticos y venta D. ropa intima D. mujer desD. hace  siete años inicio con la ayuda D. sus cuñadas que le enseñaron a vender el producto por catalogo  a domicilio y le otorgaron una pequeña cantidad D. productos para dar inicio a la venta y con el tiempo con la ayuda D.  sus papas pudo obtener  la venta D.  ropa interior D. mujer, tiene cuatro hijos menores D. edad,  el deseo que tiene es seguir creciendo en sus ventas   para salir adelante y poder ofrecer  lo necesario para sus hijos  y tener diversidad D. productos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. cosmeticos, la señorita Ana Cristina esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
'El Triunfo' group.

This group has two members: Santa Silvia and Ana Cristina.  Santa Silvia's business is selling cosmetics and ladies' underwear.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She started her business with the help of her sisters-in-law who taught her how to sell products through a catalog from home and gave her a small quantity of products so that she could start selling.  Over time, with the help of her parents, she was able to also start selling ladies' underwear.  Santa Silvia has four dependent children.  Her wish is to continue growing her sales so that she can get ahead in life and offer her children what they need.  She would also like to have a wiD. range of products.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics.  Ana Cristina is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Dy, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. Two of her sons have full-time employment, and the other is in school. 

Savy is a weaver, and her husband is a house builder. She is asking for loan of $400 to buy weaving materials. She will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land behind her house because there are some small ponds behind her, which she needs to fill in.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and fill in the land behind her house.

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.es:
María Juliana tiene 27 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de 8,4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
María se dedica a la agricultura tiene ganados y sembríos de papas habas fréjol, tiene casa propia. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar ganados y comprar la alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cambiar la situación  económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder cambiar de ciudad donde haya más empleo.
Los desafíos a los que se a enfrentado es la falta de agua en los cultivos por la sequia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, pasar el tiempo con los hijos y visitar a los padres.
texts.en:
María Juliana is 27 years old and is a single mother with three children.  She lives with her children (ages 8, 4, and 2) in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

María is a member of the ‘Pangua’ communal bank, which is based in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu, Guanujo parish, canton of Guaranda.  The community is 15 minutes from the Cooperativa San Jose office.  Most of the members of the ‘Pangua’ group make a living from farming and raising livestock, which they supplement with other activities that allow them to earn extra income, such as retail and construction.     

María makes a living from farming.  She raises cattle and has fields where she grows potatoes and beans.  She has her own house.  She sells her produce in Guaranda.  María is asking for a loan so that she can purchase cattle and food.  With the loan’s help she will be able to improve her family’s economic situation.    

María’s dream is to be able to move to a city where there are more jobs.    

The main challenge she has faced is a lack of water for her crops due to drought. 

In María’s free time she enjoys resting, spending time with her children, and visiting her parents.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and food.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces, tiene 35 años, es dueña de una cabina de Internet y venta de juguetes, es madre de un hijo, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, ella estudio Informática y siempre tuvo el deseo de tener su propia empresa, hace 4 años ella empezó con este gran sueño, a pesar de todas las adversidades que pudo tener elle salió adelante, y Finca ayudó mucho para poder tener todo lo que logró, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener mas claras sus ideas, se pudo comprar una fotocopiadora, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares.
texts.en: Marina is a member of the “Los Sauces” (Willows) communal bank.  She’s 35 years old and owns an Internet access service; she also sells toys.  She is the mother of a son.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for four years.  She studied computer sciences and always wanted to have a business of her own.  Four years ago she began this great dream and despite all the adversities she had she was able to get ahead and Finca helped her quite a bit to attain what she has.  The training helped her to focus her ideas; she bought a photocopier and will use the present loan to buy school supplies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Evanis

texts.en:
Evanis is 52 years old. She is a widow and has four children aged between 20 and 31. Only one of her children goes to school. 
Evanis has been selling beans and sorghum for three years. She has requested this loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. With the profits she plans to build a house and make savings. In the future, she would like to buy a motorcycle, which will bring in additional income.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Hau

texts.en:
Ms Hau was born in 1992. She runs a small wood workshop making furniture for the home. She started this business two years ago. 
Hau joined the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2010, and she has used her loans to buy machines for the workshop. For this new loan, she has requested 7,194,000  Vietnam Dong (VND) to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood for her business.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 3

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 3 est   un regroupement  de 10  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe mixte de 9 femmes et un homme regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Ils  sont représentées par madame   Bernadette   qui représente la personne habillée en  rouge sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur  de la transformation et du commerce d’articles divers de femmes. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 18 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de produits divers pour femmes marchandises. Son objectif  est d’acquérir le fond nécessaire pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en: Al Ouma  liberté 1, 2, 3 (subgroup 3) is a group which consists of 10 members who have all joined the same national solidarity association.  This is a mixed group, with 9 women and 1 man who are all involved in various trades.  Bernadette is their representative, and she is the woman dressed in red in the photo.  For several years now, she has been involved in the processing and the sale of various women's products.  She has acquired  over ten years of experience in these fields.  She starts her day at 9 o'clock in the morning and returns home at about 6 o'clock in the evening.  She is requesting a loan to purchase various women's products.  Her goal is to acquire enough funding to diversify her activity.

loans.use: to buy women's products for resale.

loans.name: Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres esta por quince integrantes en el cual cada uno tiene su propio negocio y se dedica  a diferente actividades, este grupo de emprendedores, ya han trabajado con fundación león 2000 en varios ciclos durante el crédito han mostrado ser responsable y con deseos de superación sus mayores sueños es de crecer en sus negocios y cumplir sus metas propuestas. Reyna Rafaela es parte de este grupo de emprendedores y su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene ubicad en su casa de habitación, está solicitando  nuevamente financiamiento nuevamente para comprar granos básicos, aceite, verduras, jabón, detergente, pan, entre otros productos que mas solicitan.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amor de Mujeres" (Love of Women) consists of 15 members.  All of them have their own businesses in various activities.  This group of entrepreneurs has worked with Fundación León 2000 in several loan cycles and has demonstrated that they are responsible and have the drive to succeed.  Their greatest dreams are to grow their businesses and to fulfill the goals they have set for themselves.  

Reyna Rafaela is a part of this group of entrepreneurs.  She manages a store located in her home.  The new loan she is requesting will be used to purchase basic grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergents, bread, and other products that are frequently requested.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergent, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
For the past four years, Fadhila has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to local neighbours. 
With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to establish a food stall business, purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 33-year-old married women.  She is responsible for 4 children and lives in Rawalpindi.

Her husband operates a business to purchase buffalo from the market sell them at another market for a profit. Her husband is the only person who supports his family .

Ambreen wants to increase her husband's  business but due to insufficient finances, her husband can not buy additional buffalo. Ambreen applied 
for the loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC to purchase more buffaloes for her husband's business.

Ambreen is very thankful to Kiva for their kind regards.

loans.use: to buy buffalo.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Julienne est une veuve femme  avec trois enfants à charge. Pour exercer son activité, Julienne vit à Baguida et vend des bijoux et pagnes à la devanture de son domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Julienne s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des douzaines de boucle d’oreilles et des pièces de pagnes, Julienne demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et avoir un gain pour aider ses enfants à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.

loans.use: acheter 02 douzaines de boucles d'oreilles et 05 pièces de pagnes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
She is 50 years old, married, has 5 children, 2 of whom have completed secondary school and 1 has completed college and is looking for employment.. She is also the group secretary.

Susan has a dairy cow; also she is a horticultural farmer, banana farmer and grows maize and beans. From her farming she is able to generate USD 150 per month and also feed her family. She bought her dairy cow from a loan of USD 120 she got from her group and income from her farming. She intends to start a small business in Githunguri shopping centre which is quite vibrant to supplement her income from farming. She will be assisted by her son who has received some formal business training but is currently unemployed. She previously had a shop in Muhutini but closed it due to insecurity. She thus has the necessary experience to manage the business.

loans.use: Susans success in farming has pushed her to starting a small retail business near her home. This will assist her in sselling her milk and farm output.

loans.name: Najeba

texts.en:
Najeba is a 27-year old mother of 2 children. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Najeba married at the age of 22. Because of the bad situation in the country her husband faced some difficulties finding work. With the help of neighbours she took a loan and started a tailoring business at home. She had tailoring experience, but due to financial problem she couldn’t continue her business. Now she has bought a machine and fabric to improve her family income.

loans.use: To buy a new machine, fabric

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. and her husband, Narin (pictured here because S. was ill) live with their five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. is 48 years old and spends most of her time watching over their young children.  Her husband is a commune officer and makes about $1.50 per day.  Two of their children work at a nearby garment factory.  S. hopes to use this loan to open a shop at the market where she will sell clothes.  Also, the family hopes to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work and to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a stall at the market to sell clothes

loans.name: Djavanshir

texts.en:
Djavanshir  raises sheep and calves. He is 57 and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is  married, has 3 children. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy sheep and calves to improve his business and get a better income for his family

loans.use: To buy sheep and calves

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
My husband and I have been in the tailoring business for a long time now. While I make clothes for the women and children in my neighborhood, my husband takes orders from bigger houses and makes men’s clothes. Together we make a net profit of $250 per month. Last year we took out a loan of $200 to buy new sewing machines.

We are now in need of a loan to put towards the rent for a small shop on the main road so that we can process more orders. We have successfully put our older three children through school and we wish the same for the youngest who is currently in primary school.

Kaneez F., Pakistan

loans.use: To rent a shop to run a tailoring business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sitri

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sitri besides being a hosuwife also helps her husband I Wayan Lungguh as a tenant farmer. To fulfill family needs Ni Ketut Sitri raises 1 mother pig, and 3 piglets for fattening. With a capital of Rp1,500,000 (about US$165) to buy pig feed, Ni Ketut Sitri could profit Rp200,000 (about $22)/month. Ketut Sitri feed her pigs 2X/day at 8:00 AM and 4:00PM. Before feeding, she bathe her pigs first, and clean the stall. Ni Ketut Sitri lives in her home with her child who finished highschool. With this business, Ni Ketut Sitri is optimistic it would increase her living standard. Therefore she is persistent and not giving up hope. One thing she believes is that everything done well will give good final results.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sitri disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga, juga membantu suaminya I Wayan Lungguh yang bekerja sebagai petani. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya Ni Ketut Sitri memelihara 1 induk babi dan 3 ekor babi untuk penggemukan. Dengan modal Rp.1.500.000.- digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi, Ni Ketut Sitri mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- perbulan. Ketut Sitri memberi makan babinya dua kali sehari pada pagi hari jam 08:00 pagi dan pada sore hari jam 16.00 wita. Sebelum memberi makan, babinya dimandikan dulu dan kandangnya dibersihkan sampai bersih. Ni Ketut Sitri tinggal dirumahnya bersama dengan anaknya yang sudah tamat sekolah SMA. Dengan usaha yang dimilikinya sekarang, Ni Ketut Sitri optimis akan dapat meningkatkan taraf hidupnya. Oleh karena itu, usahanya ini dilakukannya dengan semangat dan tidak putus asa. Satu hal yang diyakini Ni Ketut Sitri bahwa segala sesuatu bila dilakukan dengan tekun akan mendapatkan hasil akhir yang baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed

Membeli pakan babi

loans.name: Josefa De Jesus

texts.es:
Josefa has had this business for 5 years. She invested her savings to open this business along with the inheritance that her mother left her. Before having her own business, she worked for a woman selling on a stretch of the Terminal-León market.

Little by little she has managed to provide maintenance for the infrastructure of her location. She constructed it with wood and concrete, but she still needs to finish building it. She is a single mother with 4 kids under her care. The four kids are studying in elementary school, and this fills her with happiness because she knows that thanks to her business, they will be able to get ahead.

She has had approximately 20 credits with CEPRODEL, and she is very thankful for the confidence they have in her to receive these loans, since they let her make favorable purchases and sell them at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Josefa tiene 5 años de trabajar con este negocio, invirtió sus ahorros para abrir este negocio mas la herencia que le dejó su mamá. Antes de tener negocio propio era empleada por una señora para vender en un tramo del mercado la Terminal-León.

Poco a poco ha dado mantenimiento a la infraestructura de su módulo, de no tener nada ha logrado construirlo con Madera y concreto pero le falta terminar de construirlo. Ella es madre soltera con 4 hijos a su cargo, los cuatro niños estan estudiando la primaria y esto la llena de alegria porque sabe que gracias a su negocio...ellos han logrado salir adelante.

Manejó aproximadamente 20 créditos con CEPRODEL y se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza que le han brindado para recibir estos préstamos, ya que con ellos logra hacer compras mas favorables y venderlas a un buen precio.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is 38 years old and makes and sells an Indonesian salad called “gado-gado” at her small food stall from 8 A.M. until evening. She also sells other foods like crackers, snacks, and some fruit at the stall. Her husband, A., is a laborer who earns a small income. Isah is a member of MBK and requests a loan so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little business selling convenience foods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana belongs to a communal bank and lives in Yarina Cocha in the Ucayali region of Peru. She's 35 years old and has two young children who are still dependant on her. Her husband is a logger. With her initial loan, Juana decided to invest in the purchase of clothing to resell, and she currently runs the business out of her home. She rises at 6 a.m. to work on household tasks before leaving in the afternoons to deliver her merchandise to her customers.

With the $425 loan, which she plans to repay in five months, Juana will purchase clothing for men, women and children, as well as undergarments, belts, stockings and other items.

Juana has become a hard-working woman dedicated to getting ahead for the well being of her children. She is very happy and wishes to continue moving up in life, always with thanks to God and her lenders, Kiva partner Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Paikanas, vive en el AA. HH. Violeta Correa Mz. A Lt. 18 del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la extracción de la madera. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en compra de prendas de vestir. En la actualidad ella continúa con el negocio de venta de ropas a domicilio, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para realizar las actividades del hogar para luego en las tardes salir a repartir la mercadería a sus clientes. Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,200 soles el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ropa interior, correas, medias, etc. Juana se volvió una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y deseosa de salir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, esta muy feliz y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida, siempre dando gracias a Dios y a Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 32 year old man who is engaged to be married. Haytham is in the sanitary business. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. This is the second time that Haytham has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. This time he needs to purchase merchandise for his business. The increased income generated by the loan will help him buy a bedroom for the new couple.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru:
Suhrobjon G. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 35 years old, married with 5 children. At the moment the only source of income for his family is his food sales business. He has a trading stall in the central district market. He brings his inventory over from Dushanbe and sells it for a small profit. Unfortunately he does not make enough to feed his family. Suhrobjon has thus decided to increase his sales by asking for a loan that will help him attract new clients, buy and sell more popular items, at more affordable prices as he will not have to travel to Dushanbe to buy them. He will be able to repay the loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Гурезов Сухробджон Ортикович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 35 лет , женат и имеет 5 детей. На данный момент единственным источником дохода его семьи является торговля продуктами питания. Имеет торговую точку на центральном районном рынке. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Зарабатывает не очень много. Ему не хватает денег прокормить семью , поэтому он решил увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту привлечь новых клиентов , а так же обеспечить рынок товаром пользующимся большим спросом , по доступным ценам. Так как им не придется выезжать за покупками в Душанбе.Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To Increase Sales

loans.name: Fatuma's Majindecha Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old and is married woman with 2children, ages 7 and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 16 and 9 years old. Fatuma is a clothes seller, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 18pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Linda, who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sania

texts.es:
Sania is a member of the Wiracocha Communal Bank.

Sania is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She sells a variety of clothing for adults and children. She makes her sales on credit, distributing her goods among friends, relatives and acquaintances. She purchases her merchandise in the city of Lima.

Sania needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in buying pants and tops.

Sania’s dreams are that her children become professionals, to have her own store selling lubricants, and to expand her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Sania es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha.

Sania es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Sania vende ropa variada para adultos y niños, sus ventas los realiza al crédito y reparte a amigos, familiares y conocidos, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Sania necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.

Los sueños de Sania son que sus hijas sean profesionales, tener una tienda de lubricantes y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Sania needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that would be invested in the purchase of pants and tops.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Mrs. Lor L., 33, earns money by raising pigs and by cooking and selling Cambodian cake. She can earn about $5 per day from these activities. Her husband earns around $5.80 per day growing crops. L. has two children and lives in Pong Ror Village, Siem Reap Province. 

She requests a loan of $1,000 to expand her pig-raising business by buying additional piglets to raise. This will increase her income.

loans.use: To expand pig-raising business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other goods to produce food

loans.name: Diamono Plateau 2 Group

texts.fr: Le commerce est la principale activité des populations. Les femmes s'adonnent surtout au commerce à cause du manque d'industries dans le village. Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres, d’alléger le panier de la ménagère. Il s’agit d’achat et de revente de produits halieutiques, fruits, et huile de palme venant de la région de Ziguinchor, des tissus, des pagnes, des articles de fête venant de la région de Kaolack et toute autre marchandise facile à vendre et ne se détériorant pas vite. Ce qui leur permettra de faire de bonnes  affaires durant comme les fêtes de Korité (l’Aïd el Fitr) et de Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir).
texts.en:
Retail business is the primary occupation of the people from this village. Women particularly devote themselves to retail business due to the lack of industry in the village. The objectives of this group are to improve the living conditions of its members and to lighten the load of these housewives. Their retail business consists of the purchase and resale of fishing products, fruits, palm oil from the Ziguinchor region, fabric, traditional printed cloth, holiday celebration items from the Kaolack region and other merchandise that can be easily sold and that does not deteriorate quickly. This allows them to make lots of sales during holidays like Korité (l'Aïd el Fitr) and Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir).

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of retail products

loans.name: Kruoch

texts.en: Mrs. Kruoch V. is a farmer in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to work in the field. Therefore, Mrs. Kruoch V. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer in order to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Thou Peat, owns a small store where he sells fruit in the local village. Mrs. Kruoch V. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to work in the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin S. is 23 years old and lives with her 26-year-old husband in Kampong Cham.  She is currently pregnant, but continues to work as a grocer and earns about $1 each day, while her husband works as a blacksmith and earns about $5 each day.  In order to help her husband expand his business and thereby more effectively support their family when her baby is born, Sin is requesting a loan of $1,000, which will be used to purchase more sophisticated blacksmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Fidel Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Sumaq Ayllu (“Beautiful Family” in Quechua) Village Bank.  He is 44 years old and widowed. He lives with his four children who are 25, 23, 20 and 18 years old. 

Juan buys and sells dry goods (flour, sugar, rice, etc.) and condiments.  He travels to Lima (9 hours by bus) to buy dry goods in bulk, then resells them to local distributors in a market in Ayacucho.  He also owns a stand in the same market where he sells dry goods, as well as a small store in his home where he sells condiments.  He splits his time between the two businesses.

Juan is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more bulk dry goods in Lima.  He has been working with FINCA Peru for two years now, and says his quality of life has improved since he started working with the institution.

loans.use: Buy dry goods in bulk

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa Carvajal F. es madre soltera pero que piensa en el futuro de su hijo. Ella nos comenta que su casa la fue construyendo poco a poco con ahorros, primero construyó un cuarto de madera y con el tiempo con block. Su techo era de lamina entonces se vino un aire muy fuerte que provoco que este se desprendiera y se volara ahora recurre a nosotros, pidiendo un préstamo para pagar la mano de obra ya que ella cuenta con el material para empezar a poner el techo de concreto. Para pagar al albañil solicita la cantidad de $3,000 pesos. Elsa es operadora de una maquiladora de nuestra  ciudad con estos ingreso pagara el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Elsa Carvajal F. is a single mother with her son's future in mind. She tells us that her house was built bit by bit with her savings. She built a room, first with timber and later with cement block. The roof was made of tin but it came apart in a strong wind and blew away. She's come to us now to apply for a loan to pay the labor and materials cost for a new cement roof. To pay for the work, she's asking to borrow 3,000 pesos. Elso works as an operator in a factory in our city and she will repay the loan with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New roof.

loans.name: Shelly

texts.es: Shelly tiene 20 años, vive con su madre. Gracias a su trabajo como vendedora de cosméticos por catálogo pudo independizarse  económicamente de su madre y poder a la vez, cubrir las necesidades que con su sola carrera profesional no puede cubrir, es así que desde hace 2 años vende estos productos de belleza a sus compañeras de trabajo que a diario solicitan sus perdidos a la vez que la simpatía de Shelly influye en las demás personas, las cuales se sienten muy complacidos por el cálido trato que  les brinda. Pero sin duda,  lo difícil es tratar de llegar a su record como vendedora y trata de que mes a mes sus pedidos crezcan considerablemente y lograr obtener  cuantiosas ganancias. Ella es nueva en MFP, y como tal, está muy comprometida en no fallar, por ello se muestra responsable. Shelly tiene que aprovechar los productos de oferta de los catálogos de belleza para poder revenderlos a mejores precios, para ello invertirá la suma que solicita.
texts.en:
Shelly is 20 years old and lives with her mother. Thanks to her work as a salesperson of catalog cosmetics, she has become financially independent of her mother, while at the same time is able to meet the expenses of her own professional career. In this way for the last two years, she has been selling beauty products to her co-workers. They are placing orders daily while at the same time Shelly's kindness reaches others who feel very pleased by the warm relationship which she provides. But without a doubt, the hard part is to try to reach her record as a salesperson, and month by month as her orders grow considerably, she manages to obtain substantial returns. Shelly is a new member of MFP and, as such, is very committed to succeeding so as to demonstrate how responsible she is. Shelly needs to improve the offerings of her lines of the beauty products in order to be able to re-sell them at better prices. That is how she intends to invest the sum she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de productos para aumentar su stock

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid S. lives with her husband and two children. She has borrowed money from Kiva partner XacBank on two previous occasions, once as a business loan and once to help build a home. 

She has been a reliable client who entered into a relationship with the bank 572 days ago and didn't exceed the credit term. Since 2003, she has been running a secondary raw material buying center which is located opposite the Khuchit Shonkhor market at Denjiin Myanga. 

The high school educated entrepreneur buys all types of bottles, plastic bags, and plastic containers from individuals. She sells the bottles to bottle-buying centers of appropriate factories or sometimes directly sells them to the factories. She typically will resell 5,000 to 6,000 bottles twice a month.

She makes a profit of between 20 to 50 per bottle (14,000 togrog=$1 USD). She also buys plastic containers and  plastic bags at 100-150 togrogs a kilo and sells them for 200 togrogs a kilogram, mostly to Chinese companies. She has been running this business for a long time, so she has many permanent clients and suppliers.

This photograph of Tserennadmid is taken at the recycling center. The sign over her head says in Mongolian that it will take 100 years for a single littered plastic bag to decompose.

loans.use: Buying and selling bottles and plastic bags

loans.name: Mauricio José

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio Zuniga es una persona con muchas habilidades en la elaboración de artesanías nicaragueneses el cual son elaboradas y comercializadas en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por sus clientes y en muchas ocasiones por turistas que buscan la manera de adquirir dichos productos.

Actualmente él requiere del apoyo crediticio brindado por Ceprodel y es por este motivo que ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante por medio de dichos créditos. Es importante destacar que actualmente espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará su condición de vida y la de su negocio que va en desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Mauricio Zuniga has many talents for making Nicaraguan artisan products, which he makes in and sells from his home where he is frequented by customers and often times tourists who are looking to buy these products. Today he needs a loan provided by Ceprodel and is looking for a way to be successful through acquiring a loan. It is important to note that today he confidently hopes that his loan will be granted and in this way improve his living conditions and develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making his crafts

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita M. is a 53-year-old married mother of seven. Her husband is a farmer, and five of her children are still in high school. Tita runs a 'sari sari' store, a small variety shop that sells beverages, snacks, and everyday household staples. (The photo of Tita posted with this profile shows her out in front of her shop.) She also sells vegetables from time to time.

Tita plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her store, and hopes her income will be steady enough for her to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a small retail variety store

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola trabaja en el área rural D. La Paz es pequeña agricultora y productora D. leche D. vaca y comercializa queso D. vaca el esposo trabaja con ella, es donD. proviene sus ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. sus dos pequeños hijos.

Viven en la comunidad Caluyo - Batallas D. la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. una vaca lechera D. mediana calidad y mejorar su producción D. leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
El primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Paola.
texts.en:
Paola works in the rural area of La Paz. She is a small farmer and cow milk producer and she sells cow cheese. Her husband works with her. This is how she earns her income, with which she supports her two small children. They live in the Caluyo - Batallas community in the Los Andes province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase an average quality dairy cow, to improve her milk production and to improve her income. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies the approval of the loan requested by Paola.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVESTMENT CAPITAL

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Умарчон молодой человек 26 лет. Он женат и имеет дочку и сына. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит детей и по мере возможности кормит скот. Умарчон занимается откормом и продажей скота. Начало весны для Умарчона – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что скот сейчас стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Умарчон не покупает для скота сено. Через 4 месяца городские люди начинают покупать скот. Вот тогда, Умарчон продаст свой скот. Он благодарен нам за помощь в развитии бизнеса молодой семьи.
texts.en:
Umarjon is a young man, 26 years old. He is married and has a daughter and a son. His wife does not work. She keeps the house, cares for the children, and, as much as possible, feeds the cattle. Umarjon works fattening and selling cattle. Umarjon buys cattle at the beginning of spring, since prices then are low. Additionally, fattening cattle is not expensive. The cattle eat mountain grass, so Umarjon does not buy hay for his cattle. After four months, city people will start buying cattle. Then Umarjon will sell his cattle. He is grateful to us for helping develop his young family’s business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria O. de 24 años de edad está casado hace un año con el señor Dario Flores de 25 años de edad el matrimonio no cuenta todavía con hijo.

El negocio empezó a funcionar hace un año atrás con un capital que ella pudo juntar, además le ayudo su hermana que trabaja en el mismo ramo. Ella hace 2 años que es funcionaria de la municipalidad de Caaguazú y con lo que pudo ahorrar empezó el negocio. A la mañana el negocio es manejado por el marido de Maria y ella a la tarde ya está por el negocio realizando todo tipo de trabajo como fotocopias, encuadernaciones, trabajo por computadora , además está muy bien ubicada cerca de varias escuelas, colegio y universidad.

La Señora Maria está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, junto con su marido y están próximo por culminar la carrera y el objetivo de la pareja es hacer crecer el negocio y terminar su carrera universitaria.-

Solicita este préstamos para comprar otro máquina y así cumplir con todos los pedidos
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Olmeda, 24, has been married for one year. Her husband, Dario Flores is 25. They do not have children yet. Last year she put her money together and started her business. Her sister, who works in the same field, helped. She worked for the Caagauazú municipality for 2 years. That’s how she was able to save and start her business. Her husband runs the business in the mornings, and Maria runs it in the afternoons. They do all types of work like making photo copies, bookbinding, and computer work. Also, they are well located near several schools, a high school, and a college. Maria and her husband are studying law, and they are close to finishing. Their objective is to expand their business and finish their university studies. She is asking for a loan to buy another machine to be able to complete all of the orders they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Elenor

texts.en:
Elenor T. lives in Barangay Buag Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, where she is happily married to Raymond T. and the mother of two children. Because they want to give their children a better future by enabling them to achieve college educations, this couple works hard to improve their incomes.

Elenor’s husband drives a passenger jeepney (public transportation vehicle) while Elenor maintains a computer game business and is a direct seller of NATASHA, AVON, MSE and BOARD WALK products. She is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000 for additional working capital. Elenor is grateful for the opportunity of helping her husband with their daily basic needs and the education for their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Luz R. B.  tiene 34 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Hilda se dedica a la venta de bisutería y venta de productos de belleza hace 4 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa y sale a vender al mercado.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de hilos, piedritas, herramientas.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como peluches, hilos, alambres, piedras  para implementar negocio.
Hilda tiene como sueño tener su puesto en el mercado  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda Luz R. B. is 34 and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through secondary school and has 3 children who depend on her economically. Hilda has sold imitation jewelry and beauty products for 4 years. She develops her business in her home and sells in the market. With her first credit of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza II", she invested in the purchase of thread, wire, stones, and tools. She will invest this credit of 1500 PEN in the purchase of felt, thread, wire, and stones to supply her business. Hilda's dream is to have a stand in the market to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase felt, thread, wire, and stones to supply her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old and and is married with two children. She sells provisions. She hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Molino-Juli”  que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Molino, del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Molino Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de repuestos para su taller de reparación de bicicletas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de piñones, chicharras, aros, etc. Para su taller de reparación de bicicletas.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y hacer crecer su taller.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las reuniones en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma belongs to the communal bank group “Molino-Juli”, which is located in the central town of Molino in the Juli district of Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She completed high school and lives in Molino Central.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for nearly 6 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was used to buy spare parts to repair bicycles.

At this time, she is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy nuts/bolts, bells, metal rings and other supplies for her bicycle repair shop.

Her desire is to continue working and growing her business.

She enjoys the savings and her communal bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has one child. She operates a printing business in the downtown part of Nairobi, in a thriving small-business center. The printing business is highly fragmented, comprised of both big and small players. Lucy's business involves typesetting, printing and filling ink cartridges. Most of her business comes from printing exams for private schools. Due to the increased number of schools, business is doing well, and Lucy has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy another printing machine. She would like to relocate to another part of the city, to be closer to her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase another printer

loans.name: Boldbayar

texts.en: Boldbayar M. is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. He lives with his wife, Badamtsetseg, and 3-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in his father-in-law's house. Boldbayar currently operates a transportation business in the city using a van he owns. Every day, he makes ten trips between two transportation terminals in the city. His wife works along with him, collecting fares and announcing stops as he drives. They enjoy the work, however, his wife's voice is starting to tire after years of loudly announcing route stops.  Boldbayar started his business in 2006, after obtaining a loan to purchase his van. He has found much success as a driver, however, he recently had to purchase a bus as the city government plans to enact a law forbidding the use of vans for transportation in the city. He hopes to use future profits from the business to provide his family with their own house. He is requesting a  2,000,000 tugrug (~1,380 USD) loan to purchase a new van motor and four wheels to keep his van operating efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a new motor and wheels for his van

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat T. is 20 years-old and lives with her husband and two year old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She has lived with her husband for the past four years in a comfortable ger (a Mongolian traditional felt tent) on a small tract of land they own. Her son attends a local kindergarten.

Oyun operates a cafe out of a rented room of an office building in the provincial capital city. She has much competition in the city, but feels that her hard-working nature and graceful character give her an advantage. Oyun started her cafe in 2008 with capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~105 USD). Through hard work she has established a strong customer base and stable operations. Today, her working capital exceeds 350,000 tugrugs (~246 USD). For the future, Oyun hopes to expand her business to better compete with other cafes in the city. Her and her husband are always working hard to attract customers to the cafe, and their dream is to one day build a house on their land. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs (~703 USD) loan to buy more supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy cafe supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a twenty-year-old single man. He has been working as a house painter since 2006, servicing the neighboring areas. Since becoming well-known in his town, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional tools to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools for painting business

loans.name: Orfita

texts.es: Orfita es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región Ucayali, tiene 42 años y es madre D. dos hijos menores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, tiene una tienda que funciona en su casa, su esposo es chofer D. motocarro. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” desD. hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que lo utilizará una parte para invertir en productos como abarrotes y otra parte comprara carbón al por mayor para vender. La meta D. Orfita es aumentar su negocio y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Orfita is a dynamic and collaborative member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 42 years old with two small children. She is engaged in the sale of groceries and has a small shop that she operates in her house. Her husband drives a motocarro (a three wheeled vehicle used for transport). She has been a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women”) Communal Bank for eight years.

The first loan she received was for 300 soles that she invested in soft drinks which she sold. Currently, she needs a loan of 2000 soles. She will use part of this to invest in products such as groceries and another part will purchase charcoal at wholesale in order to sell. Orfita’s goal is to increase her business and work in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest part in the purchase of groceries and another party in the purchase of charcoal at wholesale

loans.name: Aniouvi Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Aniouvi Eugénie est née le 02 Septembre 1956 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Aniouvi Eugénie vit depuis trente ans au quartier Agbokou à Porto-Novo. Mariée à CHANVOEDOU Nathaniel un éleveur,  Aniouvi Eugénie est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Aniouvi Eugénie a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire et vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, divers biscuits, bombons, ainsi que des fruits devant l’Eglise catholique Sainte Anne de Porto-Novo. Aniouvi Eugénie vend également du charbon de bois et de la boisson alcoolisée locale « sodabi ». Aniouvi Eugénie s’approvisionne au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Aniouvi Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aniouvi Eugenie A. was born on September 2, 1956 in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Aniouvi Eugenie has lived in the Agbokou district in Porto-Novo for the past 30 years. She is married to farmer named Nathaniel Chanvoedou. Aniouvi Eugenie is the mother of four children, some of whom are going to school. As a couple they both support their family. Aniouvi Eugenie stopped dropped out of high school and she has been in sales for the past 15 years, selling cookies, candy, and fruit in fron of the Catholic church Sainte Anne de Porto-Novo. Aniouvi Eugenie also sells wood coal and a popular alcoholic drink named "sodabi". Aniouvi Eugenie buys her products at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She is a long-term client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) having already benefitted from two past loans, both of which were repaid. In order to increase her working capital and to better meet the needs of her clients, Aniouvi Eugenie is requesting a third loan through Alide.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cookies and sacks of wood coal.

loans.name: Rosa Emelinda

texts.es: Rosa Emelinda C. D. Z. resiD. en colon ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Con 40 años D. edad Rosa vive con su familia que la compone sus dos hijos Edwin D. 15 años y Jenifer D. 6 años D. edad, también vive con ellos su esposo Francisco. Con las necesidades que Rosa ha visto en su hogar, han hecho ahora manejar su negocio hace apenas 3 años, donD. con muchos sacrificios y ahorros  logaron comparar productos para montar su tienda, el deseo D. Rosa es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y esto solo pueD. ser posible con tu ayuda a través D. este crédito que Rosa utilizara para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Emelinda C. D. Z. is a resident of Colon, which is located in the department of La Libertad. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband Francisco and their two children, Edwin (age 15) and Jenifer (age 6).

Three years ago, Rosa decided to start a business in order to meet her household needs. After making numerous sacrifices and saving enough capital, she was able to establish a store and has been in business now for 3 years. Rosa desires to strengthen her business, but this is only possible with the help you proviD. through a loan. She will use the funds to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Dadajon

texts.en:
N. Dadajon is a 35-year-old married man who lives with his three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in a small village in the Northern part of Tajikistan in Djabbar Rasulov region. Dadajon, together with his wife (pictured), have been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has 11 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Dadajon has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. The income is enough to cover family needs but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder. So Dadajon applied for a loan to expand his activities and to purchase more cattle. With your help, Dadajon can get ahead. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita N. is from the town of Lebueg Laoac, Pangasinan. She is 47 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Juanita runs a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income is selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be Juanita's first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the product offering in her general store.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en: Dorn U., 51, is married and lives with her two children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in a business of selling firewood. They have operated this business since 1998 and are able to earn an income of US$2.5 per day. U. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, U. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work in the town. This is her second loan from CREDIT, one of Kiva’s Field Partners. In the future, she hopes she will be able to open a souvenir shop for her children to earn an income on their own. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family, and to send her children to good schools. U. is pictured with her mother in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is fifty years old. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Mary works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family.

Mary runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Accra and nearby towns. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy provision in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Lorgia Maria

texts.es: La señora Lorgia tiene negocio de venta de artesanías en Managua, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que las clases empezaran en la primera semana de febrero el crédito le beneficia a su familia ya que así los niños van a poder ir a clases doña Lorgia es madre de cinco niños pero solamente tres estudian, desde muy temprano se prepara para ir a su cumplir su día de trabajo ya que se tiene que trasladar a la capital regresando a horas altas de la noche esto lo hace con el fin de darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos a los que ella ama mucho.
texts.en:
Lorgia has a business selling handicrafts in Managua. She will use the loan to buy school supplies for her children. Classes will start the first week in February. The loan will benefit her family because this way her children will be able to go to school. Lorgia has five children, but only three go to school. She starts to prepare for her work day very early because she has to go to the capital. She returns late at night. She does it in order to give her children, whom she loves a great deal, a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy uniforms and school supplies for her children

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es soltero, tiene 31 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el  caserío Casa Blanca del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pavos desde hace seis años. El cría los pavos en los exteriores de su casa para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona donde vive. También los vende a sus vecinos. Este negocio le provee los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su hogar.

José desea mejorar la calidad de los pavos que ofrece en venta, por ello se ha propuesto comprar alimento balanceado para aves, con el cual sus pavos tendría una mejor acogida en el mercado. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es un joven responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir creciendo como empresario para apoyar a sus padres y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Casa Blanca in the District of Mórrope, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been selling turkeys for the past six years. He raises the birds outside of his home and sells them to traders who pass through the area. In addition, he sells turkeys to his neighbors. This business has provided the income necessary to cover his personal expenses and maintain his household.

José hopes to improve the quality of the turkeys that he sells. He proposes to buy nutritional feed for his turkeys to make them more attractive when sold at the market. For this reason, he is applying for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 soles so that he can achieve his goal.

He is a responsible young man who is very devoted to his family and his work. His neighbors and acquaintances have much respect for him. José’s greatest wish to continue growing his business so that he can support his parents and provide them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional feed for his turkeys

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
Perly J. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Perly is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Perly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, such as RTW (Ready to Wear items), in the local community. Perly has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chhoum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoum L., 39, is married, but divorced her husband years ago, and she lives in Siem Reap Province. She is a farmer and earns around $3 per day. She has three young children. One of the children works in construction to provide an income. Chhoum L. has been planning to invest in a new suitable business in order to provide more money for her family. Her proposal is not possible because she has no capital to start a new business. Due to that, Chhoum L. decided to ask for assistance to begin selling roast beef.

loans.use: To begin selling roast beef.

loans.name: Lydie Baï

texts.fr: A. Lydie Baï est née le 26 Mars 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Lydie Baï vit depuis 36 ans au quartier Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Mariée à GBEDEY Mesmin, Lydie Baï a cinq enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés. Lydie Baï vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure les différentes charges familiales. Lydie Baï a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Lydie Baï prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs et de cossette d'igname) au marché de Sainte Rita. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Lydie Baï s'approvisionne. Lydie Baï sollicite pour une première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Lydie Baï A. was born on 26th March 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has lived for the past 36 years in the Sainte Rita district of Cotonou. Lydie Baï is married to Mesmin GBEDEY and has five children in her care, all of whom are at school. She lives with her children and husband. The couple share responsibility for the various family expenses. Lydie Baï left school during secondary level. In order to cover her needs, she prepares and sells food (rice, corn dough and "cossette" made from dried yam, at the market in Sainte Rita. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Lydie Baï is applying for a loan from ALIDé for the first time in order to build up her stock of products and to strengthen her activity.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, corn and yam "cossettes"

loans.name: Virila

texts.es:
La señora Virila tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Nelson Acosta Almeida quien es empleado de una empresa de telecomunicaciones que realiza armaje de antenas por el interior del pais, tienen 3 hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá, posee un copetín ubicado en su domicilio hace poco tiempo, debido a que por este año no trabajará como cantinera de una escuela de la ciudad como lo venia haciendo hace varios años atrás por que su hija quien la ayudaba en el negocio actualmente esta trabajando como empleada de una estación de servicios.
La señora Virila solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general,  también para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, panificados, harina, mandioca los cuales necesita para realizar sándwich de carne, empanadas de harina, mandioca y jamón y queso.
texts.en:
Virila, age 49, is married to Nelson Acosta Almeida. He is employed by a telecommunications company that makes antennas for the interior of the company. She has three children, two girls and a boy. They live in a well known-known neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has had a snack bar in her home for a short time. This is because this year she will not work as a food server in a school in the city as she has been doing for the past several years. The reason for this is that her daughter, who helped her in the business, is currently working as an employee in a service station. Virila is asking for a loan to buy drinks. She will also buy meat, ham, cheese, bread products, flour, and tapioca. She needs these items to make meat sandwiches, flour empanadas, tapioca, and ham and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, drinks, and other products

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia buys condemned plastic and sells to a recycling company. She does this to earn her living in Lagos. She has been in the business for the past 4 years. She is happily married and she is 38 years of age. Her husband is a transporter and they lives together. She needs the loan of NGN150, 000 to purchase more condemned plastic to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more condemned plastic to sell.

loans.name: Abdull Qayum

texts.en: Abdull Qayum son of M. Y. is 45 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives in district 8th of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a whole sales store (the materials of shoe-making) in the city of Kabul. He brings all the tools for his store from Pakistan and he is involved in this business for more then one year. He and all the family members benefit from his income. He wants to expand his business and to attract more clients, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani. He is happy that he has the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: To expand his business and to attract more clients.

loans.name: Fatouama Manda

texts.fr: Fatoumata Manda D. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SITHIANG COUNDARA depuis 2007 et 06 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide depuis plus de 03 ans, son nouveau prêt lui sera d’une grande utilité pour le renforcement de son activité et l’augmentation de son production. Elle participe à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux, par exemple le payement de la scolarité des enfants, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Manda D. is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 2007 and has been granted six successive loans. She has been manufacturing and selling peanut paste for over three years. Her new loan will prove very useful to strengthen her activity and increase her production. She participates in managing family needs, for example paying for the children’s tuition fees, healthcare and food.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Humberto Pascual

texts.es: Humberto es de 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, se dedica a la actividad de comercio venta de ropa en general tiene aproximadamente ocho años de experiencia, solicita su primer préstamo para incrementar su capital y surtir mejor su negocio, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Humberto is 58 years old, married, and has three children (two sons and a daughter). He works as a clothing merchant and has approximately eight years of experience.

Humberto is requesting his first loan to increase his capital and improve his business inventory. Her personal references indicate he is a responsible and hardworking individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hort

texts.en: Mrs. Hort P. has spent her entire life raising crops, and is widely known as a skilled farmer who does an excellent job of helping to support her family. She is married and nine children, six of whom are married and living on their own. Her husband, who we see in the photo with Hort P., frequently works in the fields beside her. Last month, Hort P. planted potato crops but they are growing slowly due to a lack of fertilizer. To solve this problem, she has applied for a loan to buy the fertilizer she needs to improve her farm's output.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer to expand her farm's output.

loans.name: Crisa

texts.en:
Crisa O. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Crisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Crisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Crisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Crisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
