About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Rosario is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia S. is a busy entrepreneur who aims to become successful someday by developing her farming business. Her husband closely works with her as a farmer. The couple works together for the hopes of their family. Amalia is thankful to ASHI for the loans they have provided since 2003. Amalia was able to maintain her farm by purchasing fertilizers, rice seeds, and other supplies. She is hoping to further improve their crop production in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI and Kiva. 

Amalia's lack of business capital encouraged her to look for financial support from KIVA lenders. She will be pleased if her loan request is granted. She l use the loan wisely by purchasing agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her crop production. Her hard work and determination are her foundation for achieving a better life. They currently live in poverty. 

In addition, the income she gets from the business is very helpful for her business and for sustaining the needs of her family, especially providing school tuition fees and allowances for her three children. Two of the children are college students and the youngest is in high school. She hopes that someday,she can expand her farming business. Amalia is glad for the secured chance of taking this loan and for your support and inspiration. 

Amalia's biggest dream is to have rice production someday. Amalia hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable farming business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the maintenance of her crop production.

loans.name: Nurzhan

texts.en:
Nurzhan O. is 40 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works as an electrician and supports Nurzhan with the household. 
In 1995, Nurzhan began to engage in stock-breeding using her 5,000 KGSsavings and bought only her first calf. Also, she decided to engage in cultivating land with potatoes. 

Nurzhan is a real hard-working woman and is striving to provide her children with a better life leaded to success.  Today she has two milk cows,  two calves and a small barn for her cattle, whose milk she sells to her customers at the local market,.  

Nurzhan will use this loan of 35,000 KGS to further broaden her business by buying one more cow. She expects for increasing the sales of milk and also to acquire new customers. With the revenues, she plans to provide a good education to her children. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: C1196 Tuvemubukene Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married. She is the leader of this group called Tuvemubukene that is well-known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as sorghum, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Jacqueline and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional goods such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to the extent that they can even start wholesaling to the retailers in their area.

If successful, they will keep reinvesting for better financial stability and continue providing the basic needs of their families.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old, married and has four children. Her eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is only 3 months. She is a farmer and raises pigs for a living. She sells her pigs at the market. She also plants and harvests rice crops. She says part of her harvest is used for family consumption and the rest is sold in her community.

Milagrosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Milagrosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Milagrosa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Las estrellas",  y se integra de tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad, se ubica en la localidad de "La Ribera Vista Hermosa", Municipio de Copaínala, Estado de Chiapas México, la razón del nombre es porque son tres personas y cada una de ellas tiene una gran estrella.
    
  Alba Arévalo A. es casada con el señor Carlos Pérez Juárez, ellos tienen cinco hijos, dos ya están casados y tres siguen a su responsabilidad y son: Cintia verónica  estudia en la telesecundaria, Carla Rafaela que estudia la primaria y la más pequeña es Alexia Roxana de tres años de edad.
     
   Alba se dedica a su hogar, y tiene un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropas, hace pocos meses que inicio éste negocio y solicita su préstamos para surtirse, cometa que la va bien con esta actividad ya que de eso ha tenido ingresos para su hogar.
    
 Se inspiro en esta actividad por una prima cercana que la animó a vender ropas ya que es un trabajo donde se obtiene buenas ganancias y con ello podrá ganar su propio dinero, apoyar con los gastos que tiene del diario en su hogar y así apoya a su esposo que a diario trabaja en el campo.
   
 Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo ahorra para que cuando vaya a resurtirse tenga suficiente dinero y pueda comprar más cosas y de mejor calidad para su clientela. De ésta manera los clientes comprarán con mas gusto y sus ingresos serán mayores.
   
   El sueño que tiene es tener una tienda de ropas en donde pueda vender su mercancía y también desea ahorrar para darle lo mejor a sus hijas que están estudian y con el apoyo de su esposo construir una casa donde vivan mejor.
  
   Alba formó un grupo para pedir un préstamo a FRAC, lo formó con su nuera que esta de blusa morada quien acaba de tener un bebé y con su vecina. Habló con ellas y todas pensaron que era un buen apoyo para que ellas continuaran trabajando y pudieran obtener ganancias mientras pagan el crédito.
   
   Las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:

   María Candelaria Pérez A.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: maseca, chile ancho, carne, entre otros, para le elaboración de antojitos.

   María Emma Pérez Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos para matanza y venta por kilo.(destazados).

  Alba Arévalo A.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y  venta de ropas como son: pantalones, camisas, playeras, faldas blusas entre otros para venderlo en la misma región.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Estrellas" (The Stars), and it is made up of 3 women who each have a different kind of business.  This group resides in the locality of Ribera Vista in the beautiful municipality of Copaínala, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  

The reason for the name of their group is that their group contains 3 women, and each one of them is a great star. 

Alba Arévalo A. is married to Carlos Pérez Juárez; they have 5 children: 2 of whom are married, and 3 of whom are still dependent children.  These 3 are: Cintia Verónica, who is in a distance education program for secondary school, Carla Rafaela, who is in elementary school, and  Alexia Roxana, the youngest, who is 3 years old.

Alba is a housewife who also has a small clothing business.  It has only been a few months since she started this business, and she requests a loan to stock the business with merchandise.  She comments that the business is going well, as it allows her to have some income for the household.  

She was inspired to start this activity by a cousin who lives nearby who motivated her to sell clothing, since it is a business where one can obtain good earnings.  With this business she will be able to earn her own money and pay for some of the daily household expenses and in this way support her husband, who works daily in agriculture.  

She will save some of the profits from her business to restock it with more merchandise and merchandise that is of better quality for her customers.  This way her customers will buy with greater enthusiasm and her income will be higher.

Her dream is to have a clothing store where she can sell her merchandise.  In addition, she wants to save so that she can provide the best for her daughters who are still in school and, with the support of her husband, build a house where they can live better.

She formed this group with her daughter-in-law, who is in the purple blouse and recently had a baby, and a neighbor.  They found out about FRAC, and it seemed to them to be a source of support where they could work on their activities and obtain earnings while paying back the loans.  The members of this group are the following: María Candelaria Pérez A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients such as corn flour, ancho chiles, meat and other items to make snacks; María Candelaria Pérez A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of broilers to slaughter, season and sell; and Alba Arévalo A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to sell such as: pants, shirts, T-shirts, skirts, blouses, and other items to sell in the same region.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as: pants, blouses, dresses, skirts and other items

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos para comercializarlos cuando estos ya están gorditos; ella vive con su esposo únicamente porque su única hija D. 30 años D. edad, está casada y tiene su propia casa.
Este negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia, observando cómo sus vecinos que se dedican al mismo oficio lo realizaban y D. esta manera lo decidió empezar ella, trabaja junto a su esposo y no tienen horario D. trabajo; Ella quiere comprar más cerdos y para realizar la inversión solicita un préstamo que le dé la oportunidad D. adquirir cerdos pequeños y comenzar el proceso D. crecerlos y engordarlos para luego comercializarlos, con esta inversión ella espera que todo el proceso D. crecimiento sea favorable y al momento D. venderlos puedan retribuir el gasto que realizara en ello.
Ella sueña con ampliar su granja, realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo y generar los suficientes ingresos para poder algún día construir una vivienda más apropiada para compartirla con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María is 50 years old.  She lives in Santa Elena in Usulután department.  She works raising pigs to fatten and sell.  She only lives with her husband because her daughter is 30 years old, married and has her own home.

This business was started on her own initiative.  She saw how her neighbors who had the same business carried it out and decided to start herself.  She works together with her husband and they don't have fixed working hours.  She would like to buy more pigs and in order to do this she is requesting a loan which will allow her to acquire some young pigs and begin the process of fattening them so that she can sell them later on.  With this investment she hopes that the whole growth process will be favorable and that when she comes to sell her pigs the money she makes will cover the expense she has incurred.  She dreams of expanding her farm, making a good investment with her loan and making sufficient income to be able to some day build a more suitable home to share with her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He longs to see his wife and children having all their basic needs met, such as food, shelter and security. 

He owns a video library and has been in the business for ten years, starting as an employee and then starting his own business. However, his business faces financial challenges. Richard needs the loan to buy current videos to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: Buying current videos to meet the demands of his customers

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
Hostensia S. is a single mother with five children. Faced with the challenges of being a single mother, she finds it difficult to take care of her children,  especially sponsoring their education. In addition she sustained a serious accident which had put her in abject poverty. 

Faced with her low level of education she could not secure a good job for herself, thus she embarked on farming.  Unfortunately for her, she did not knows what farming methods to use to improve on her output.  Becoming a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate to have acquired some farming knowledge which has helped her improve on her farming techniques.

She has proven successful with her previous loans, which she had repaid with the progress she made buying and selling shoes. Given a new loan, she plans to invest it in farming and the selling of shoes.

Her activities will help her community in that she will be able to supply the market with basic foodstuffs.  She will also provide the community with footware. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming, and shoes to resell

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Santa Martha.

En este lindo lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, el menor de ellos tiene 13 años  y estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja de forma ocasional cuando hay trabajo. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en Montecristi.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años, se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer aunque también cose camisas para caballeros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Además de esto también tiene un negocio de venta de productos de plástico.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales para la costura y productos de plástico. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un local donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Santa Martha Communal Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as a type of straw hats that are known both around Ecuador and abroad.

This beautiful place is where we find Ms. Rosa, who is 43 years old.  She is married and has three children from her marriage.  Two of her children are grown up and independent, while the youngest is 13 years old and studying in secondary school.  Her husband works sporadically when there is work available.  She has been learning dressmaking in Montecristi for several years.

She has a small sewing workshop where, for several years, she has been making all types of clothing.  She works by taking orders from individuals.  Her favorite thing to make is women's clothing, although she also sews men's shirts.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. and sometimes later.  Along with sewing, she also has a business selling plastic goods.

She is requesting this new loan to buy sewing materials and plastic products.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to have a store where she can sell her plastic products.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc., as well as plastic products

loans.name: Ubando

texts.es:
Ubando es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente  frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como agricultor en un pequeño terreno de cultivo de su propiedad. Usualmente siembra limón y arroz. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, el cría estos animales en algunos corrales que se encuentran ubicados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado del distrito. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se hace cargo de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Ubando desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos aplicándoles algunos fertilizantes y riegos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ubando is a family man, he is 39 years old and he lives together with his wife and their three children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a temperate region that is a major producer of fruits such as mangos, lemons, and passion fruit. It is within the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. 

He works as an agriculturist on a small plot of land on his property. Usually he cultivates lemons and rice. In addition he also raises foul. He raises his livestock in small corrals located near his home. When the livestock has reached a certain level in their development he sells them in the market of his district. With the income that he earns from these businesses he is able to provide for his family.

Ubando wishes to provide some attention to his plantations by applying fertilizers and watering them. In order to meet his objective he has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 600 nuevos soles. This loan will let him reach his goals.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor D. is from the village of Alanib, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, breads, biscuits & toothpaste. Amor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & breads. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia T. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Pacencia is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Pacencia owns & operates a business selling fish in the local community. Pacencia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pacencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pacencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Mrs. Delia U. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Delia is married to Pepito U. and has two school-age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a direct sales business, particularly beauty products. She’s been engaged in this kind business for 5 years already and earns approximately Php 13,000 a month from this business activity. 

In 2007, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 15,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP as her 7th loan, which will be used to purchase additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially for her basic needs, savings, insurance and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naimodu Ene

texts.en:
Naimodu has practised wheat farming in Narok town for the last five years. She is 24 years old, married, and a mother of two children who are schooling.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan which she is planning to use to buy fertilizer and wheat seeds for planting. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Naimodu repaid the previous loans well and in good time.

Naimodu's dream is to educate her children to university level and expand her farming venture. She is an assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her goals if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat remain

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda B. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Esmeralda is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from serving & selling specialty food products like inun-on nga isda & bulalo in the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables like ginger & spring onions. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esmeralda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like beef & spices. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esmeralda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like beef & spices

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Jesus Elvira, forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Triunfadoras" desde hace casi dos años. Tiene una hijita de meses quiene es el motor y motivo de superación, por ella se esfuerza muchísimo en desempeñar lo mejor posible su trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la confección y estampado de polos, inició con una maquina de coser preparando pequeñas cantidades para ofrecerlo a la venta,hoy en día ella puede colocar sus prendas en centros comerciales de mucha concurrencia aumentando ahora el servicio de estampado, lo cual le genera un poco mas de ingresos.
Con el prestamo solicitado compró los materiales necesarios para iniciar su trabajo de estampado de polos.
texts.en:
Jesus Elvira has been a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Triumphant Women) group for almost two years.  She has a young daughter, who is only months old, who is the driving force and motivation behind her desire to get ahead.   For her daughter's sake, she works very hard indeed to carry out her work as well as she can.  Her business is making clothes and printing polo shirts.  She started out with a sewing machine, making small quantities to offer for sale.  She is now able to place her garments in very busy shopping centers.  Jesus is increasing her shirt printing service which makes her a little more money. 

Jesus used the loan she requested to buy the materials she needed to start work printing polo shirts.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed to make and print polo shirts

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en: Jenifa A. is 40 years old.  She is married to a farmer, and the couple have five children, three of whom are in school.  She is currently in the business of selling fruits & vegetables.  Her future goal is to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to stock more fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Joseph Gitau

texts.en:
Joseph N. is a 23-year-old single businessman who supports his parents, and brothers and sisters still in school. He has been running his business for about two years with an income of approximately 9,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member, and he wants to use it to buy a piece of land with his group members. He hopes to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land as a group.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 1 sont toutes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans,  en moyenne  6 enfants et vivant avec leurs maries et leurs enfants dans de familles traditionnelles à N'gona, un des villages situé à environ 40 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc et dont les  ventes  constituent une activité rentable dans la zone.
SALIMATA compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women belonging to this group, BENKADI 1, are all married with an average age of 36 and on average, six children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional families in N'gona, a village situated about 40 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 

These clients are on their fifth rural loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy their average needs for agricultural supplies and intrants. Their prior loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women are involved in growing maize, rice, peanuts, okra, etc., crops which can be sold profitably in their area.

SALIMATA is planning to buy one sack of urea (fertilizer), while using the remainder of the loan for plowing costs and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 15,000 F CFA which will be used for everyday family expenditures.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay plowing costs.

loans.name: Carol Nokuthula's Group

texts.en:
Carol is 35 years old and married with 2 children who are 4 and 18 years of age. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for 3 years selling juice, making dresses and selling them and does hiring. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is transport when she has to do orders.

Carol requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy juice and fabric materials for hiring. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her children get a better education. In future, she would like to see her business grow and end up doing a tent-hiring business.

loans.use: to buy juice and fabric material for hiring

loans.name: Helmer

texts.en: Helmer lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras, where he has operated a small convenience shop for the last 10 years. His business has enjoyed modest success over the years due to its strategic location in an area with high foot traffic. Helmer is requesting a loan of Lps.15,000 with which to buy merchandise for his store. He is very grateful to Prisma for their support and hopes to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four adult-aged children.

She is a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture in planting and harvesting. She plants and harvests rice to make a living. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years, which is the only means of her subsistence. Every quarter, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP (~$712) from these activities.

Zenaida has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to gain more income and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of weeding.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl, age 30, is a member of this group.  She is a resident of Tokmok, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).  In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, she cultivates strawberries and then sells it on the market.  In this way she earns 10,000 soms per month.  This profit made it possible to purchase a vehicle and improve her living conditions.  She applied for the loan because she needs money to hire labor for collecting the harvest.  In the future Janyl dreams to purchase her own apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to hire labor for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old, married to Jane, and they have two school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last eleven years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fauto

texts.es:
el sr. Fauto esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, su familia y el viven en el Coroso, namasigue. Fauto se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su esposa cuando el no esta en la casa, sus clientes son los vecinos de la comunidad y otras personas que viven cerca a ese caserio.
el credito lo invertira en compra de abarroteria.
Fauto tiene planes de llegar a tener un mini super en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sr. Fauto is married and has three children. He and his family live in Coroso, Namasigue. Fauto sells popular consumer products and has a store located in his home. His wife helps out whenever he is not around. His customers include neighbors from the community and other people who live near his village.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of grocery products. Fauto has plans to open a mini-supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial tiene 39 años, es soltero; tiene su casa que es propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Marcial comenta que cuando era niño perdió a sus padres, por lo que tuvo que trabajar en las calles poniéndole frente a todo peligro que le pueda ocurrir. Como hijo mayor, tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus dos menores hermanos, ya que uno de ellos apenas tenía 5 años y requería de mucho cuidado. Fue de esta menera que marcial se sacrificaba la vida siendo un niño, tuvo que olvidarse de los  juegos con sus amigos y hacerse hombre a temprana edad. Ahora tiene un bar recreo al que le dedica todo su tiempo, sus dos hermanos llegaron a ser profesionales, son ahora ellos que están al pendiente de marcial que fue como un padre y madre para ellos. Marcial esta contento con el negocio que realiza, pues tiene buenos ingresos económicos, el único inconveniente que tiene es que a veces se queda atendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles amueblara su local.
texts.en:
Marcial is 39 years old, single, and has his own house in the district of Pichari. Marcial says that when he was a boy he lost his parents, which caused him to work in the streets putting him in the face of possible danger. As the eldest child, he had to take care of the two younger siblings, one of which was hardly 5 years old and required a lot of care. It was in this way that Marcial sacrificed his life being a child, forgetting playing games with his friends and becoming a man at an early age. 

Now he has a recreational bar where he works all the time, and his two siblings have become professionals, and now they watch over Marcial because he was a father and mother to them.

Marcial is happy with his business, has a good financial income, and the only drawback is that sometimes he has to take care of business late into the night. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time. With a loan of 1500 nuevos soles ($575.00) he will furnish his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his recreational bar

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 50 years old, married and mother of six children aged between 25 and 14 years old. Rahab sells charcoal in Mariakani. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This is her fourth loan with KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. With this loan she plans to purchase more bags of charcoal. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Amina est une femme âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto et revendeur de céréales. Elle a 06 enfants. 
Amina travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 1993. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Anié et Sotouboua. Sa fille l’aide dans la vente des ignames.
Amina a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, he also sells cereals. Amina has 6 children. 

Since 1993, Amina has worked as a seller of yams. She sells to customers at a local market, and buys her products in Anié and Sotouboua. Her daughter helps her with sales. Anima is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy yams. She wants to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 45 years old and married to Margaret. He is a father to six children aged between 14 and 3 years. He runs a business producing and then selling charcoal. He has been in business for 11 years and right now his monthly income from the business is KSHS 80,000. 

He is borrowing a loan of KSHS 25,000, which he intends to use to buy more trees for charcoal production. This is his first loan and his dreams and hopes are to continue with his charcoal business and to build rental houses on his small piece of land as well as educate his children.

loans.use: To buy one acre of trees to burn to produce charcoal

loans.name: Lucerito

texts.es: Lucerito tiene 27 años, es una mujer alegre y honesta, es soltera y vive a lado de sus padres a quienes apoya y ayuda en todo lo que necesiten. El trabajo de Lucerito consiste en la venta de golosinas, pues tiene un pequeño kiosco en su casa, es de regular tamaño y le genera buenos ingresos, lleva haciendo este trabajo ya por ocho años y sabe bien las temporadas altas y bajas, por eso hay meses que ella realiza otro tipo de trabajo. Entonces es su madre quien esta a cargo del negocio, mientras tiene ella que realizar otros trabajos. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio y tener una bodega, ya que hace mucha falta en su barrio. Además tiene como meta llegar a tener una fuente de soda y vender todo tipo de bebidas. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda continuar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más golosinas para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucerito, 27, is a cheerful, honest woman.  She’s single and lives with her parents who she supports and helps with whatever they need.  Lucerito’s work consists in selling snacks because she has a small kiosk at home.  It’s of regular size and generates good income.  She’s been in this business for 8 years now and she knows when her high and her low seasons are.  Because of this, there are months when she does a different kind of work and while she has to do this, her mother tends to the kiosk.  Her plan for the future is to expand the business into a store because it’s much needed in her neighborhood.  Besides, she also has the goal of opening a soda fountain and sell all types of beverages.

This will be the fourth MFP loan so she’s hoping for support from each of you to be able to continue with her plans.  She will use the amount requested to buy more snacks to have more variety available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more snacks.

loans.name: Mkulima Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mkulima SHG Group in Western Kenya! Erick is the facilitator of the Mkulima SHG group. Members of this group joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and 2010 and will re-enroll again in the 2012 program.

Erick is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed the family, to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Erick had a very good maize yield harvesting 25 bags on 1 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Erick was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Erick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Erick will save for future use and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Mkulima SHG group will each plant between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

He is pictured with the group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season
